story:
Greetings, I'm Lori and the superhero in the photo is my Fiance, Mike. We are scheduled to wed in Las Vegas, NV on July 29th 2013. Mike and I are the biggest nerds you will find, enjoying every opportunity to geek out, and our wedding is no exception. Growing up, I always joked about having a Star Trek wedding in vegas with my grandma. When she passed away almost 2 years ago, so I made it my goal to keep my word.

Mike proposed to me on Thanksgiving this last november, and I couldnt say yes fast enough. he has been my super hero for over 3 years. I love him dearly and knew he was my Superman.

If only the world was complete, we would ride off into the sunset on lovely new hover boards... I was laid off a year ago, and just began working a little more than a month ago. I have been working as hard as I can making home made geek crafts and selling them at shows, but that money doesnt go as far as we need it to. Mike works very hard, but hours at work fluctuate alot, and during the school symester 4 days a week working on his second degree for film production.

We have been lucky to order my Star Trek dress and Mike's Colonial Marine Uniform, as well as a little Mini Star fleet dress for my little one. We are now focusing on Airline Tickets, and hotel Accomadations, final touches, and regular vacation budgeting.

We are doing this wedding without turning to ANY family for financial assistance. Instead I am hoping to work for the additional money. Even though I returned to the work force, I still run an online store, and I hope you can visit my shop! sillyrabbitcrafts.etsy.com

I have also set up Contribution Perks on here as well. (All donation perks will be sent out by July 10th, any shop orders will be shipped out as fast as they can be filled)

With the donations from Indiegogo, it will go towards hotel stay, the rest of the wedding fee, food and activities for the newly wed couple and my Daughter. Anything you can contribute(or any orders through the my online store) will be so greatly appreciated. (Donations for $5 perk for Lani: Lani will receive full amount up to $5, the remaining goes towards any further expenses)

 

 

 

(Bracelets photo coming soon)

story:
Featured by:

 

"...the only trivet you’ll ever need." (Design Milk / USA)

 

" It looks, dare I say it, slightly magical in the way it changes shape." (Katie Hagar, Editor-in-Chief of BLTD / USA)

 

"Simple, Unusual, Fun, and Useful. Dewa Bleisinger has managed to capture all of those traits in his creation, the Quad Trivet. " (Crnchy / USA)

 

"Not only does the Quad Trivet get the job done, it does so in style." (Trendhunter / Canada)

 

"...das Kultobjekt in spe..." (Nachhaltig Leben / Germany)

 

 

Hi, my name is Dewa Bleisinger and I´m a product designer from Berlin, Germany. By backing this product you´ll help me get it into production.

A short summary for my German-speaking followers:

Diese Kampagne dient dazu, Vorbestellungen für mein Produkt QUAD entgegenzunehmen, um einen Teil der Produktionskosten vorab decken zu können. Dadurch ermöglicht ihr mir, mein Produkt unabhängig von etablierten Herstellern nach meinen Vorstellungen von nachhaltiger und fairer Produktion umzusetzen. Die Preise können nur in einer Währung angegeben werden, daher steht hier alles in US Dollar. Wenn ihr Fragen zum Produkt oder zur Produktion habt, könnt ihr mich gerne anschreiben oder sie im Kommentarbereich hinterlassen. Ich freue mich schon darauf, dieses tolle Produkt endlich umsetzen zu können!

QUAD is not just a trivet. It´s a beautiful and exciting design object. Its practical, but not just reduced to its function. It´s captivating, inspiring and will put a smile on your lips.

I have been working on this product for the last few months finalizing the materials, details, manufacturers, packaging. I`ve even produced a small hand-made batch which I sent out to my family, friends and retailers....and they love it!

Now I´m ready to get it produced in a larger scale so more people can enjoy this wonderful product.

This product will be made using local wood from Germany with the help of local manufacturers as well as my own studio in order to provide high quality and sustainability.

 

What is the QUAD good for?

 

 

 

QUAD unfolds from a 12 x 12cm (4.72″ x 4.72″ ) square up to a Ø 25cm (9.84″ ) circle...

 

Discover the seemingly endless array of patterns you can create

 

The QUAD Trivet

QUAD consists of 16 wooden cubes – oiled walnut or maple - connected by a silicone ribbon inserted in the underside of the cubes. The silicone ribbon is flexible, yet durable and heat-resistant. This structures allows various configurations ranging from a compact square to a widespread circular shape.

There are multitudinous variations ranging from basic geometries to more chaotic and decorative shapes.

materials: walnut or maple wood from Germany (oiled), silicone ribbon, felt pads
dimensions: 12 x 12 x 3cm (basic square) unfolds up to Ø 25 x 3cm (circular)

 

 

DEWADESIGN

In a world of mass products and big retail chains, trying to establish a label for useful and innovative design products is challenging.

I have had a lot of positive response so far and realized in order to make my work sustainable I need to reach the end customers, the design enthusiasts, people who are looking for individual and innovative products - and not necessarily the big retailers.

By pre-ordering the QUAD trivet you are backing the first production run and helping establish my brand as a maker of innovative and exciting design products.

 

 

 

 

Felt pads on the underside of the cubes protect table surfaces from being scratched

 

 

Will be available in oiled walnut and maple wood

 

 

Production + Shipping

The QUAD Trivet is a simple product, which keeps the manufacturing clear and manageable. However, it isn´t so easy to manufacture it in higher quantities and offer it for an affordable price. Until now I can only buy small quantites of wood and do each step by hand. To offer this product for a more affordable price I need to invest in larger quantites of wood and outsource some of the manufacturing steps. The main supplier and manufacturer will be my trusted local wood workshop in Germany, which supplied the wood for the first prototypes. The final manufacturing steps and packaging will be done in my studio in Berlin, Germany.

I have tried to design this product as sustainable as possible using mainly natural materials such as wood and felt from local production. Also, I use solvent-free linseed oil for the wood coating and solvent-free adhesives. The flexible silicone ribbon is durable, long-lasting and heat-resistant.

After the campaign ends I will immediately go into production. Since this product is also producible in small quantities I can ensure each backer will recieve his backing order even if the backing goal is not reached. As a professional product designer a high quality of execution is my top priority. 4-6 weeks after the campaign ends the first shipment of QUADs will be sent out.

 

Perks

Perks are a pre-order of the QUAD Trivet or of other dewadesign goodies which will fund the production run of QUAD. Please note that shipping costs must be added to the Perk prices and that I am shipping from Germany.

Perks sind Vorbestellungen des QUADs, um die Produktion zu finanzieren. Nach Ablauf der Kampagne wird das Produkt - also der Perk - hergestellt und an euch verschickt.
story_txt:
Featured by:
 

"...the only trivet you’ll ever need." (Design Milk / USA)
 

" It looks, dare I say it, slightly magical in the way it changes shape." (Katie Hagar, Editor-in-Chief of BLTD / USA)
 

"Simple, Unusual, Fun, and Useful. Dewa Bleisinger has managed to capture all of those traits in his creation, the Quad Trivet. " (Crnchy / USA)
 

"Not only does the Quad Trivet get the job done, it does so in style." (Trendhunter / Canada)
 

"...das Kultobjekt in spe..." (Nachhaltig Leben / Germany)
 
 
Hi, my name is Dewa Bleisinger and I´m a product designer from Berlin, Germany. By backing this product you´ll help me get it into production.
A short summary for my German-speaking followers:
Diese Kampagne dient dazu, Vorbestellungen für mein Produkt QUAD entgegenzunehmen, um einen Teil der Produktionskosten vorab decken zu können. Dadurch ermöglicht ihr mir, mein Produkt unabhängig von etablierten Herstellern nach meinen Vorstellungen von nachhaltiger und fairer Produktion umzusetzen. Die Preise können nur in einer Währung angegeben werden, daher steht hier alles in US Dollar. Wenn ihr Fragen zum Produkt oder zur Produktion habt, könnt ihr mich gerne anschreiben oder sie im Kommentarbereich hinterlassen. Ich freue mich schon darauf, dieses tolle Produkt endlich umsetzen zu können! 
QUAD is not just a trivet. It´s a beautiful and exciting design object. Its practical, but not just reduced to its function. It´s captivating, inspiring and will put a smile on your lips.
I have been working on this product for the last few months finalizing the materials, details, manufacturers, packaging. I`ve even produced a small hand-made batch which I sent out to my family, friends and retailers....and they love it!
Now I´m ready to get it produced in a larger scale so more people can enjoy this wonderful product.
This product will be made using local wood from Germany with the help of local manufacturers as well as my own studio in order to provide high quality and sustainability.
 
What is the QUAD good for?

 

 

 
QUAD unfolds from a 12 x 12cm (4.72″ x 4.72″ ) square up to a Ø 25cm (9.84″ ) circle...

 
Discover the seemingly endless array of patterns you can create

 
The QUAD Trivet
QUAD consists of 16 wooden cubes – oiled walnut or maple - connected by a silicone ribbon inserted in the underside of the cubes. The silicone ribbon is flexible, yet durable and heat-resistant. This structures allows various configurations ranging from a compact square to a widespread circular shape.
There are multitudinous variations ranging from basic geometries to more chaotic and decorative shapes.
materials: walnut or maple wood from Germany (oiled), silicone ribbon, felt pads dimensions: 12 x 12 x 3cm (basic square) unfolds up to Ø 25 x 3cm (circular)
 

 
DEWADESIGN
In a world of mass products and big retail chains, trying to establish a label for useful and innovative design products is challenging.
I have had a lot of positive response so far and realized in order to make my work sustainable I need to reach the end customers, the design enthusiasts, people who are looking for individual and innovative products - and not necessarily the big retailers.
By pre-ordering the QUAD trivet you are backing the first production run and helping establish my brand as a maker of innovative and exciting design products.
 

 
 
 
Felt pads on the underside of the cubes protect table surfaces from being scratched

 
 
Will be available in oiled walnut and maple wood

 


 


Production + Shipping
The QUAD Trivet is a simple product, which keeps the manufacturing clear and manageable. However, it isn´t so easy to manufacture it in higher quantities and offer it for an affordable price. Until now I can only buy small quantites of wood and do each step by hand. To offer this product for a more affordable price I need to invest in larger quantites of wood and outsource some of the manufacturing steps. The main supplier and manufacturer will be my trusted local wood workshop in Germany, which supplied the wood for the first prototypes. The final manufacturing steps and packaging will be done in my studio in Berlin, Germany. 
I have tried to design this product as sustainable as possible using mainly natural materials such as wood and felt from local production. Also, I use solvent-free linseed oil for the wood coating and solvent-free adhesives. The flexible silicone ribbon is durable, long-lasting and heat-resistant.
After the campaign ends I will immediately go into production. Since this product is also producible in small quantities I can ensure each backer will recieve his backing order even if the backing goal is not reached. As a professional product designer a high quality of execution is my top priority. 4-6 weeks after the campaign ends the first shipment of QUADs will be sent out.
 


Perks
Perks are a pre-order of the QUAD Trivet or of other dewadesign goodies which will fund the production run of QUAD. Please note that shipping costs must be added to the Perk prices and that I am shipping from Germany.
Perks sind Vorbestellungen des QUADs, um die Produktion zu finanzieren. Nach Ablauf der Kampagne wird das Produkt - also der Perk - hergestellt und an euch verschickt.

story:
Smart Cube is a bluetooth locking device and the first real solution when it comes to protecting what matters. Easily install the device to any cupboard, cabinet or drawer and sync with the Smart Armor app to turn your phone into the key. 

 

 

 

 

After you have affixed the locking connector to drawer or cabinet door you are ready to sync the Cube to the app.

 

Once you’ve downloaded the Smart Armor app, it will quickly walk you through the syncing progress. It’s that simple!

 

 

 

SHIPPING UPDATE: SMART CUBES ARE EXPECTED TO SHIP MID-MARCH 2017

 

 

 

 

HOW MUCH WILL THE SMART CUBE COST?

The smart cube will retail for $89-$99 but Indiegogo backers will get the device for $49-$69 (depending on package)

 

WHAT IS THE SMART CUBE?
The Smart Cube is the first smart locking solution for both home and office that will keep your important and dangerous possessions secure.

WHAT HAPPENS IF MY PHONE DIES & I NEED TO UNLOCK THE SMART CUBE?
The Smart Cube can be accessed from any smartphone, computer or tablet, and is accessiblevia bluetooth so long as you know your access code.

WHAT WILL THE SMART CUBE PROTECT?
The Smart Cube will help keep cabinets, drawers, closets and etc. locked. It’s the first smart locking system that creates a true child-proofed home. Keep poisons, pharmaceuticals/drugs (oxy, percs, etc), alcohol, work files, guns, drawers, closets, cabinets, sheds, tool boxes, car counsels, etc.

HOW STRONG IS THE HOLD ON THE DEVICE TO THE SURFACE IT’S PROTECTING?
The device can withstand up to 100lbs of force via 3M tape.

HOW IS IT POWERED?
The Smart Cube is powered by camera battery.

HOW LONG WILL THE POWER LAST?
The battery that is pre-installed will last 1-2 years, then simply replace with a CR2 battery.

HOW BIG IS THE SMART CUBE?
The Smart Cube measures in at 1.25in X 1.25in.

DOES THE APP WORK FOR IOS AND ANDROID?
Yes.

IS IT A CONNECTED DEVICE (IoT)?
Yes, can integrate into any home network via API (Nest, Kwikset, Phillips Hue, etc)

CAN I MAKE A WHOLESALE ORDER?
Yes, if you are interested in buying wholesale please contact us at: and we will create a secret perk just for your needs.

REFUND POLICY

You have 10 days from the date of purchase to receive a refund. This is done on the Indiegogo platform through your account. After that 10 days no refunds will be available until you have received your shipped purchase. Once you've received your Smart Armor order, you will have 30 days to return your purchase for a full refund. **If ordered on Indiegogo, the shipping and handling charge will not be included in refund.

 

Giveaway Winner announced!

Congratulations to Randall Parkins! You've won a free Smart Cube. We will reach out to you directly to claim your prize.

story:
Meet Hurdle Hanger, our innovative take on an all-purpose hanger.
It's designed to help you organize clothes quickly and easily. Declutter your closet in no time.

 

Just slide it in. It's that easy.

Tops

It ain't goin' nowhere!

 

 

How the Project Began

We created Hurdle Hanger with one goal in mind: to help you organize clothes quickly and easily. It may seem trivial, but it really is a daunting task, especially since different clothes require different types of hangers. Like any other chore, it’s something you want to get over with quickly. We know what that’s like, and we believe Hurdle Hanger is the perfect tool to help you out.

After countless revisions in design and numerous product tests, we are proud to say that we have come up with the “one hanger to hang them all” (a little corny, I know). All we need is your support to put Hurdle Hanger into production, and we cannot wait for all of you to use it at home!

 

 

Meet Collabo Space

In December 2018, we launched Hurdle Hanger for Pants and successfully distributed it to over 58 countries. This would not have been possible without your awesome support, and we can’t thank you enough for believing in us and our product.

Since then, we have built a small but close-knit team of innovators and have worked passionately on Hurdle Hanger as our sophomore project. We are incredibly proud of the outcome and are confident that you’ll love it as much as we do.

Connect with us on our Homepage, Facebook, and Instagram. We look forward to seeing you there!
story_txt:
Meet Hurdle Hanger, our innovative take on an all-purpose hanger.It's designed to help you organize clothes quickly and easily. Declutter your closet in no time. 
One second. It's that simple.

Yes, your closet can be this neat!
Hurdle Hanger’s innovative design helps prevent the neckline of your tops from stretching.Now you can hang your favorite shirts, even turtlenecks, with ease. 

Just slide it in. It's that easy.


How the insert design works
Whether it be tops or bottoms, you can hang your clothes effortlessly.
TopsBottoms
Fold & Hang
SlacksAnd even your belt!
Hurdle Hanger is designed to hang clothes 2 to 3 inches (5 to 7.6 cm) higher than most hangers in the market, creating more storage space beneath.
 

Before & after using Hurdle Hanger. Make the most out of your closet.
Hurdle Hanger is made of ABS (Acrylonitrile Butadiene Styrene), an easily recyclable high-quality thermoplastic with increased strength, rigidity, toughness, and temperature & chemical resistance. Because of these properties, ABS is widely used for making all sorts of household and consumer goods, ranging from protective headgear to Lego bricks. ABS products do not break unless you intentionally attempt to do so by applying excessive force.
The slip-resistant strips on Hurdle Hanger help prevent clothes from falling off.It ain't goin' nowhere!

story:
Our Mission

We are blessed with the wonderful mission of helping to find homes for orphaned children - especially those children who are determined to have "special needs."  We help lower and middle income US adopting families who are opening their hearts and homes to these wonderful children.  These wonderful families have a significantly increased financial burden due to the cost of the child's associated medical or psychological treatments. 

What we Need From You

Please consider contributing at one of the levels shown to the right, so that we can achieve our goal of finding loving families for 100 orphans by Christmas.  We issue grants in $500 multiples, so you can see we still need your help! 

If you'd like more information, you can continue reading below, or visit our website at www.TheOrphanFoundation.org.

Sometimes Statistics Speak Volumes:

  • There are 143,000,000 orphans in the world
  • There are an additional 20,000,000 “displaced children” in the world
  • The combined count of these categories makes the orphan population the 7th largest nation on the planet – slightly larger than the population of Russia
  • In some Middle Eastern countries, unwanted children with Downs Syndrome are used for terrorist acts of bombing.
  • In Africa, homeless children are armed and used for war.
  • In Africa, there is a concerted effort to extend children’s lives beyond 5 years of age
  • In Eastern Europe, less than 50% of the orphan population will live to see their 20th birthdays
  • In Eastern Europe, of the orphans that survive their 20th birthdays, 50% will end up in organized crime, drugs, or prostitution
  • In the US, 25% of foster children become homeless
  • 30,000 leave the system every year without getting into a family
  • 56% of foster care children enter the unemployment ranks
  • 27% of the emancipated male children in foster care end up in jail
  • 30% of the emancipated females in foster care experience early parenthood
Here are some of the adoption agencies / non-profits through which we gave grants to these adopting families.  We give monies only through 501(c)3 intermediaries.  :
  • All God's Children
  • St. Julie Billiart Catholic Church
  • Plan Loving Adoptions
  • AAC Adoption and Family Network
  • Madison Adoption Associates
  • CASI Foundation for Children
  • International Christian Adoption
  • Welcome Home Ministries
  • Heartsent Adoptions
  • Great Wall China Adoption
  • Bethany Christian Services
  • Hope Adoption Agency
  • WACAP
  • MAPS Worldwide
  • ABL Adoptions
  • Wasatch International Adoptions
Here is the direct link to our non-profit's listing on GuideStar: http://www.guidestar.org/organizations/20-8201228/orphan-foundation.aspx. And you can always find out more about what we've been doing at our website: http://www.TheOrphanFoundation.org.
 
But before you decide if you want to help us, we think you should hear the stories behind the first 3 grants we gave out in 2007. 

The First Three Adoption Grant from The Orphan Foundation

What makes a single mom struggling to start up a new business, adopt a hard-to-place, “special needs” child from another country? Why would a perfectly happy, healthy, and content family take on a Down syndrome child with heart complications, when the boy’s own mother chose to give him up at 6 weeks of age? And why would a New York family rescue three frail and traumatized orphans from the ravages of Liberia’s second civil war?

We asked ourselves these questions as our foundation’s Board reviewed the grant requests from these families. When most people hear the term ‘adoption,’ we tend to think about couples faced with infertility, or couples who are trying to put their step-families together to strengthen their family bond. These first three grant requests to The Orphan Foundation bore no similarities to those stereotypical images.

The Smith Case – California

Madeleine Smith, the first recipient of an adoption assistance grant from our Foundation, is a very interesting woman. She describes herself as having a big heart, with an even bigger pile of bills. When she found her way to our Foundation, she was in the process of adopting Dang Jian, a “special needs” child from China. The name she chose for the 4-year old boy is “Elijah.” She describes Elijah as a wonderful child who loves to play outside, and is especially fond of toy cars. His fifth birthday will be in December, so she’s planning a very big celebration when he arrives.

But that is only a small piece of the story. Dang Jian was placed in the “special needs” category by his China orphanage, and given to an adoption agency in Oregon to place. Dang Jian is missing his right ear, which is accompanied by marginal hearing on that side. Adding to that malady are various urinogenital and colorectal problems. These factors, along with his age, also put him in the “hard-to-place” category of adoptions. And what does that mean? He was given this one last chance to be adopted before he would be permanently institutionalized in China.

If China and the adoption world considered Elijah’s problems as significantly daunting, why would a single mom struggling to grow a start-up music services business, step in to rescue him? Good question. But wait.  There is still another page to this story.

Elijah will be Madeleine’s third “special needs” child that she has adopted! And she also has a 22-year old college student son, Donovan. Madeleine’s other adopted children include her 7-year old son Michael, from Bulgaria, and her 3-year old daughter Hana, from Guatemala. And just to make this random act of love more difficult on her, Madeleine decided she had to move from her 2-bedroom apartment to a 3-bedroom apartment to make sure that there was enough room for Elijah in his new home.

Madeleine discovered Dang Jian, when a friend emailed her that she saw Dang Jian’s story on an adoption agency’s website, and described his impending fate. Madeleine found out that someone had put up an anonymous donation to help offset part of the adoption expenses, and that started Madeleine’s wheels in motion. With domestic adoptions averaging $18,105 currently, and almost double that internationally, due to travel costs, document translations and other country specific requirements, this was the opening break she needed. This was her chance to give Elijah a home, and she’d worry about the rest of his living and medical needs when he was in her care.

Madeleine has since arranged for the UCLA Craniofacial Center to replace Elijah’s missing ear. All she wanted from The Orphan Foundation was enough money to finish her legal paperwork with the State of California, get the legal documents translated into Chinese and certified, and have enough left over to pay her travel expenses to China to bring “Elijah” home.

When we asked her why she was doing this, she simply repeated what she said earlier – she has a big heart. The only anchor on that big heart seems to be that big pile of bills she’s managed to build in the process. Our Board could not have agreed more, and voted unanimously to grant her the money.

The Cancilla Case – California

Mary and Warren Cancilla, along with daughter Annalise, seemed truly overjoyed about 6-week old Harrison’s arrival. Harrison would be that new brother for Annalise, and the perfect one boy, one girl family would arrive in a small, quiet California town. However, this family portrait turns out to be a bit more unique than that. Harrison was born with Down syndrome, with the added rare heart complication called tetralogy of Fallot.

Mary, a sign language interpreter, told us that they had been on the Down Syndrome Association of Greater Cincinnati’s waiting list for 2 years. This seemed hardly a “spur of the moment” decision. When the association called to tell the Cancilla’s that Harrison’s mother decided to give him up, and they were on the top of the list to receive a Downs syndrome child, they were overjoyed that their long wait was finally over.

What did they want from The Orphan Foundation? Just some financial help with their adoption costs so that they could free up some money for the medical needs that Harrison will be facing.

Another unanimous vote, and another unnoticed random act of love from just a regular kind of family who chose to love a very special boy.

The Buckley Case – New York

When we talked with Lorraine Buckley she told us all about the incidents that led up to their finding Abrous, the brother of one of the two girls that they had already adopted from an orphanage in Liberia – an orphanage that had been overrun by soldiers during Liberia’s deadly civil wars. A badly beaten orphanage director managed to save the children from harm, by convincing the soldiers that some of the children might be their own. The soldiers confiscated all of the orphans’ food, but allowed the children to vacate the orphanage. The children walked for two days in search of shelter, with at most, a handful of rice for each day of their journey. The UN came to their rescue, and stepped in to provide them with blankets and food. Eventually the orphanage reopened, but everything was completely destroyed, including the children’s beds and toys.

Now what was the connection and motivation that moved the Buckley’s to adopt these two young girls in the first place? Lorraine’s dad was doing some volunteer work to build a home for an old Air Force buddy, who had later turned to missionary work. While swapping time with other contractors to save his buddy money, Lorraine’s father met yet another missionary family in the area. That family had already adopted one of the children from that Liberian orphanage, by the name of George. George had been spared from the attack on the orphanage by being in the US on tour with the Liberian Boy’s Choir. It took a year for George to get up enough courage to ask the missionary family to try to find his sister, who was also living in that orphanage. The family was in shock. They never even knew he had a sister! The family agreed immediately, found his sister Mala, and brought her to the States.

When the Buckley’s went to visit Lorraine’s parents during the December holidays of 2004, they also met the other missionary family, and the reunited siblings, George and Mala. The plight of these children thrust them into motion. Mala asked the Buckley’s if they would help find her two roommates from the orphanage, Patience and Naomi. The Buckley’s not only found them, but by October 2005, the girls were on their way here to their new home with the Buckley’s in New York.

As fate would have it, when Lorraine’s father and husband went to pick-up the girls, Naomi's parents brought her brother Abrous to the Liberian orphanage when they came to see Naomi off. Abrous’ parents asked that the Buckley’s take Abrous as well as his sister Naomi. It wasn’t safe for any of them in Liberia, and the parents were not only living in abject poverty, their situation was made even worse by Abrous’ father being severely injured in a work accident. But in that first round of adoptions, the Buckley’s only succeeded in bringing the 7 and 9 year old girls back to New York. Abrous had already been relinquished to the orphanage, but he was on a waiting list to get in, and of course there was the mound of official paperwork required, and all the money that had yet to be raised. Imagine that - on a waiting list to get into an orphanage!

When they brought the two girls home to New York, Abrous returned home with his parents to wait for an opening at the orphanage. Luck finally prevailed, and at the end of August, Abrous was one of 100-plus children admitted to the orphanage. The Buckley family immediately went into motion trying to raise the money they needed to rescue Abrous, and once again, they reentered the adoption process. Nearly 14 months later, in December of 2006, their documents were finally clear to send to Liberia, and the monies were almost all in place to cover the country fees and other adoption costs. As of July 2007, they are still waiting for word on the case, and final passport clearance. The Buckley’s are hoping that the adoption petition is either in the Liberian courts or will be there very soon.

What did they want from The Orphan Foundation? Financial help to complete the adoption. The families were all asked to go through the same United States adoption agency, which resulted in additional processing fees of $1,800. The Buckley’s were now running out of sources to tap for quick financial help, and were becoming more anxious and desperate in the eleventh hour of Abrous’ rescue. Another unanimous vote from the Board, and another lost child in the world was sent a lifeline.

These were definitely not the stories that we expected to see in our first three grant requests. Where was that stereotypical family that was starving for a child of their own, but left barren by some cruel twist of biological fate? Where was that known connection between the parties that used adoption to solidify a new marriage and family? These weren’t childless parents looking to fill an empty space in their heart, or stepparents coming in to secure the bonds of their new family. These were a whole new breed of parents, with a whole new agenda and view of life.

Our 12-person Board looked at each other in astonishment. We just couldn’t get our heads around this left-turn in our world views. We were seeing entirely different passions at play, complete with an unfaltering commitment to see the long arduous adoption process through to the end, so that they could then begin on the really hard part of all this – raising children with some very special needs.

We told all three of these families that they are the real heroes out there. Forget Superwoman, Batman, and Spiderman. Meet Madeleine, the Cancilla’s, and the Buckley’s. These are the kind of quiet heroes we pass on the streets each day, and had no clue that they even existed. They’re made of the same mettle as those courageous people, who rush into burning buildings to save children, rescue a fallen soldier from enemy fire, or run down a thief who snatched an old woman’s purse. And then they want to quietly disappear behind their private lives, shying away from the cameras and lights of a press eager to exploit their bravery and courage. These families don’t even seem to know what all the fuss is about. Wouldn’t all of us do the same?

Perhaps it was that small quote, nearly hidden at the top of our home page that led them to us:

"We ask that you not judge our success in terms of "bottom lines." Instead, we ask to be measured by the number of "lifelines" we extend to the homeless children of this world."

Perhaps we were never alone in our mission to find these children a family to love them, to cherish their worth, and to give them hope. Either way, bear witness to the birth of a whole new breed of family. Meet the new “tutelaries of hope,” the real guardians of our world’s children. They know no bigotry, no deception, nor bias of thought that would ever prevent them from the simple act of loving a child that would otherwise be lost to the world. We think this is a bright and shining light in the distant skies, and we choose to call that light “hope ascending.”

 

Author’s Footnote: The semi-official orphan count is now estimated at 143 million children around the world. UNICEF estimates that there are another 20 million children in the “displaced children” category. These are the child victims of armed conflict and human rights violations. If we considered these combined categories of children as a nation, their population would rank them as the 7th largest country in the world. Please help us by donating your time or money to our mission to find these children a home, and equally important, by discussing adoption in your circle of family and friends. Currently, we are run by an all-volunteer force of dedicated people, which means 100% of your donations will go to help families adopt.

© 2007, Joe DiDonato, The Orphan Foundation - a 501(c)(3) Nonprofit

27% of the emancipated male children in foster care end up in jail
30% of the emancipated females in foster care experience early parenthood


Here are some of the adoption agencies / non-profits through which we gave grants to these adopting families.  We give monies only through 501(c)3 intermediaries.  :
All God's Children
St. Julie Billiart Catholic Church
Plan Loving Adoptions
AAC Adoption and Family Network
Madison Adoption Associates
CASI Foundation for Children
International Christian Adoption
Welcome Home Ministries
Heartsent Adoptions
Great Wall China Adoption
Bethany Christian Services
Hope Adoption Agency
WACAP
MAPS Worldwide
ABL Adoptions
Wasatch International Adoptions

Here is the direct link to our non-profit's listing on GuideStar: http://www.guidestar.org/organizations/20-8201228/orphan-foundation.aspx. And you can always find out more about what we've been doing at our website: http://www.TheOrphanFoundation.org. 

 
But before you decide if you want to help us, we think you should hear the stories behind the first 3 grants we gave out in 2007.  The First Three Adoption Grant from The Orphan Foundation
What makes a single mom struggling to start up a new business, adopt a hard-to-place, “special needs” child from another country? Why would a perfectly happy, healthy, and content family take on a Down syndrome child with heart complications, when the boy’s own mother chose to give him up at 6 weeks of age? And why would a New York family rescue three frail and traumatized orphans from the ravages of Liberia’s second civil war?
We asked ourselves these questions as our foundation’s Board reviewed the grant requests from these families. When most people hear the term ‘adoption,’ we tend to think about couples faced with infertility, or couples who are trying to put their step-families together to strengthen their family bond. These first three grant requests to The Orphan Foundation bore no similarities to those stereotypical images.
The Smith Case – California
Madeleine Smith, the first recipient of an adoption assistance grant from our Foundation, is a very interesting woman. She describes herself as having a big heart, with an even bigger pile of bills. When she found her way to our Foundation, she was in the process of adopting Dang Jian, a “special needs” child from China. The name she chose for the 4-year old boy is “Elijah.” She describes Elijah as a wonderful child who loves to play outside, and is especially fond of toy cars. His fifth birthday will be in December, so she’s planning a very big celebration when he arrives.
But that is only a small piece of the story. Dang Jian was placed in the “special needs” category by his China orphanage, and given to an adoption agency in Oregon to place. Dang Jian is missing his right ear, which is accompanied by marginal hearing on that side. Adding to that malady are various urinogenital and colorectal problems. These factors, along with his age, also put him in the “hard-to-place” category of adoptions. And what does that mean? He was given this one last chance to be adopted before he would be permanently institutionalized in China.
If China and the adoption world considered Elijah’s problems as significantly daunting, why would a single mom struggling to grow a start-up music services business, step in to rescue him? Good question. But wait.  There is still another page to this story.
Elijah will be Madeleine’s third “special needs” child that she has adopted! And she also has a 22-year old college student son, Donovan. Madeleine’s other adopted children include her 7-year old son Michael, from Bulgaria, and her 3-year old daughter Hana, from Guatemala. And just to make this random act of love more difficult on her, Madeleine decided she had to move from her 2-bedroom apartment to a 3-bedroom apartment to make sure that there was enough room for Elijah in his new home.
Madeleine discovered Dang Jian, when a friend emailed her that she saw Dang Jian’s story on an adoption agency’s website, and described his impending fate. Madeleine found out that someone had put up an anonymous donation to help offset part of the adoption expenses, and that started Madeleine’s wheels in motion. With domestic adoptions averaging $18,105 currently, and almost double that internationally, due to travel costs, document translations and other country specific requirements, this was the opening break she needed. This was her chance to give Elijah a home, and she’d worry about the rest of his living and medical needs when he was in her care.
Madeleine has since arranged for the UCLA Craniofacial Center to replace Elijah’s missing ear. All she wanted from The Orphan Foundation was enough money to finish her legal paperwork with the State of California, get the legal documents translated into Chinese and certified, and have enough left over to pay her travel expenses to China to bring “Elijah” home.
When we asked her why she was doing this, she simply repeated what she said earlier – she has a big heart. The only anchor on that big heart seems to be that big pile of bills she’s managed to build in the process. Our Board could not have agreed more, and voted unanimously to grant her the money.
The Cancilla Case – California
Mary and Warren Cancilla, along with daughter Annalise, seemed truly overjoyed about 6-week old Harrison’s arrival. Harrison would be that new brother for Annalise, and the perfect one boy, one girl family would arrive in a small, quiet California town. However, this family portrait turns out to be a bit more unique than that. Harrison was born with Down syndrome, with the added rare heart complication called tetralogy of Fallot.
Mary, a sign language interpreter, told us that they had been on the Down Syndrome Association of Greater Cincinnati’s waiting list for 2 years. This seemed hardly a “spur of the moment” decision. When the association called to tell the Cancilla’s that Harrison’s mother decided to give him up, and they were on the top of the list to receive a Downs syndrome child, they were overjoyed that their long wait was finally over.
What did they want from The Orphan Foundation? Just some financial help with their adoption costs so that they could free up some money for the medical needs that Harrison will be facing.
Another unanimous vote, and another unnoticed random act of love from just a regular kind of family who chose to love a very special boy.
The Buckley Case – New York
When we talked with Lorraine Buckley she told us all about the incidents that led up to their finding Abrous, the brother of one of the two girls that they had already adopted from an orphanage in Liberia – an orphanage that had been overrun by soldiers during Liberia’s deadly civil wars. A badly beaten orphanage director managed to save the children from harm, by convincing the soldiers that some of the children might be their own. The soldiers confiscated all of the orphans’ food, but allowed the children to vacate the orphanage. The children walked for two days in search of shelter, with at most, a handful of rice for each day of their journey. The UN came to their rescue, and stepped in to provide them with blankets and food. Eventually the orphanage reopened, but everything was completely destroyed, including the children’s beds and toys.
Now what was the connection and motivation that moved the Buckley’s to adopt these two young girls in the first place? Lorraine’s dad was doing some volunteer work to build a home for an old Air Force buddy, who had later turned to missionary work. While swapping time with other contractors to save his buddy money, Lorraine’s father met yet another missionary family in the area. That family had already adopted one of the children from that Liberian orphanage, by the name of George. George had been spared from the attack on the orphanage by being in the US on tour with the Liberian Boy’s Choir. It took a year for George to get up enough courage to ask the missionary family to try to find his sister, who was also living in that orphanage. The family was in shock. They never even knew he had a sister! The family agreed immediately, found his sister Mala, and brought her to the States.
When the Buckley’s went to visit Lorraine’s parents during the December holidays of 2004, they also met the other missionary family, and the reunited siblings, George and Mala. The plight of these children thrust them into motion. Mala asked the Buckley’s if they would help find her two roommates from the orphanage, Patience and Naomi. The Buckley’s not only found them, but by October 2005, the girls were on their way here to their new home with the Buckley’s in New York.
As fate would have it, when Lorraine’s father and husband went to pick-up the girls, Naomi's parents brought her brother Abrous to the Liberian orphanage when they came to see Naomi off. Abrous’ parents asked that the Buckley’s take Abrous as well as his sister Naomi. It wasn’t safe for any of them in Liberia, and the parents were not only living in abject poverty, their situation was made even worse by Abrous’ father being severely injured in a work accident. But in that first round of adoptions, the Buckley’s only succeeded in bringing the 7 and 9 year old girls back to New York. Abrous had already been relinquished to the orphanage, but he was on a waiting list to get in, and of course there was the mound of official paperwork required, and all the money that had yet to be raised. Imagine that - on a waiting list to get into an orphanage!
When they brought the two girls home to New York, Abrous returned home with his parents to wait for an opening at the orphanage. Luck finally prevailed, and at the end of August, Abrous was one of 100-plus children admitted to the orphanage. The Buckley family immediately went into motion trying to raise the money they needed to rescue Abrous, and once again, they reentered the adoption process. Nearly 14 months later, in December of 2006, their documents were finally clear to send to Liberia, and the monies were almost all in place to cover the country fees and other adoption costs. As of July 2007, they are still waiting for word on the case, and final passport clearance. The Buckley’s are hoping that the adoption petition is either in the Liberian courts or will be there very soon.
What did they want from The Orphan Foundation? Financial help to complete the adoption. The families were all asked to go through the same United States adoption agency, which resulted in additional processing fees of $1,800. The Buckley’s were now running out of sources to tap for quick financial help, and were becoming more anxious and desperate in the eleventh hour of Abrous’ rescue. Another unanimous vote from the Board, and another lost child in the world was sent a lifeline.
These were definitely not the stories that we expected to see in our first three grant requests. Where was that stereotypical family that was starving for a child of their own, but left barren by some cruel twist of biological fate? Where was that known connection between the parties that used adoption to solidify a new marriage and family? These weren’t childless parents looking to fill an empty space in their heart, or stepparents coming in to secure the bonds of their new family. These were a whole new breed of parents, with a whole new agenda and view of life.
Our 12-person Board looked at each other in astonishment. We just couldn’t get our heads around this left-turn in our world views. We were seeing entirely different passions at play, complete with an unfaltering commitment to see the long arduous adoption process through to the end, so that they could then begin on the really hard part of all this – raising children with some very special needs.
We told all three of these families that they are the real heroes out there. Forget Superwoman, Batman, and Spiderman. Meet Madeleine, the Cancilla’s, and the Buckley’s. These are the kind of quiet heroes we pass on the streets each day, and had no clue that they even existed. They’re made of the same mettle as those courageous people, who rush into burning buildings to save children, rescue a fallen soldier from enemy fire, or run down a thief who snatched an old woman’s purse. And then they want to quietly disappear behind their private lives, shying away from the cameras and lights of a press eager to exploit their bravery and courage. These families don’t even seem to know what all the fuss is about. Wouldn’t all of us do the same?
Perhaps it was that small quote, nearly hidden at the top of our home page that led them to us:
"We ask that you not judge our success in terms of "bottom lines." Instead, we ask to be measured by the number of "lifelines" we extend to the homeless children of this world."
Perhaps we were never alone in our mission to find these children a family to love them, to cherish their worth, and to give them hope. Either way, bear witness to the birth of a whole new breed of family. Meet the new “tutelaries of hope,” the real guardians of our world’s children. They know no bigotry, no deception, nor bias of thought that would ever prevent them from the simple act of loving a child that would otherwise be lost to the world. We think this is a bright and shining light in the distant skies, and we choose to call that light “hope ascending.”
 
Author’s Footnote: The semi-official orphan count is now estimated at 143 million children around the world. UNICEF estimates that there are another 20 million children in the “displaced children” category. These are the child victims of armed conflict and human rights violations. If we considered these combined categories of children as a nation, their population would rank them as the 7th largest country in the world. Please help us by donating your time or money to our mission to find these children a home, and equally important, by discussing adoption in your circle of family and friends. Currently, we are run by an all-volunteer force of dedicated people, which means 100% of your donations will go to help families adopt. 
© 2007, Joe DiDonato, The Orphan Foundation - a 501(c)(3) Nonprofit

story:
This is a campaign for another batch of SUMPODs.

 

SUMPOD ALUMINIUM (mid September)

In the last couple of months we have secured reliable suppliers to produce the next generation of Desktop 3D Printer and CNC Router.

The difference with the ALUMINIUM SUMPOD is it has been fully designed to be a quality machine at a reasonable price.

The basic machine comes with everything needed to start 3D Printing and routing.

Some of the features are:

1. An Aluminium profile frame construction which makes it extremely solid.  This is important for accuracy.

2. Moving parts that have been milled from billets of Aluminium. Most machines at this price point use wood or plastic.

3. 10mm Linear bearings and Rods.

4. High Quality Stepper Motors on all axis.

5. Fully built and soldered electronics.

6. A 240x240x150 build area.

The machines also come with an additional heated bed and high amp power supply.

 

SUMPOD BASIC KIT MDF (mid September)

This is the entry level SUMPOD machine made of MDF. It is a simpler version of the original SUMPOD with and upgraded Hotend.

It has been designed to be even easier to build and comes with soldered electronics.

The SUMPOD Basic has a build area of 140x140x100 and comes with everything in the kit to make a working 3D Printer.

This is the culmination of many months work to try and produce an affordable 3D Printer Kit.

This kit can not only be looked at as a way of getting an inexpensive 3D printer but also as a great electronics learning tool. This is due to the inclusion of the Arduino Mega development board.

 

This is a PLA only machine (although a heated bed may be offered later).


Shipping Costs

These will be billed after the campaign.

The costs are:

UK Pickup: Free

UK: £29

Europe: £39

US and Canada: £59

Rest of World: £89 - £129

 

Why IndieGoGo?

 

This campaign is to hopefully get more SUMPODs out there to expand the community and also to make 3D Printing cheaper.

 

All perks will be filled regardless of goal although we hope to be able to take the SUMPOD to the next level with the introduction of the SUMPOD BASIC and ALUMINIUM.

Perks will ship in order recieved.

story:
Pablo

When I met my friend Pablo, he was selling coconut on the street of Puerto Plata. Like most places in the Caribbean, there is a local price for things, and then there is the price for the tourist. (Usually quite higher than the local price)

I remember asking him cost of a single coconut. Even though he had the opportunity to hike the price, he sold his coconuts to me at the same low local price. I remember thinking to myself that this is an honest man.


That was in 2012.  At the time, I was there in the Dominican Republic with a group of co-workers on a charity initiative to build some houses in a very deserving community. In 2013, I went back to the Dominican Republic with another group of co-workers to once again build some more houses in the same community, and just as he did in the previous year, Pablo was there almost every day with his wheel barrow filled with coconuts for sale, often drenched with perspiration from pushing his wheel barrow over distances that we would never consider or contemplate.

After the building of the houses was completed, and the rest of the group had returned to Canada, I stayed in the Dominican Republic for an extended vacation. It was at that time that I visited Pablo at his home and saw the condition of his house. (As bad as the pictures are, they really cannot paint a truly accurate picture of how desperate his living condition really is)

In-spite of the crumbling and decaying condition of his house, Pablo was excited to show me a picture of both of us that he had displayed inside of his home. It was only after I started asking questions that he explained to me what had happened and how his house had come to be in its present condition.


A bit about my friend Pablo

Pablo was born in the countryside about 40Kilometers from Puerto Plata to a single mother living in poverty. When he was nine (9) years old, his mother died and Pablo went to live with his grand father. Pablo immediately started working in the field with his grand father, robbing him of a normal childhood and education.

At age 17 he moved to Puerto Plata looking for a better life. He got a job at a local hotel as a dishwasher. It was here that he met his wife who was also working at the hotel as a waitress. A few years later, the hotel closed rendering both Pablo and his wife unemployed with two small children to take care off.

With the small severance package that they received, Pablo and his wife started building a house for their young family. Unfortunately, the funds quickly ran out and all construction came to a screeching halt.  That was about 10yers ago in 2004. Today Pablo sells coconuts to try and support his family, and collects food scraps to feed a few pigs that he is raising.

The Sad Reality

Pablo’s two little girls have now grown up to be teenagers, their entire lives lived in what we would consider to be a broken down backyard shed. Soon they will move on to start families of their own leaving Pablo and his wife to live out their lives in this already crumbling structure, which will eventually collapse around them. The sad truth is, that the older he becomes, the less likely he is to complete what he had started ten years ago, and the more likely that both walls and roof will cave in on itself.


The goal

My goal is to help Pablo complete what he had started 10 years ago, and to finish the construction of his house so that he and his wife can have a safe, dry place to call home.

To achieve this goal, I need to raise a total of $10,000 (ten thousand) dollars for the cost of building materials, the cost of a local contractor and workers, furnishings and appliances.


The driving force

I believe that we all have the capacity to truly impact other people’s lives in a most positive way with out the need, or desire for compensation. It is our opportunity to perform truly selfless acts of kindness. It is our opportunity to simply do Good.

If you have ever been to the Dominican Republic, or any other Caribbean island for that matter on a sunny beach Vacation, then I urge you to donate to this campaign.

The lives of so many of the people living on the islands is often far removed from the Resort lifestyle experienced while on Vacation.



I have found that among its other benefits, giving liberates the soul of the giver. - Maya Angelou

story:
Because you are tired of the caffeine jitters and sugar crashes we want to create a beverage that not only hydrates and refreshes but STIMULATES your MIND and keeps you FOCUSED for those long, LONG hours of CONCENTRATION.  

We could grow the drink slowly, starting in only a few distribution points and one flavor for a few years, but we’d really like to be able to release a substantial range into the marketplace from the start.  Unfortunately, the costs of such a project are significant, so we’re asking for your help.  With the aid of our backers, we plan to release this drink, initially with one flavor, quickly followed by 2-3 additional flavors chosen by YOU, over the course of the next few months.

Why?

Energy Drinks are NOT created or marketed to GAMERS!!!  We feel that it is time to change this.  What is so different about the gamers needs from the jocks?

  • Sugar & caffeine are not the stimulation we need.  Energize my brain! 
  • We need to sustain long hours of focus and the ability to keep ourselves at the top of our game.
  • We need a drink to relieve and prevent mental fatigue.
  • We don't need the jitters from caffeine.
  • And we can't afford that sugar crash.
  • Yes, we will have caffeine & sugar, just not at the extremely high amounts found in other drinks.

Is this only for gamers?  Heck no!  Programmers, engineers or anyone that needs to stay mentally focused for long periods of time will benefit.

Who are we?

We are life long gamers, geeks, etc.  We have "normal" jobs but we choose to game every chance we get.  We are all professionals with a wide range of knowledge. Several of us work in the food industry with advanced knowledge of how to get a food product from concept to actually being on the shelf in your local grocery store or even available online.

Help us raise money to finish the formulation and packaging of GG Energy. An Energy drink to keep your mind energized during long, long, long gaming sessions or tournaments.

How will this happen ? Most drinks fail ?

Great question!! 1st of all we are ALREADY in formulation. Our team has experience running businesses. We did Dilbert the board game, Vapor's Gambit and one of our advisors just finished launched Tabletop Props on another crowdfunding site.

We actively attend / organize gaming conventions and work in the food industry. We have the advantage of knowing the right people in the right places.
Help us bring your product to the shelves and internet ordering!!! Ask any other questions in the public comments and we will answer.

Voting

Everyones tastes are different.  We need your help with finding the best flavors to start with.  Our Level 2 perk gives you the chance to make your voice heard.  Really want to make it count? Vote as many times as you like, on as many flavors as you like. 

If this isn't enough you may want to go for the Level 7 perk.  Be one of only 10 that gets a chance to suggest one of the flavors that everyone votes on.

Level 10 lets you literally put your money where your mouth is!  With this perk you get to be involved with the formulation.  You participate in the formulation and your input helps to decide when the taste is "just right".  Hurry, this one is only available for 2 people and for a limited time while we are in formulation.

Voting updates posted here...

  1. Fierce Pom Berry
  2. Cool Citrus
  3. Tropical Pear
  4. ... your flavor here
  5. ... your flavor here
  6. ... your flavor here
  7. ...your flavor here
  8. ... your flavor here
  9. ...your flavor here
  10. ...your flavor here

Our Plan for the Money

There are many steps to bringing this from concept into your hand.  There will be unforeseen obstacles but we plan to make this happen regardless.  If we don't reach our Indiegogo goal we plan to still make this happen.  We are reaching out to investors as well as other funding sources to ensure success. Every penny helps to bring us to fruition.

RAISING $5000

This 5K will go to pay for the Formulation Lab and the Graphic Team for the packaging.

RAISING $10,000 to $50,000

The extra funds will go to the initial manufacturing of the cans, bottling and attending conventions to promote the drink.  (Do you have a list of local conventions you would like us to attend?)  Minimum print runs for the cans, minimum bottling numbers can be quite staggering.  We estimate the initial run will be over 100,000 cans and costs will be $45k - $56k.

RAISING over $50,000

Now we get to add the additional flavors.  The ground work has already been established.  Formulation included these flavors, now we get to bottle them and get them on the market for you.

Stretch Goals

  • If we surpass our initial target of $5000 and reach $6,500, all levels of support will receive a bonus gift of a coupon for a free can.
  • If we reach $10,000, all contributors at Level 4 and above will receive a T-shirt as an additional Thank You.
  • We will continually update our stretch goals as we get further along.  If you have any suggestions please reach out to us.

Shipping

Domestic (USA) shipping costs are included in all pledge levels.  For International shipping please contact us for details.

Progress

Regular progress reports will be sent out to all backers at regular intervals.  We have a team dedicated to making this project a success and each has his/her own duties along the way.  One individuals task is to keep our backers informed and answer questions ASAP.
story_txt:
Because you are tired of the caffeine jitters and sugar crashes we want to create a beverage that not only hydrates and refreshes but STIMULATES your MIND and keeps you FOCUSED for those long, LONG hours of CONCENTRATION.  We could grow the drink slowly, starting in only a few distribution points and one flavor for a few years, but we’d really like to be able to release a substantial range into the marketplace from the start.  Unfortunately, the costs of such a project are significant, so we’re asking for your help.  With the aid of our backers, we plan to release this drink, initially with one flavor, quickly followed by 2-3 additional flavors chosen by YOU, over the course of the next few months.Why?Energy Drinks are NOT created or marketed to GAMERS!!!  We feel that it is time to change this.  What is so different about the gamers needs from the jocks?
Sugar & caffeine are not the stimulation we need.  Energize my brain! 

We need to sustain long hours of focus and the ability to keep ourselves at the top of our game.

We need a drink to relieve and prevent mental fatigue.
We don't need the jitters from caffeine.
And we can't afford that sugar crash.
Yes, we will have caffeine & sugar, just not at the extremely high amounts found in other drinks.
Is this only for gamers?  Heck no!  Programmers, engineers or anyone that needs to stay mentally focused for long periods of time will benefit.Who are we?We are life long gamers, geeks, etc.  We have "normal" jobs but we choose to game every chance we get.  We are all professionals with a wide range of knowledge. Several of us work in the food industry with advanced knowledge of how to get a food product from concept to actually being on the shelf in your local grocery store or even available online.Help us raise money to finish the formulation and packaging of GG Energy. An Energy drink to keep your mind energized during long, long, long gaming sessions or tournaments.How will this happen ? Most drinks fail ?Great question!! 1st of all we are ALREADY in formulation. Our team has experience running businesses. We did Dilbert the board game, Vapor's Gambit and one of our advisors just finished launched Tabletop Props on another crowdfunding site.We actively attend / organize gaming conventions and work in the food industry. We have the advantage of knowing the right people in the right places.Help us bring your product to the shelves and internet ordering!!! Ask any other questions in the public comments and we will answer.VotingEveryones tastes are different.  We need your help with finding the best flavors to start with.  Our Level 2 perk gives you the chance to make your voice heard.  Really want to make it count? Vote as many times as you like, on as many flavors as you like. If this isn't enough you may want to go for the Level 7 perk.  Be one of only 10 that gets a chance to suggest one of the flavors that everyone votes on.Level 10 lets you literally put your money where your mouth is!  With this perk you get to be involved with the formulation.  You participate in the formulation and your input helps to decide when the taste is "just right".  Hurry, this one is only available for 2 people and for a limited time while we are in formulation.Voting updates posted here...
Fierce Pom Berry
Cool Citrus
Tropical Pear
... your flavor here
... your flavor here
... your flavor here
...your flavor here
... your flavor here
...your flavor here
...your flavor here
Our Plan for the MoneyThere are many steps to bringing this from concept into your hand.  There will be unforeseen obstacles but we plan to make this happen regardless.  If we don't reach our Indiegogo goal we plan to still make this happen.  We are reaching out to investors as well as other funding sources to ensure success. Every penny helps to bring us to fruition.RAISING $5000This 5K will go to pay for the Formulation Lab and the Graphic Team for the packaging.RAISING $10,000 to $50,000The extra funds will go to the initial manufacturing of the cans, bottling and attending conventions to promote the drink.  (Do you have a list of local conventions you would like us to attend?)  Minimum print runs for the cans, minimum bottling numbers can be quite staggering.  We estimate the initial run will be over 100,000 cans and costs will be $45k - $56k.RAISING over $50,000Now we get to add the additional flavors.  The ground work has already been established.  Formulation included these flavors, now we get to bottle them and get them on the market for you.
Stretch Goals

If we surpass our initial target of $5000 and reach $6,500, all levels of support
will receive a bonus gift of a coupon for a free can.
If we reach $10,000, all contributors at Level 4 and above will receive a T-shirt as an additional Thank You.
We will continually update our stretch goals as we get further along.  If you have any suggestions please reach out to us.

Shipping
Domestic (USA) shipping costs are included in all pledge
levels.  For International shipping please contact us for details.
Progress

Regular progress reports will be sent out to all backers at regular intervals.  We have a team dedicated to making this project a success and each has his/her own duties along the way.  One individuals task is to keep our backers informed and answer questions ASAP.

story:
In celebration of reaching our goal, we’ve unlocked a new feature that will ship standard on all Orbii units completely free; a built-in speaker! Use the Orbii app to enable two-way communication with pets and loved ones in real time, or scare off intruders with a variety of alarm sounds and warnings. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 
Using advanced stabilizer bar including a gyroscope, accelerometer, and magnetometer, Orbii can tell where it’s camera is pointing. The camera will stream seamless video to the user.

 

 

 
Orbii’s drive module moves by shifting its center of gravity like a hamster in a ball, rolling in any direction with accuracy and precision. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Control Orbii through any smartphone or tablet. The app features simple joystick controls, live streaming video, real time notifications, sensor data readings, and access to both locally and cloud stored video footage.

 

 

 
 
 

 

 

If Orbii detects any sound or motion beyond a certain threshold set by you, it will alert you via text message or push notification and record a 30 second video automatically. Orbii can tell the difference between humans, pets, and general motion, and can be taught to recognize sounds like smoke alarms, glass breaking, or a baby crying.

 

 

 

 

Orbii has 8 GB of on-board memory for recording audio and video streams and environmental data. Opt in to the cloud storage subscription plan, and you will be able to keep your data on our secure servers for up to 30 days.

 

Orbii’s standard camera is excellent in low light situations. An upgraded camera with infra-red LEDs will be available, allowing clear night vision in complete darkness.

 

 

 

Orbii will be able to use its position sensors to map your home or office as you drive it around. Once a map has been created, the user will be able to tell Orbii to travel anywhere on it—or patrol the entire home—completely autonomously. 

 

 

 
 
 

 

 

Orbii is made of high density Polycarbonate shell, a durable, wear resistant material that is resistant to small shocks and other forms of damage. While Orbii is primarily intended as an indoor device, it is fully capable of outdoor operation.

 

 

 

 
 

 

 
 

 

 

 

 
Orbii can be upgraded with atmospheric sensors capable of measuring temperature, humidity, carbon monoxide levels, air quality, air pressure, and volatile organic compounds.

 

 

 

 

 

Orbii’s stabilized bar come with 4 USB type C ports. Users will be able to install module upgrades like a thermal camera, environmental sensors, Infra Red emitters, and even a laser pointer.

 

 

 

Orbii will integrate with other If This Then That capable devices. That means any device in your smart home can by synced up with Orbii to coordinate all the tasks important to your daily home life.

 

 

 
 
 

 

Orbii will push notifications to your phone for any of the devices to which it is connected, in addition to it's own notifications for sound and motion detection.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 
 
 

 

 

 Orbii’s camera and remote drivability make it a perfect device for capturing memories with your loved ones. Capture memories with family, friends and pets and store them on the cloud.

 

 

 

Is your favorite pet prone to boughts of naughtiness? Keep an eye on them with Orbii! Youll be able to hear and see everything they do, and can scare them off if they go somewhere they are not supposed to be.

 

 

 

Hear a scary noise under the porch? Check it out with Orbii. Explore crawl spaces, check for lost items behind furniture, see parts of your home you’ve never been able to reach. Orbii can act as your own personal home inspector – send it into dangerous areas to scope things out.

 

 

 

 

 

 
Orbii uses a simple control scheme. A joystick controls the motion in any direction, while the directional pad pans the camera.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

When researching home security cameras, Orbii’s creators noticed a flaw in the market – current cameras are limited in viewing angle, coverage, and most importantly mobility. All of the available offerings require the buyer to purchase multiple cameras to set up all around their home. And so the idea for Orbii was born: a driveable, internet connected camera that a user can drive from room to room for a cost effective home security solution.

While the Orbii was in early development, the team was approached by first responders. They loved the idea behind the Orbii, but were looking more specifically for a remotely controlled environmental monitoring solution for Fire Fighters, Police, and Hazmat teams to use during rescue operations. So the Orbii team designed a modular sphere with interchangeable panels that can be upgraded to include environmental and atmospheric sensors, letting first responders drive it into dangerous sites and obtain situational awareness. This campaign will fund the consumer version, which can later be adapted into a lifesaving commercial version.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Can I connect to and control my Orbii from anywhere?
In a word, yes. Whether you are across the street or across the country, provided you have the password you can connect from any mobile device or computer.

Can Orbii go upstairs or downstairs?
No, you will need one Orbii for each floor of your residence. However, think of other cameras on the market; you’ll need one in every room, on each floor, for the kind of coverage you can get with just one Orbii per floor!

How does Orbii drive and move?
Orbii moves by shifting its internal center of gravity, like a hamster in a hamster ball. A central sphere contains omni-directional drive motors that will shift the sphere in any direction with precise control and surprising agility.

How much is the drive time on a single charge?
Orbii will be able to drive and record data for 1 hour on a single charge. While sitting on its charging dock, Orbii can pan, tilt and stream both video and data for an uinlimited amount of time.

What is the camera resolution on Orbii?
Orbii is equipped with a 720p High Definition camera with an integrated microphone

When driving, how does the video remain steady?
Orbii is equipped with Gyro Accelerometer and Magnetometer sensors. These sensors communicate with the camera to tell it when to stream frames or video. The Camera will only stream video when the lens is facing in the direction of travel. When Orbii is stationary or panning, the camera streams video at 30 frames per second.

What is stopping someone from using my Orbii to spy on me in my own home?
Orbii utilizes tokens and keys to further secure encrypted data transfer between the device and the cloud. Other users will not be able to use your Orbii or access your files.

I already have a security system, why do I need this?
Security sensors are only able to detect breaches in your home’s perimeter (doors, windows, ect.), and traditional security cameras can only cover the room into which they are installed. Orbii is able move around the interior of your home, and detect threats your security system would otherwise miss.

Is Orbii meant to replace my security system?
Not right now. Orbii at this stage of development is intended to augment existing security, or provide a degree of security for those who cannot afford a full, modern home security system.

What happens if my Orbii stops working or breaks?
Every Orbii comes with 1 year limited warranty for any manufacturing defaults. Any type of accidental damage will not be covered under the warranty. In case of problems or issues you can contact our customer service department and they will be happy to assist you.

Can multiple devices connect to Orbii?
Yes, any user equipped with the password can connect to Orbii at any time.

Can Orbii operate outdoors?
Yes it can! Orbii operates more effectively on smooth surfaces, but it has can roll on paved surface or short grass. Please don’t take Orbii off-roading or swimming.
Does Orbii work on Carpet?
In a word, yes! Orbii will operate on most flat surfaces, including carpet, wood, and other common flooring materials.

How will Orbii receive software updates?
Once an update is available, it will pushed via WiFi to each device from our servers automatically.

What comes default on Orbii? How do I purchase other modules?
The basic Orbii model includes an HD camera and microphone. As they become available, a speaker, additional sensors and attachments will either be added to your perk package, become available for purchase on our website, or both.

Does Orbii record the video it streams to my phone?
Yes. Orbii will record video while it is being driven and store it in internal storage, or to our cloud server.

How do I access archived video that my Orbii has recorded?
You will be able to use the app to access locally stored video footage, and If you have a monthly subscription plan with us you may store your video on a cloud server, also accessed through the Orbii application. 

What do I do if Orbii gets dirty?
It is advisable to clean Orbii occasionally with a damp cloth.

How much is shipping and handling?
Domestic shipping and handling will be free via USPS Priority Mail

International shipping and handling for a single Orbii unit costs as below via USPS First Class Mail
Canada = $20
UK, Australia, Japan = $30
EU = $35
Rest of World = $40

How much storage capacity does Orbii have for recorded footage?
At maximum video resolution, Orbii can record up to 8 hours of data on local storage. Videos are recorded in 30 seconds chunks initialized by triggers like motion or loud noises. If Orbii is left on to observe and record in away mode, it will record 8 hours of footage, and then begin overwriting from beginning.

Is Orbii pet-proof?
Orbii is made of high density Poly carbonate, which is resistant to pets using it as a chew toy, and also water resistant 

How loud is the Orbii speaker? Can the volume be adjusted? If so, to what range?
The orbii speaker will be loud enough to be easily heard in a relatively quiet room. Volume will be adjustable from the app settings screen.

Can the Camera detect anomalies in the dark?
Orbii’s camera is excellent in low-light situations. We are also working on adding a night vision-capable camera to the basic model, which will be equipped with IR LEDs around the lens to enable streaming video in complete darkness.
