story:
On Nov. 14, DePrimo spent his own $75 on winter boots for a homeless man who said he had never before owned a pair of shoes. Officer DePrimo's acted without expectation of repayment, reward, or recognition.  Join me in thanking him for what he's done, and giving him the resources to do even more.

A week before Thanksgiving, Jennifer Foster of Florence, AZ was visiting Times Square with her husband when they saw a shoeless man asking for change. As Foster explained to the NYPD: 

“Right when I was about to approach, one of your officers came up behind him. The officer said, ‘I have these size 12 boots for you, they are all-weather. Let’s put them on and take care of you.’ The officer squatted down on the ground and proceeded to put socks and the new boots on this man. The officer expected NOTHING in return and did not know I was watching. I have been in law enforcement for 17 years. I was never so impressed in my life. I did not get the officer’s name. It is important, I think, for all of us to remember the real reason we are in this line of work. The reminder this officer gave to our profession in his presentation of human kindness has not been lost on myself or any of the Arizona law enforcement officials with whom this story has been shared.”

We all occasionally witness the needs of the sick and homeless on our city streets. Sometimes we offer change. More often we walk right by. Yet our police officers don't have the luxury of ignoring the needs of our most vulnerable citizens. Their hearts ache as much as ours do for what they witness, and for their lack the resources to address the problem.

That's why I'm petitioning to help Officer DePrimo do more of what he's already done - to help those he thinks could best use it. The Larry DePrimo Act of Kindness Fund will allow police officers, police departments, and community organizations of Officer DePrimo's choosing to help the sick and the homeless in the recognition and remembrance of Officer DePrimo's striking and selfless act of kindness.

Officer DePrimo gave $75 to the cause on that chilly night. I'm giving $150 here and now. What can you give?

Merry Christmas, Officer DePrimo. Thank you for reminding us to put kindness at the top of our Christmas lists.
story_txt:
On Nov. 14, DePrimo spent his own $75 on winter boots for a homeless man who said he had never before owned a pair of shoes. Officer DePrimo's acted without expectation of repayment, reward, or recognition.  Join me in thanking him for what he's done, and giving him the resources to do even more.
A week before Thanksgiving, Jennifer Foster of Florence, AZ was visiting Times Square with her husband when they saw a shoeless man asking for change. As Foster explained to the NYPD: 
“Right when I was about to approach, one of your officers came up behind him. The officer said, ‘I have these size 12 boots for you, they are all-weather. Let’s put them on and take care of you.’ The officer squatted down on the ground and proceeded to put socks and the new boots on this man. The officer expected NOTHING in return and did not know I was watching. I have been in law enforcement for 17 years. I was never so impressed in my life. I did not get the officer’s name. It is important, I think, for all of us to remember the real reason we are in this line of work. The reminder this officer gave to our profession in his presentation of human kindness has not been lost on myself or any of the Arizona law enforcement officials with whom this story has been shared.”
We all occasionally witness the needs of the sick and homeless on our city streets. Sometimes we offer change. More often we walk right by. Yet our police officers don't have the luxury of ignoring the needs of our most vulnerable citizens. Their hearts ache as much as ours do for what they witness, and for their lack the resources to address the problem.
That's why I'm petitioning to help Officer DePrimo do more of what he's already done - to help those he thinks could best use it. The Larry DePrimo Act of Kindness Fund will allow police officers, police departments, and community organizations of Officer DePrimo's choosing to help the sick and the homeless in the recognition and remembrance of Officer DePrimo's striking and selfless act of kindness.
Officer DePrimo gave $75 to the cause on that chilly night. I'm giving $150 here and now. What can you give?
Merry Christmas, Officer DePrimo. Thank you for reminding us to put kindness at the top of our Christmas lists.

story:
tm

 

What's it all about,.....Alfie? 

 

 

 

A FLIK'r Switch?............... What is it?

 

In House Hard Wired Switching Method: Cumbersome with switches, junction boxes, and huge amounts of copper wire$.

 

New FLIK'r Switching Method: Much of the wiring is eliminated and easy FLIK'r fail free battery-less andw wireless remote switching all throughout the house and even outdoor-to-indoor control or indoor-to-outdoor control.

 

Remote control lighting up to

300 feet indoors (91 metres)

450 feet outdoors (137 metres)

through floors, doors, windows to control with or without dimming.

 ISM ENIGMA WEB SITE: ISMENIGMA.COM

ISM ENIGMA EMAIL:  

ism.enigma@gmail.com

info@ismenigma.com

sales@ismenigma.com

 

 Our facebook page:  https://www.facebook.com/FlikrSwitch

No batteries!

   This international patent pending scalable energy harvesting generator invented by Dr. Deak eliminates the need for any batteries in the switch remote enclosure.

 

 

 

 

 

The switch does not need to be mounted on walls but it can. Also can be carried on person or docked in a wall sleeve and no need to poke holes in walls.

The switch transmitter sends switch and dim data on an ISM (Industrial Scientific & Medical Band) frequency of 915 MHz (USA) and 868 MHz (UK/EU).

The switch receiver is powered by the AC mains and will automatically adapt and operate on either 120 VAC @ 60 Hertz (in USA) or 220 VAC @ 50 Hertz (in UK and the EU).

One switch (as shown below) can control an unlimited number of receivers and each receiver can handle a plurality of lights or other electrical loads up to its maximum wattage limit for multi-lighting situations. A range of power handling versions will be marketed as part of Phase II design and marketing steps.

Also up to 32 switches can control one receiver. 

 Actually people find our FLIK'r Switch fun to operate. Some have even imposed a time out for family members wanting to over FLIK the FLIK'r. It's like excersing or squeezing a rubber ball for therapy..........NO BATTERIES!...........NO WORRIES!......A milli-calorie burner as well.

 

Each receiver has 32 memory storage locations for different addresses and when the memory storage locations are all filled up any additional addresses will be rejected, however this receiver has a reset button to clear all addresses and make all new 32 address mamory space free for any re-addressing decisions. 

 

 

Unique switch transmitter encoding is generated upon the initial flicking of the switch transmitter, this address code is then the device ID code to be transmitted and paired with the receiver device. The receiver learns the address code by a user simply pressing in a button switch on the receiver and whilst holding the button switch in, the switch transmitter is flicked. That's all there is to pairing the switch transmitter ID code to the receiver where it is stored in an address storage memory block. To dim the controlled light, simple move the slide control to the extreme right for full 100% brightness, and extreme left for minimum brightness. The slide control is linear so mid position gives 50% brightness.

Using 128 bit binary encoding gives 3.4 x 10^38 number combinations. By comparison there are 10^24 number of stars in the known Hubble Universe. Ergo, one never has to worry about turning on or off a neighbor's lights as well as your own.

 

The FLIK'r Switch Transmitter                                    Internal View

Size: 100 x 64 x 15 mm.

Weight: 95 grams

Colors: various including transparent

 

The FLIK'r Switch System                                      Clear plastic

                                                                              (Perks #9, #10)

(868 MHz EU/UK version)

 

What will FLIK'r switch and dim?

The present model receiver rated @ 300 Watts for 120 VAC 60 Hertz or 220 VAC 50 Hertz loads will switch any one of these:

3 - 100 Watt Incandescent bulbs or 6 - 50 Watt Incandescent bulbs.

60 - 4.5 Watt LED lights (if the LED lights are dimmable then FLIK'r can dim them). Note #1: 4.5 Watt LED light give the brilliance of a 60 Watt Incandescent light.

20 - 14 Watt CFL lights (brilliance of a 100 Watt Incandescent light). NOTE: Dimmable CFL lights require a special dimmer, and will not be dimmed by conventional wired in dimmers. The “maybe” answer in the above table refers to the FLIK'r being able to dim some dimmable CFL lights, but not all.

The FLIK'r will switch and dim a fan up to 300 Watts of power consumption.

 

Some surpise applications that FLIK'r Switches can be used for:

1) Hotel Taxi Calling System
Each bellman has a Transmitter to control a stop/go light at a taxi stand.

2) Combat Simulation Demolitions Training
US government, specific application unknown

3) Senior Call for Assistance System
For assisted living facilities, patient flicks Transmitter to call for help.

4) Casino Table Service Calls
Dealer flicks Transmitter to call for chips, drinks, etc.

5) Control of Lift for the Handicapped

6) Doctor is Ready for Patient
Doctor flicks a Transmitter in the examining room to turn on a signal to the nurse's station.

7) Control Lights on Docks/Boats from Shore/House

8) Control Christmas Tree Lights or to Control All of Your Holiday Window Candles at Once

9) Control Computer Monitors in Classrooms

10) Factory Floor Alerts
Worker flicks a Transmitter to control a remote signal to call for assistance, inspection, etc.

11) Control Landscape Lighting, Fountains, Pumps for Ponds, etc.

12) “Safe from Shock Hazard” Light Controls for Use in Wet Areas
For kitchens, bathrooms, pool areas, Jacuzzis, etc. 

The FLIK'r Switch Transmitters generate their own power.

They have no outside source of electricity -- so there is no danger of electrical shock.

13) One FLIK'r Control of Store Fixture Lighting
One Transmitter is used to control all showcase lights in entire store.

14) Back Lighting of Framed Art (or other portable battery powered mobile use).
A special 12V Lightning Receiver controls battery-powered lamp that backlights framed art.

15) Individual Control of Overhead Lights in Office Cubicle Area
Each cubicle has its own wireless/batteryless control to switch on/off ceiling lighting.

 

 

A SWITCH IN A BOOK (For PERK#11)

 

A SWITCH ON A WALL                                                                               Munich

 

A SWITCH OUTSIDE IN LUGANO, CH.                                                     Bolzano

(Switching the sun perhaps)

 

tm

 

 

ISM ENIGMA, LLC. is a Long Island, NY based development-stage company formed in 2012 to develop the unique and groundbreaking inventions of inventor and Physicist, Dr. David Deak, CTO. Consisting of 3 founding members, Dr. Deak, Ronald Ranieri, CFO and Robert Heppenheimer, CEO; ISM ENIGMA is proud to present its first product for final commercialization. Based on international patent pending technologies, the FLIK'r switch is the first, simple, cost effective and easy to install wireless and battery-less (self powered) light switch technology (with a dimming feature) geared specifically for both the home and commercial markets.

 

With the completion of Phase I testing, the initial production demonstration switches have proven to be effective and reliable at long ranges, through concrete and other usual real world building obstacles. With this milestone achieved, ISM ENIGMA, LLC is now seeking funding to complete our Phase II commercialization process of this innovative light switching (or any electrical load device) product and bring this new technology into both the national and international markets.

 

Previous Funding and Future Funding Needs

 

ISM ENIGMA, LLC. has been funded by the founding partners thus far. This funding has brought the Flik’r lighting switch technology from a concept to a working production type demonstration model. It is funding the next stage to commercialize the product where we need help in making this available worldwide.

 

Current Team and Required Skill sets

ISM ENIGMA, LLC has 3 founding partners:

Dr. David Deak, Ph.D. in Physics is the Chief Technology Officer 

Mr. Robert Heppenheimer, MPA is the Chief Executive Officer

Mr. Ronald Ranieri, MBA is the Chief Financial Officer

 

With contributions, ISM Enigma will be able to make final beneficial improvements in the design process for minimizing the production costs, and obtaining testing for UL and CE approval and certification; as well as making design packaging for shipment.

 

 

ISM ENIGMA, LLC. has successfully completed transmitter and receiver circuit hardware designs, and software design including final testing of the first 40 switches engineered and produced on behalf of ISM ENIGMA by our manufacturer Ultraflex, Inc. a Long Island design company with manufacturing facilities in Sofia, Bulgaria. 20 switches are geared to the U.S. market, the other 20 for European markets. The only difference between the U.S. and European devices is the operating frequency in compliance with U.S.'s FCC and the EU's R&TTE (Council on Radio Equipment and Telecommunications Terminal Equipment) and patents are pending in the US and EU for the switch and the underlying software.

With working demonstration models, it is anticipated that additional work needs to be done to streamline the manufacturing process to bring the costs down for the final product. We will reduce the circuitry size by using hybrid micro chips, which will be part of the funding useage costs.

If our entire funding goal is not reached, the funds will be directly applied to paying the contract manufacturer Ultraflex, Inc. (http://ultraflex.net/) to begin Phase II design modifications and get the product UL tested and approved initially to sell in the USA. If our goal is reached then we can have CE certification as well for UK and EU marketing and sales.

 

Projected roll-out timeline: Note #2: Timeline begins after Indiegogo closing.

* Completion of commercialization 9 months

* Marketing Planning and Strategy 3 - 6 months (concurrent)

* Develop Manufacturing/Distribution Strategies 9 months (concurrent)

* Launch marketing plan  Begin in month 9

* First Sales in U.S. market Begin in month 10

* First Sales Internationally Begin in month 13

 

Detailed Product Overview

The FLIK’r Switch is based on ISM ENIGMA, LLC's international patents pending technology (see note #3 in red below) in a switch form, which creates its own power by the flicker action/activation of the switch. The first time the customer "flicks" the switch power on the FLIK’r Switch, power is generated to the microcontroller/microchip transmitter run by the patent pending wireless communication software, sending a signal, using proprietary software, to the receiving light fixture. It automatically communicates and pairs with the light fixture enhanced with a wireless receiver which has been connected to a usual power sources (i.e. ceiling, table top or other routine lighting systems). Once paired, the wireless connection between the mobile switch and the lighting fixture is permanently established. A flick of the switch will now turn the light on or off, or on at varied levels of intensity/dimming. Installation is reduced to connecting the lighting fixture/receiver to a power source and pairing the switch to the fixture. No other installation costs or labor is required.

 

Note #3: There are three international patents pending, one for the energy harvesting generator that powers the switch transmitter, one for the switch system itself and one for the system software (firmware).

 

Why This Invention Is Needed In the Marketplace?

Conventional switches require significant wiring to connect to a device (i.e. lighting fixture). In addition one must also include the wiring necessary to bring electrical power to the lighting fixture itself. Both devices (switch and fixture) require a fixed permanent positioning as well as the cost of wire and the labor of doing the wiring. (Note: there are currently in the market, a few battery operated wireless switches.)

With the ISM ENIGMA, LLC FLIK’r Switch, technology takes a leap forward: the switch has no wires nor batteries. It generates its own power when flicked and sends a signal to a light fixture that is connected to a FLIK'r receiver to turn on and off and dim as specified. It makes the switch totally mobile and it never needs to have any batteries that need to be changed periodically, thus saving money on the wires, wiring, as well as the cost of batteries if compared to a battery operated wireless switch. Additionally it eliminates the battery disposal problems inherent with battery operated devices making for a less toxic environment contribution. 

 

Discussion

With new technologies changing our lives, few have the real world, daily impact as much as lighting. Each and every day, several times a day, we reach for a lighting switch while walking in and out of a room, never giving the switch and its fixed position and required wiring to both power and its related lighting fixture a moments thought. The costs of material, and underlying time and labor costs required for conventional lighting systems add significant cost to all new construction and renovation projects in both commercial and residential building sites. Never mind the cost of removal and disposal when renovation time comes.

Imagine a new world where remotely controlled lighting switches do not need external power and can connect to a lighting fixture, wirelessly. ISM ENIGMA, LLC has invented the FLIK’r Switch (*) the first completely wireless and battery-less self-powered remote controlled switch specifically geared to the consumer. Once freed from the wires, switches become mobile and can wirelessly connect to a light fixture via specially designed proprietary software (*). This ground-breaking technology can be applied to any lighting device(s) requiring on/off switching/dimming and saves significant time, labor and material costs during construction. Additionally, there are significant benefits to the end-user consumer including ease of use, mobility and flexibility that have heretofore been impossible or very expensive.

(*) International patents pending.

 

The Perks

As it is understood from the very concept of crowd funding such as indiegogo.com, our goal is to succeed. The definition of a donation then, is to obtain help from interested parties that will directly benefit from our technology. We at ISM ENIGMA ask that help, and the Perks remain as a way of thanking everyone for their generosity and help.

 

NOTE: #4 - Perks 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 7, and 8 can be viewed among the Gallery photos for various selections. Perk 12 is a custom painting by Dr. Deak, and will be painted after donation is entered.

 

Ergo, to make it clear to indiegogo and all visitors and contributors to our cause:

Our team at ISM ENIGMA thank you and appreciate your interest and help. We know you will be pleased with all Perks offered here.

 

The Make It Happen Team

CEO - Robert Heppenheimer , M.P.A.

Mr. Heppenheimer has a BA in Psychology from Queens College and an MPA in Public Administration in Health Policy and Management from NYU. After having worked his way up from Recreation Volunteer in 1974 to Assistant Administrator, in 1989 he became a NYS Licensed Nursing Home Administrator. Bob has been active in Skilled Nursing Facilities for his entire healthcare career and has been an advocate for change in this industry. From 1990 – 2005, Mr. Heppenheimer was Administrator of Record in several facilities on Long Island including; Sunrise Manor Center for Nursing & Rehabilitation, John J. Foley Skilled Nursing Facility, Bellhaven Nursing Center, and Grace Plaza Nursing Center. He has been Executive Director for several facilities since 1999 and took a lead position in New York State appointed Receiverships for Bethany Gardens (Rome, N.Y.) and Affinity Skilled Living & Rehabilitation Center (Oakdale, N.Y). During his tenure he has been responsible for developing proactive programs in the facilities to improve the quality of life and the level of care and compassion provided by facilities.

In 1999 he first became an owner of a skilled nursing facility and has been active in developing these facilities to meet the needs of the “Next Generation”. In March 2006, he became Owner/Operator of Hilaire Farm Nursing Home a 76 bed home in Huntington, New York. In February, 2008 Bob became the Owner/Operator of Nesconset Center for Nursing & Rehabilitation in Smithtown, New York and has brought his innovated philosophy and technology to this Facility as well.

Mr. Heppenheimer has served as President of Intercounty Health Facilities Association, a 55 member Nursing Home trade association on Long Island as well as on the Board of NYSHFA for many years. He currently serves on the Governing Board as well as the Legislative Committee for NYSHFA. He has lectured around the State on Culture Change and other nursing home related topics. He currently serves as Chairman of the Board for a charitable organization for stroke prevention and awareness, Judy’s Run and is a Board Member for LIGALY, Long Island Gay & Lesbian Youth not for profit organization.

CFO - Ronald Ranieri, M.B.A.

Mr. Ranieri was the Owner/Administrator of the Nesconset Nursing Center, a 240 bed Skilled Nursing Facility employing 350 people in Nesconset, New York, from its opening in August 1984 until the facility was sold in February 2008. Mr. Ranieri was responsible for the overall daily operation of the Nursing Facility and ensured that the facility was in total compliance with all required Federal, State and Local regulations. Under his direction, the facility was “deficiency free” in fifteen of the twenty-two unannounced annual surveys conducted by the New York State Department of Health, Office of Health Systems Management, a record not equaled by many Nursing Homes in New York State or the Nation. In addition, he established the first medical model Adult Day Health Services (Adult Day Care) Program on Long Island in 1985. In 1989, Nesconset Nursing Center became the first proprietary facility in New York State to open a free-standing medical model Adult Day Care Program. In September 1994 the Facility opened a second free-standing medical model Adult Day Care Program. Mr. Ranieri oversaw the operation of these Adult Day Health Services Programs which addressed the medical and social needs of 180 Registrants from the community, with a combined staff of 70 employees.

While in the Nursing Home industry, Mr. Ranieri was actively involved at both the local and state level. He held various Executive Officer positions (Treasurer, Secretary and Vice President) in the Suffolk County Health Facilities Association, an association of 31 Nursing Facilities caring for 5,200 Residents. He also was a committee member for many years on the Group Purchasing Committee and the Payment for Services Committee for the New York State Health Facilities Association, an association of 230 Nursing Facilities caring for 40,000 Residents. Mr. Ranieri holds an undergraduate degree in Economics from Lafayette College (Pennsylvania) and a master’s degree in Business Administration from Pace University (New York City).

CTO - Dr. David Deak (age:71)

Dr. Deak is a physicist and noted contemporary artist with a very strong background through experience in art, science, and technology. Dr. Deak is an unusual combination of an artist and a physicist-technologist whose work is infused with a wealth of knowledge stemming from his scientific and technical background. Educated at the University of London, England (BS in Mathematics), Imperial College & Queen Mary College London, England (Masters of Science), and achieved a Ph.D. in physics from the University of Copenhagen, Denmark. He has lived in NY & London, where he has been active in theoretical physics, applied physics, inventing, engineering and is a respected artist as well. He has taught and consulted in these related fields for over forty years. Since the 1980’s, Dr. Deak has had many technologically ground-breaking inventions and been deeply involved in cutting edge research.

* First Sales Internationally Begin in month 13
 
Detailed Product Overview
The FLIK’r Switch is based on ISM ENIGMA, LLC's international patents pending technology (see note #3 in red below) in a switch form, which creates its own power by the flicker action/activation of the switch. The first time the customer "flicks" the switch power on the FLIK’r Switch, power is generated to the microcontroller/microchip transmitter run by the patent pending wireless communication software, sending a signal, using proprietary software, to the receiving light fixture. It automatically communicates and pairs with the light fixture enhanced with a wireless receiver which has been connected to a usual power sources (i.e. ceiling, table top or other routine lighting systems). Once paired, the wireless connection between the mobile switch and the lighting fixture is permanently established. A flick of the switch will now turn the light on or off, or on at varied levels of intensity/dimming. Installation is reduced to connecting the lighting fixture/receiver to a power source and pairing the switch to the fixture. No other installation costs or labor is required.
 
Note #3: There are three international patents pending, one for the energy harvesting generator that powers the switch transmitter, one for the switch system itself and one for the system software (firmware).
 
Why This Invention Is Needed In the Marketplace?
Conventional switches require significant wiring to connect to a device (i.e. lighting fixture). In addition one must also include the wiring necessary to bring electrical power to the lighting fixture itself. Both devices (switch and fixture) require a fixed permanent positioning as well as the cost of wire and the labor of doing the wiring. (Note: there are currently in the market, a few battery operated wireless switches.) 
With the ISM ENIGMA, LLC FLIK’r Switch, technology takes a leap forward: the switch has no wires nor batteries. It generates its own power when flicked and sends a signal to a light fixture that is connected to a FLIK'r receiver to turn on and off and dim as specified. It makes the switch totally mobile and it never needs to have any batteries that need to be changed periodically, thus saving money on the wires, wiring, as well as the cost of batteries if compared to a battery operated wireless switch. Additionally it eliminates the battery disposal problems inherent with battery operated devices making for a less toxic environment contribution. 
 
Discussion
With new technologies changing our lives, few have the real world, daily impact as much as lighting. Each and every day, several times a day, we reach for a lighting switch while walking in and out of a room, never giving the switch and its fixed position and required wiring to both power and its related lighting fixture a moments thought. The costs of material, and underlying time and labor costs required for conventional lighting systems add significant cost to all new construction and renovation projects in both commercial and residential building sites. Never mind the cost of removal and disposal when renovation time comes.
Imagine a new world where remotely controlled lighting switches do not need external power and can connect to a lighting fixture, wirelessly. ISM ENIGMA, LLC has invented the FLIK’r Switch (*) the first completely wireless and battery-less self-powered remote controlled switch specifically geared to the consumer. Once freed from the wires, switches become mobile and can wirelessly connect to a light fixture via specially designed proprietary software (*). This ground-breaking technology can be applied to any lighting device(s) requiring on/off switching/dimming and saves significant time, labor and material costs during construction. Additionally, there are significant benefits to the end-user consumer including ease of use, mobility and flexibility that have heretofore been impossible or very expensive.
(*) International patents pending.
 
The Perks
As it is understood from the very concept of crowd funding such as indiegogo.com, our goal is to succeed. The definition of a donation then, is to obtain help from interested parties that will directly benefit from our technology. We at ISM ENIGMA ask that help, and the Perks remain as a way of thanking everyone for their generosity and help.
 
NOTE: #4 - Perks 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 7, and 8 can be viewed among the Gallery photos for various selections. Perk 12 is a custom painting by Dr. Deak, and will be painted after donation is entered.
 
Ergo, to make it clear to indiegogo and all visitors and contributors to our cause:
Our team at ISM ENIGMA thank you and appreciate your interest and help. We know you will be pleased with all Perks offered here.
 
The Make It Happen Team
CEO - Robert Heppenheimer , M.P.A.
Mr. Heppenheimer has a BA in Psychology from Queens College and an MPA in Public Administration in Health Policy and Management from NYU. After having worked his way up from Recreation Volunteer in 1974 to Assistant Administrator, in 1989 he became a NYS Licensed Nursing Home Administrator. Bob has been active in Skilled Nursing Facilities for his entire healthcare career and has been an advocate for change in this industry. From 1990 – 2005, Mr. Heppenheimer was Administrator of Record in several facilities on Long Island including; Sunrise Manor Center for Nursing & Rehabilitation, John J. Foley Skilled Nursing Facility, Bellhaven Nursing Center, and Grace Plaza Nursing Center. He has been Executive Director for several facilities since 1999 and took a lead position in New York State appointed Receiverships for Bethany Gardens (Rome, N.Y.) and Affinity Skilled Living & Rehabilitation Center (Oakdale, N.Y). During his tenure he has been responsible for developing proactive programs in the facilities to improve the quality of life and the level of care and compassion provided by facilities.
In 1999 he first became an owner of a skilled nursing facility and has been active in developing these facilities to meet the needs of the “Next Generation”. In March 2006, he became Owner/Operator of Hilaire Farm Nursing Home a 76 bed home in Huntington, New York. In February, 2008 Bob became the Owner/Operator of Nesconset Center for Nursing & Rehabilitation in Smithtown, New York and has brought his innovated philosophy and technology to this Facility as well.
Mr. Heppenheimer has served as President of Intercounty Health Facilities Association, a 55 member Nursing Home trade association on Long Island as well as on the Board of NYSHFA for many years. He currently serves on the Governing Board as well as the Legislative Committee for NYSHFA. He has lectured around the State on Culture Change and other nursing home related topics. He currently serves as Chairman of the Board for a charitable organization for stroke prevention and awareness, Judy’s Run and is a Board Member for LIGALY, Long Island Gay & Lesbian Youth not for profit organization.
CFO - Ronald Ranieri, M.B.A.
Mr. Ranieri was the Owner/Administrator of the Nesconset Nursing Center, a 240 bed Skilled Nursing Facility employing 350 people in Nesconset, New York, from its opening in August 1984 until the facility was sold in February 2008. Mr. Ranieri was responsible for the overall daily operation of the Nursing Facility and ensured that the facility was in total compliance with all required Federal, State and Local regulations. Under his direction, the facility was “deficiency free” in fifteen of the twenty-two unannounced annual surveys conducted by the New York State Department of Health, Office of Health Systems Management, a record not equaled by many Nursing Homes in New York State or the Nation. In addition, he established the first medical model Adult Day Health Services (Adult Day Care) Program on Long Island in 1985. In 1989, Nesconset Nursing Center became the first proprietary facility in New York State to open a free-standing medical model Adult Day Care Program. In September 1994 the Facility opened a second free-standing medical model Adult Day Care Program. Mr. Ranieri oversaw the operation of these Adult Day Health Services Programs which addressed the medical and social needs of 180 Registrants from the community, with a combined staff of 70 employees.
While in the Nursing Home industry, Mr. Ranieri was actively involved at both the local and state level. He held various Executive Officer positions (Treasurer, Secretary and Vice President) in the Suffolk County Health Facilities Association, an association of 31 Nursing Facilities caring for 5,200 Residents. He also was a committee member for many years on the Group Purchasing Committee and the Payment for Services Committee for the New York State Health Facilities Association, an association of 230 Nursing Facilities caring for 40,000 Residents. Mr. Ranieri holds an undergraduate degree in Economics from Lafayette College (Pennsylvania) and a master’s degree in Business Administration from Pace University (New York City).
CTO - Dr. David Deak (age:71) 
Dr. Deak is a physicist and noted contemporary artist with a very strong background through experience in art, science, and technology. Dr. Deak is an unusual combination of an artist and a physicist-technologist whose work is infused with a wealth of knowledge stemming from his scientific and technical background. Educated at the University of London, England (BS in Mathematics), Imperial College & Queen Mary College London, England (Masters of Science), and achieved a Ph.D. in physics from the University of Copenhagen, Denmark. He has lived in NY & London, where he has been active in theoretical physics, applied physics, inventing, engineering and is a respected artist as well. He has taught and consulted in these related fields for over forty years. Since the 1980’s, Dr. Deak has had many technologically ground-breaking inventions and been deeply involved in cutting edge research.

story:
Short Summary

CAMTech Computers has proudly served the good people of Collingswood for nine years and we intend to stay here for the foreseeable future. While we're keeping our basic bills paid, our front window lettering desperately needs to be replaced. The lettering has been peeling up and cracking for the last couple of years.

Please help us to maintain a positive image in town and get our lettering replaced. I would gladly contribute to any business here that needed the same.

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $700 to cover the cost of replacement vinyl, design cost, and removal of the old vinyl. I originally did the window lettering myself when we opened as I worked at a sign shop at the time. I know for a job of this size, $700 is in the low ballpark range but we can make up the difference if it's any higher.

We are offering the following for donations:

$25 - get 20% off your next computer repair

$100 - get 20% off computer repairs for life

$150 - get 25% off computer repairs for life plus a free CAMTech t-shirt

Other Ways You Can Help

Please let your friends and neighbors know we need help. It's difficult for small computer stores like ours to stay in business with big places like The Geek Squad to compete with. Also, if you know a sign shop who might be able to give us a better price on the lettering removal and replacement that would be a great referral.

story:
We have been working hard to acquire items for ModBoxx.  Seeking out the best of the best and making it easy for great products to arrive at your doorstep in one simple monthly boxx.

Our companies current goals are to:

-- Share great products with the everyday PC user.
-- Expand the the likes of great companies into more homes across the US and eventually cover the globe.  
-- To raise the overall awareness of PC modding.

    With the recent launch and announcement of our company, the current social popularity has been overwhelming, but greatly appreciated.  This is not a new business idea by any means and we are competing against some great and well established companies.  The only difference is these companies are all geared towards Geeks, Nerds, and Gamers.  We are targeting a unique industry in Custom PC Building and PC Modding.


    Our ModBoxx will include but not be limited to:

    Tools:
    Both Modding related and more generalized PC Tools.

    Safety Gear:
    Eye ware, Masks, Gloves, etc...

    Custom One-Off Items:
    Fan Grills, Case Badges, Mechanical Key Sets, Radiator Grills, etc...

    PC Collectibles:
    T Shirts, Banners, Posters, etc...

    PC Hardware:
    SLI/CFX Bridges, Fans, Fan Controllers, Fan Accessories, etc...

    Case Hardware:
    Nuts, Bolts, Feet, Handles, Lighting, Cable Management, etc...

    PSU Sleeving:
    Braided PET/Para-cord Sleeving, Pins, Connectors, Cable Combs, etc...

    Water Cooling:
    Fittings, Coolant, Tubing, etc...


    Our goal is set at $20,000, this is equal to our projected numbers of first year subscribers. This Indiegogo run is more of a "test the waters" campaign, then it is an actual "funding campaign" .  We will be allowing early subscribers to get exclusive first year rates (Gauranteed for the first year) and some added bonus items!

    Did I say Bonus Items?  We will not only be giving early subscribers their monthly boxx's at a reduced rate, but we have set aside some great items for donating.




    Non-Subscription Level. You just want to donate to help us grow! We will still give you a Bad-Ass Social Shout-out!


    Early Backer Month 2 Month Subscription Level + Bonus Items!

    (Currently Available to US Residents Only!)


    Early Backer 3 Month Subscription Level + Bonus Items!

    (Currently Available to US Residents Only!)


    Early Backer 6 Month Subscription Level + Bonus Items

    (Currently Available to US Residents Only!)


    We will be offering 4 ELITE Partnership slots.  What does this include?  Not only will you have a say in what ModBoxx does and offers in the future, but you will be a LIFETIME MEMBER!  More details provided upon request.




    What does this Campaign do for ModBoxx?

    The sheer amount of numbers generated early before the official launch will not only keep costs down, but will allow us to provide even more stuff in every boxx.  Larger numbers will receive greater attention from larger companies!

    If we reach the goal of 20k, ModBoxx will be off to a running start and will be able to get the boxxes out quicker and more efficient!

    If we exceed the 20k goal, we would be able to create a lot of the custom items in house.  This will also save us time and money.  In return, more stuff inside the boxes!




    The risk in joining this campaign and becoming an early subscriber is extremely low to nonexistent.  We at ModBoxx have already secured an EPIC TON of great things, and have more and more people/companies joining all the time.

    The only challenge I see is interest.  That all resides in you the early subscribers.  The more you share this campaign, the more we will grow and the quicker the Boxx's will hit your doorstep!  




    Every bit helps, even if its a simple share on Facebook, Tweet, or telling a friend or family member!  We appreciate all the help we can get in making this a successful launch.

    If you want to share on your favorite Social Network Indiegogo has preset functions at the top of this campaign!  Also don't forget to follow us on our Facebook & Twitter pages for even more updates!  

    Facebook -- https://www.facebook.com/epicmodboxx

    Twitter -- https://www.twitter.com/EpicModBoxx

story:
The Cool Hook has been Featured on 

New Inventions, Modern Technology And Interesting Facts of 21st Century
We added more than 2100 interesting posts about technology, modern inventions and interesting facts since we created this page last year on July 21st! If you are bored or you want to check it out, scroll down on to our timeline to see the posts.
Page: 111,830 like this
 
and
 
Ultimate Camping
Online magazine about Camping trips, tips and tricks. Gear reviews & other camping / hiking / biking / canoing related stuff
Page: 3,458 like this

 

The Cool Hook Story

The Cool Hook is a new innovative product for coolers. Instead of sitting your cooler on the ground or on a bench, hang your coolers with The Cool Hook! Field tested and lab tested for durability. Use The Cool Hook at parks, construction sites, camping areas, softball / baseball games and anywhere else you can use a cooler. We are confident that this will be the best selling cooler accessory sold across the nation because there isn't anything like this being sold. In order to keep our costs down we need to make large order. With the support of our Indiegogo fans we can bring this product into retail locations.

  • Holds 5 and 10 gallon water coolers
  • Also holds small to large sized food coolers
  • Lab tested to hold up to 800 lbs 
  • Keep your coolers off the ground, tables and benches

This is why we're here

In order to keep our manufacturing costs down we need to make a large order. We need to raise $15,250.00 to cover our first order plus shipping costs so we can send out our preorders to all of you wonderful Indiegogo fans. With your support we can make The Cool Hook a huge success!

Make your coolers a little bit Cooler

Do you or someone you know go to baseball or softball games? How about camping? The Cool Hook should be and will be on every construction site everywhere. 

Our funding success stands on the outcome of this Indiegogo campaign. If we don't raise the funds from the support of Indiegogo then we'll find our selves in a tough place to try and raise capital, which is extremely critical in getting our first order made. I have ACE Hardware lined up as one of our retail locations to start selling The Cool Hook but we can't fulfill any orders if we are unable to raise these funds. Your support means a lot! It's always been my dream to be a creative inventor. With the success of this product we will be able to build our business and work on the other products in our portfolio.   

 

Hey who do you KNOW ?

I understand that not everyone can contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help: Help us by spreading the word :)

Can you do us a huge favor? Send this link out to your friends and family. By sending this out to the social networks you are connected to, you might single handily help get us funded. I truly believe you can, so just take a few moments and let someone know. Good deeds never go unlooked and we appreciate your support. 

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

All of you supporters are Amazing!

Thank You so much

Loren Alberts

Creator of The Cool Hook

story:
Legal Aid of Marin wants to tell YOUR story.

In fact, we want to tell 101 stories!

Do you work in Marin but live elsewhere?

Ever notice all of that traffic on Hwy 101? Imagine if you had to spend 1 – 2 (or more) hours on it each morning and evening just to get to work and back home again.

Have you asked your local police officer, your favorite grocery store clerk or your child’s teacher where they live?  This is often an AHA moment when you realize how much time is spent commuting by the important people in your family's lives.

We want to hear the stories of the people working in Marin County who can’t afford to live here; the people who spend much of their time driving up and down Hwy 101 getting to and from work. Did you know 60% of the individuals who work in Marin County cannot afford to live here?!

We need your help in raising funds to hire an experienced storyteller who will interview, explore, and record the stories of these hard working individuals. The funds and the 101 stories will help support Legal Aid of Marin staff members as they advocate for reasonable, affordable housing to local and state officials.  

The 101 stories will also support the implementation of Marin County's 10-Year Plan to End Homelessness and pave the way for developers to create new affordable homes primarily located near transit along Highway 101.

For the cost of your morning cup of coffee YOU could be part of the movement to reduce traffic on Hwy 101! YOU could help hard working families find affordable housing near where they work and YOU could help create an AHA moment in Marin County! We need your help!  Whether you contribute $1 or more than $10,000, you will be helping to make a difference!

Click here or click on the the big red Contribute Now button located at the top, right of your screen to make a donation and pick your perk! For a $25 donation, you can wear your support with this attractive Legal Aid of Marin lapel pin!

 

AHA for Health

Affordable housing improves health outcomes for lower income working families through housing stability, reduced stress and an increased availability of services.  Children that live in affordable housing benefit from reduced moves, increased educational achievement and improved indoor environmental quality.

Please join our campaign, support Legal Aid of Marin with a donation and make an impact on Marin's AHA moment.



Thank you!
Paul Cohen, Executive Director, Legal Aid of Marin

Email Paul at pcohen@legalaidmarin.org to send your story or to connect us with someone who may want to share their story. Please also join our campaign by lending your financial support.

Note:  Any stories or comments received in response to this request may be preserved or used at the sole discretion of Legal Aid of Marin.

Visit www.legalaidmarin.org to learn more about our non-profit Marin-based agency serving the community since 1958.

Please ‘LIKE’ us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter!

Share your stories!
#101stories #AHAmoment

story:
The Transformer Table 3.0 Collection of signature hardwood tables, benches, Coffee Tables and Chairs were intentionally designed to cultivate beautiful, functional spaces that bring people together. 

From 18" to 118", our expandable dining room tables are built with an integrated extension feature that allows you to adjust the table for any space or gathering.

The new Transformer Table collection includes 5 signature products: 

The Transformer Table

Transformer Counter Height 

Transformer Bench

Coffee Table - Panel Storage Unit 

Transformer Chairs 

 Offering unrivaled multi-functionality and adaptability.

 

Creating the best dining table was not easy. Our team of engineers, carpenters and designers worked around the clock for the past 2 years, testing prototype after prototype, and finally got to a product we know you will love and be able to use for a very long time.

Made from 100% hardwood, the Transformer Table serves as a bold focal point in any living space. This extendable dining table adjusts from 18" to 118", seating up to 12 guests, and can fit perfectly in any home.

Extend your Table - Extend an invitation. From 18 inches to 10 feet and seating up to 12 of your guests, the Transformer Table expands to accommodate a lot people and slims down to a console size.

The Transformer Table's innovative magnetite steel ball bearing telescopic mechanism, providing complete flexibility and is sure to WOW all your guests when you open it up.

The mag latch returns underneath each panel hook into each other, providing a perfect fit and stabilization.

 

Its adjustable middle leg moves side to side, provides complete flexibility for all your guests. It also hides inside the legs, when you don’t need it.

 Complementing perfectly the Transformer Table our Transformer Bench extends all the way up to 11 feet and seats up to 6 of your guests.

The Transformer bench also allows you to store all your unused panels within the integrated storage box.

The Transformer Bench also feature a magnetite steel ball bearing mechanism. Extending the bench from 28 inches to 11 feet.

The Benches mag latch returns provide a completely stabilized designed, creating a sturdy seating arrangement, seating up to 6 people and supporting up to 1500Lbs.

Best part of it all, we’ve designed it to be much more than a simple dining bench. Its sleek and versatile design can also be used for all kinds of other things.

 

WONDERING WHERE YOU’LL STORE ALL THOSE TABLE PANELS?

Only use the panels you need, when you need them, and just store the others within your coffee table. 

 

The new Transformer Coffee Table was designed to be just as versatile as all our other products. You can now store all your unused table panels inside the integrated compartment.

Multifunctionality is everywhere! Use it as a coffee table, but also for storage or even as an extendable shelving unit.

Complementing perfectly your Table or Dining Set, the Transformer Chairs have been designed to create a beautiful style and environment in your dining room. 

This mid-century dining table is made with 100% Mahogany hardwood for a classic yet sleek look of simple luxury and minimalism. Its dark brown features are perfect to give your home a natural, warm presence.

Marked by uniquely-scored distressing and earthy wood grain detail, the Siberian Birch finish brings an elegant look that’s both inviting and relaxing. Finished with a wire brush, the surface of this table is lightly textured and variable across individual pieces.

The Dark Oak table brings a bold and luxurious presence to any dining space. With balanced steel-brushed detailing and charming dark features, this finish is sure to exude a refined, contemporary look and feel.

Made from solid acacia wood, this finish inspires an elegant rustic look with an edge of contemporary chic. This table radiates the natural elegance of smooth hardwood that easily complements any decor style.

The Arctic White table is the definition of modern design. Its smooth and sleek look resonates the innovative edge and view of modern condos and housing. 

 

Our innovative ball bearing telescopic mechanism is the heart of the Transformer Table. It easily allows you to extend the table from 18 inches to its full size of 118 inches. It's ball bearing component allows the track system to slide with very little effort. This cutting-edge technology is what makes our products stand out from the rest.

When fully extended at 118 inches (10 Feet), the ball bearing mechanism can support up to 750Lbs of weight.

The magnetite grade steel used in the manufacturing of our telescopic mechanism provide the sturdiest and most robust table mechanism ever seen.  We're so convinced of its quality that we offer a LIFETIME WARRANTY on all our mechanism.

 

 

 ITS SURE TO AMAZE ALL YOUR GUESTS!! WE GUARANTEE IT

 

 Soslan Tsoutsiev - President  Zaur Pkhalagov - Director   Alexandre Dore - CoFounder 

    Richard Mabley - B&D       Artem Kuzmichev - Media   Cedric Deltandre - Int.Relations

    Bogdan Luncasu - Engineer   Natalia Lemieux - Logistics   Cesar Delvasto - Creatives

       Holland Wabley - Sales         Cindy Ramelson - Accounting           Django - Mascot

story:
It shouldn’t be difficult or inconvenient to understand the water you’re using at your property, where it’s going, and how much it costs. Yet until now, our only insight is an abstract and sometimes costly bill at the end of the month.

Meet bluebot™, an intelligent clamp-on universal water meter that solves these issues, and more. Featuring real time flow data, custom alerts, and the ability to Dollarize™ your usage, bluebot helps you effectively and proactively monitor your property’s water from anywhere.

Are you familiar with water shut offs and pipe cutting? Thanks to bluebot, you don’t have to be. Simply clamp it on and you're on your way to control. After bluebot is on your pipe, plug in to power, open the app and connect via Wi-Fi.

The bluebot device can be placed on main line or irrigation, pool house, guest house, individual property units, and more. We recommend using bluebot on single family homes, townhouses, condos and apartments, small businesses, second homes – really, any property you can think of up to a 2” water line.

The bluebot device is an essential tool for home owners, property managers, vacation rental companies, HOA’s, disaster preparedness companies, small business owners, and more.

We are in production. Backing this campaign with a product purchase guarantees you will receive the product. We will be delivering the first units in October 2020.

Shipping is complete! 

As of November, 2020, all backer orders have been fulfilled! Thank you so much for your support! To order your own bluebot with the quickest fulfillment, we recommend ordering directly through shop.bluebot.com

 

As a special thank you, every single backer who gets a bluebot device will be grandfathered in to an Indiegogo exclusive VIP bluebot™ account, ensuring there are no additional fees, ever. As our campaign continues to grow, new perks & features will be unlocked. Be sure to share with your friends to keep the updates coming!

The first 100 bluebot devices will come with an exclusive VIP backer edition hat and rapid fulfillment. 

Throughout the development of bluebot, we've heard countless water stories about leaks while a property was left unattended, surprise water bills, toilets refilling for hours on end, and rogue irrigation systems to name a few. We've heard them all, and they're almost always bad (and expensive).

We're ready to change the narrative, making your next water story a good one with bluebot.

Property Owner's Story

“I noticed that my water usage was increasing but I was not doing anything differently. I could not figure out where the excess water was going. With bluebot, I could easily see when different devices were using water. I looked at my recent usage and found one of my low-flow toilets was flushing more water than intended – a lot more water. We were able to quickly find the problem and shut off the water, then get a replacement kit from the hardware store and resolve the problem. It was great to have the ability to see my water usage in detail and know that I can help our community save water during a drought!”   
-James 

Vacation Rental Owners

“I wish I had bluebot sooner. A few months ago, I had a huge leak at my vacation rental property that resulted in a $1200 bill! I live a few hours away, and the house often goes unattended for weeks at a time. I have other smart home devices that allow me to monitor other parts of my home, but nothing has been available like bluebot. I am so happy I found this device! I put two on my vacation rental – One on the main line and another on the irrigation. The irrigation line is especially useful for me to avoid overwatering. I’ve ordered another to put on my main house because it’s so easy to control from within the app!”
-Terry

Small Business Owners

“As a small business during COVID, we’re doing everything we can to get a better handle on our monthly expenses. Water is one of the most ambiguous utilities we pay. It’s extremely hard to get a grasp on where it might be going. I  have started reducing my monthly usage and with their cool Dollarize feature, I can keep track of what my bill is looking like day to day throughout the month. No more surprises!”
- Robert

 

When bluebot identifies constant or erratic water use, you'll get alerted of a possible leak or that water has been left running, allowing you to take action to protect your property (and wallet) from potential damage.

This is especially important for those who manage multiple properties at once or are highly conscious of their monthly expenses, such as vacation rental owners and small business owners.

The bluebot device can be placed indoors or outdoors. You should not dunk bluebot into a pool, but bluebot is water resistant so you can place it on outdoor water lines such as irrigation without worry.

Have you ever wondered what your monthly water bill looks like broken down into weekly or daily intervals? Have you ever found yourself wondering how much you’re spending on hand washing compared to your dishwasher, or if your irrigation is costing you more than you’d like?

We did. That is why we integrated the ability to Dollarize your usage into the bluebot app. Most people relate usage to dollars, not gallons.

All municipalities charge for water a little differently based on a variety of factors. You can have bluebot reference average national rates or go custom by adding your own water bill so bluebot can calculate your particular costs.

Simply toggle your view to see how much each water event or usage period is costing you. You can also create dollar-specific alerts to get notified throughout your billing cycle, or opt-in to the integrated coaching program to have bluebot intelligently (and practically) guide you to achieving your goals.

Capturing around 43,200 data points per day, bluebot captures live flow data and shows it in the app within just seconds, sometimes faster. Real time flow data is relayed through our cloud to your mobile device no matter where you are. Our state-of-the-art high-resolution capture of flow readings allow our platform to display your water usage and patterns in unprecedented detail.

While live flow is great for capturing events as they happen, historic data allows you to analyze trends and pinpoint specific water events. The bluebot app’s graph displays Live, 1 Day, 1 Week, 1 Month, 3 Months & Custom Date Ranges. You can view and scroll through the past week, month, or 3 months to analyze trends. Simply press and hold on the bar to zero in on that day, then pinch & zoom even further to get even more detail for that period. You can also drag a window around a range of spikes to determine your usage and Dollarize the cost.

 

The bluebot app includes an optional coaching program. It uses your monthly bill and your savings goal to automatically update you throughout the month on your progress. Simply ask bluebot to help you save on your monthly bill. 

Take total control with the robust alerting and notification options within the bluebot app. Unlike other water meters that only notify you when they see fit, bluebot puts you in total control. Set alerts based on your monitoring preferences: flow over time, gallons, dollars, irrigation and more. We're constantly brainstorming new alert formats as we receive feedback from our bluebot community!

Our newest alert will allow you to start tracking your usage as you begin washing your car, and notify you when you reach a dollar limit.

Have you ever wondered what day of the week you use the most water? Or the longest amount of time you left the water running?

Thanks to bluebot's configurable statistics, now you can easily see your water data at a glance. Toggle and prioritize daily total gallons, highest flow rate, longest continuous flow, peak usage day and time, and your total water savings since adding bluebot onto your property.

Similar to alerts, we are constantly thinking of new statistics we can add to make bluebot even more useful to analyze your water trends.

Through the bluebot app, you can connect endless bluebot devices and manage multiple devices across many properties with ease, from anywhere in the world. The most common application is placing one on your property's main line, and another on your irrigation line. 

You can share your devices, and have devices shared with you to help family & friends keep an eye on their property's water usage, as well.

 

In 2017, our founders set to work developing a compact, universal flow meter that could be installed by anyone, nearly anywhere. Over the next three years, the device's effortless installation and technology was refined, brand, interface design, and feature set began, with a focus on ultimate simplicity. 

bluebot evolution 2017-2020

The bluebot device meets all requisite standards required of consumer electronic devices set by the FCC and CE. We also hold a US patent on our technology. 

In May 2020, we distributed 50 v8.0 devices to homes spread across California, Washington, Utah, Georgia, Michigan, and one even made its way to Dubai.

During the alpha test, we gained valuable insight into real-world use cases, allowing us to make another round of updates to our hardware, software & app prior to launching on Indiegogo.


Here is a bluebot device installed in a typical downstairs laundry room on the main cold water line.

Our users were able to reduce their property's water bill by up to 42% over the course of three months by implementing very small changes to their water use habits.

Each year our population grows substantially. Our nation, and our planet’s water infrastructure is having a harder and harder time keeping up. It is no surprise that national water rates have risen over 30% in the past decade, outpacing inflation.

This increase in population is resulting in a substantial growth of usage, that we won’t be able to sustain forever.

Water is the planet’s most precious resource. And one that we can’t simply get or make more of. Even though our blue planet is 75% covered by water, just 0.003% of it is actually fit for use and human consumption. ¹

At the rate we’re going, our planet will run out of water in less than 20 years. ²

Getting a handle on our own, individual usage is the first step in being able to understand our options for a more sustainable future. Our hope is that bluebot makes it easier for everyone to understand their usage while mitigating unforeseen, costly water events.

More than that, we hope that bluebot will play a role in the movement for better water usage practices by helping bring awareness to the over-usage and the practical areas most properties can conserve, to help water demand from exceeding supply and prevent larger water stress for future generations. 

Our team is comprised of flow industry experts, a Harvard Law alum, a Yale water scientist, a team of talented engineers and one particularly creative duo. Our balanced team has adopted agile IoT development practices with a focus on Quality, Delivery, People, Innovation, and Customer Support. We believe that excellence in these five areas will result in the best product and the happiest customers.

California  Shenzhen

From left to right: Jack, ZhangJing, Lin, Mr. Xiao, Hezihao, Liguangzhao, Huangjiaming, Zhanwenxiang (not pictured, Tina)

Our shared concern with the ambiguity and over-usage of water, one of the most essential resources on the planet, has shaped bluebot into what it is today - far more than just a water meter. 

Our major goal is to get a bluebot™ on every home. The current priority is to get our app and device out in the field with your help, allowing us to make rapid improvements to our AI engine and coaching. Next, we will share bluebot™ with the world.  

Supporting bluebot™ by backing this campaign, or sharing with your family & friends on social media would truly mean the world to us.

Our team’s founding members include two ultrasonic flow industry experts with a combined 55 years of flow product development expertise, with special focus on ultrasonic sensor technology and flow calibration.

The bluebot™ water flow calibration loop calibrates each device on all commonly used pipe sizes and types found in homes and light commercial (¾” – 2” Copper, PVC, PEX & Galvanized).

Our production facility uses dozens of quality control processes throughout each stage of the manufacturing process. Every device receives complete functional and final QC testing before being shipped to you.

 

The primary engineering challenges are long behind us. After nearly four years of product development and iteration, bluebot v8.1 is our most reliable device yet, and ready for the next phase of robust real-world testing.

Our main potential source of risk and challenge, like most other innovative IoT products, is the connection. Wi-Fi signal is subject to interference. Wi-Fi signal strength and stability vary greatly from home to home, and from provider to provider. Through our testing, the biggest hurdle for our Alpha group has been finding a reliable Wi-Fi signal. Most users have been able to easily remedy this issue with a simple Wi-Fi extender placed between their main router and their bluebot device.

Another potential source of risk and challenge is finding your water line. Though most homes can be traced from the street meter back to the home with ease, some older homes have more complex plumbing systems and for those un-familiar with their home, this may take more than a few minutes.

A last challenge we want to outline is that we could experience hardware failures. We are using tried and true ultrasonic flow technology, but in a way that’s never been done before, in a very small package. This means very small parts, which can experience failure from time to time. We have been testing extensively, and will continue to do so, but there could be unusual scenarios that we had not thought of in the real world that could cause the bluebot device to not work as accurately or precisely as we expect it to. We will be actively monitoring these issues and will respond to all feedback from the backer community.

One final note that is less of a risk but more of a notice to backers in the Android community: We have not yet developed the Android version of the bluebot app. In the interest of efficiency and integrity, we have spent the past 9 months of R&D on our iOS app, so we can have a full picture of what the Android app should also offer. This has saved our team an exponential amount of time, allowed us to create a more complete vision for both versions of the app, and afforded us the ability to maintain a higher focus on overall performance. Thanks to our wonderful backers, we will be starting our Android app development very soon. Backers should expect the Android app to be released near the end of 2020. Please check back often for updates.

 

 

 

If you have any questions, at any time during or after the campaign has closed, you can always reach out to a member of our team at hello@bluebot.com 

If you’d like to write a story about bluebot, feel free to contact Nicole at nicole@bluebot.com and we would be happy to send along our media kit as well as answer any questions you may have.

What’s your water story? We’d love to hear it!  Share on your favorite social media platform using #mywaterstory and tag us @heybluebot  

 

 

Sources: [1] [2]
