story:
NEOJI Media Coverage


    

    

        

     

     

 " Neoji is a sensor-packed home security, safety And efficiency monitoring hub"  -- TechCrunch

 "We just came across one smart home device that packs in just about every smart home function into one place " -- Tech Faster

"The first  all in one smart home device that puts the environment first" -- Digital Journal

"Neoji, the all-in-one smart home device, allows homeowners to be safe, secure and proactive" -- PR Web

 " Neoji is definitely designed to help you monitor your home's energy levels, so you can make the proper adjustments to save you money and the planet as well"   -- The Geek Church

 "There are not nearly  as many smart home hubs that offer all of those controls from one central device"--  Best Home Security Companys

"Neoji, la box domotique qui rend votre maison zen et connectée"-- Connected-Objects

" Neoji veut rendre votre maison intelligente" -- Stuffi 


                                                  

Imagine you had a magic portal to see into your home when you weren’t there.

Imagine you could ensure the home you worked so hard for was always protected.

Imagine you could slash your energy bill and do your part to save the planet.

Imagine that you didn’t have to constantly worry about your cherished sleeping baby, your unsteady aged parent, your fractious pets...

Neoji is a sleek and elegant device, with artificial intelligence that directs smart sensors to track nearly every movement or event in your home or office environment. 

http://www.neoji.com

It’s new, and it’s going to revolutionize the way you take care of your family, your home, and our planet.

Neoji’s name sprang from Chinese origins, “Neo” meaning new, and “ji” meaning crucial moment or machine, and perfectly reflects the opportunity it provides for you and your home.

Neoji is a sleek and elegant device that functions like a Zen master for your home, creating a sanctuary of comfort, calm, and cost-efficiency.    

Neoji understands what is happening in your home at any moment, day or night.  Its artificial intelligence directs smart sensors to track nearly every event in your home’s environment.  It learns to ignore routine events in your home, while still alerting you instantly if the sensors detect any anomalous change or unexpected reading.  

When something unusual does occur, Neoji’s smart technology knows what to do.  You can program instant notifications to be sent to you, a family member, your doctor, or even the fire or police department if you’re far from home.  And caring for those more vulnerable family members is Neoji’s specialty. 


Whether it’s listening in to the nursery where your baby slumbers, or keeping tabs on your aging (and sometimes forgetful) parents, Neoji will alert you instantly of any problems or concerns.  Just like when your children are tiny and dependent, the same thing happens with our parents as they age, though they’re loathe to admit it!  They took care of you, now it’s your turn.  And Neoji will be your partner to ensure you’ll instantly know if they experience a fall, leave the stove burner on, or if there is an unexpected presence in their home.  

Soaring energy costs have taken their toll on consumers, who have little control until their bill arrives.  Neoji puts the control back in your hands, so you can track your energy and water consumption each day and take steps to reduce your consumption—and save money.

Neoji talks to all your smart devices—heating, cooling, lights, and even your fridge!  No, it doesn’t run down to the market for a bottle of wine, but if it’s possible, we’ll figure it out!

The true magic of Neoji lies in how it can benefit our environment.  You’ve seen the news reports, you’ve heard the statistics, and the news is never good.  At times, it’s easy to feel helpless and ineffectual, like you can’t do anything to make a real impact.  With Neoji’s guiding hand, you can make a difference, affecting concrete changes to your energy consumption, protecting biodiversity, and creating a greener community where you live.

INTELLIGENT, INTUITIVE, and USER FRIENDLY

Neoji will care for your home and everything it contains.  State of the art sound sensors can hear unusual activity; movement sensors can detect an intruding presence when no one is at home, and air quality sensors can detect humidity, a gas leak, abnormal temperature fluctuations, or the presence of smoke or other air pollutants.  

It can also arm parents with confidence.  Of course you know your child is in good hands with your nanny or babysitter, but have you ever felt that niggling sense, that urgency to just check in and be sure they are ok?  Go ahead, have a look.  Neoji gives you the reassurance to put your mind at rest.  

When anything happens, Neoji knows what to do.  You can program notifications to instantly be sent to you, a friend, a family member, the police, or even your doctor.  Even if you’re far from home, help will be instantly summoned.  

Neoji understands your home and learns its rhythms over time, and its sensors adapt to your needs.  

Life is complicated, busy, and at times chaotic.  Neoji is about simplifying your life and providing peace of mind.  Be your own Zen master, with the help of this single clever little device.  

SAFETY    SAVINGS     SUSTAINABILITY    SATISFACTION 

Whether it’s your home, your cottage, an apartment rental, or the office, Neoji is your go anywhere partner.  Neoji is portable and moves along with you, unlike traditional security systems.  

And you can monitor it from any smart phone or tablet.  Alerts are received instantly, from anywhere.    

You’ve got enough in life to worry about:  fixing the car, saving for your next holiday, figuring out how to dodge the next visit from your in-laws—there are a multitude of things we can’t control.  

Let Neoji help you with the things you can control—reducing energy consumption, saving money, and make our world a better place to live—for you and your children.  

Neoji is always with you, a perceptive presence that ultimately simplifies your life.  Who knew it could be so easy?  


The result is:

  1. Giving you the control over energy costs and consumption: soaring energy costs have taken their toll on consumers, who have little control until they get their bills.  Neoji puts the control back in your hands, so you can track your energy and water consumption each day and take steps to reduce your consumption—and save money.
  2. In addition, Neoji acts as a security device, and will care for your home and everything it contains.  State of the art sound sensors can hear unusual activity; movement sensors can detect an intruding presence when no one is at home, and air quality sensors can detect humidity, a gas leak, abnormal temperature fluctuations, or the presence of smoke or other air pollutants.  
  3. It can also arm parents with safety and confidence.  Of course you know your child is in good hands with your nanny or babysitter, but have you ever felt that niggling sense, that urgency to just check in and be sure they are ok?  Go ahead, have a look.  Neoji gives you the reassurance and put your mind at rest. You simply program notifications to instantly be sent to you, a friend, a family member, the police, or even your doctor.  Even if you’re far from home, help will be instantly summoned. 


Sensors

High sensitivity sensors are driven by software that can recognize normal movements in your home, so your pets won’t set off the sensor constantly.

  • Microphone
  • Motion sensor
  • Air quality sensor 
  • Humidity sensor
  • Temperature sensor
  • HD camera * 

* Neoji Grand Zen Master version

Care

  • Sound and voice recognition
  • Machine learning algorithms
  • Baby monitoring
  • Pet monitoring
  • Fall detection
  • Presence simulation
  • Neoji’s LED Mood indicator light
  • Zen music: Neoji can play a soft and peaceful music for your child
  • Zen alarm: Neoji plays alarm sounds when an alert is triggered

Personalised Service

  • 24/7 client support
  • Neoji mobile app
  • Wall-mounted version
  • Family Coaching: our experts answer your questions online about your home and your family
  • Energy coaching and personalised advice to reduce your bills and take care of the environment
  • Removable brushed aluminium logo

About us

Neoji was founded by a team of experts, passionate about technology, web development and smart home. We are recruiting talents! 

See more about Neoji's team: http://www.neoji.com/#about-us

We would like to invite our fellow developers to use this open technology, and create and develop their own applications with Neoji.  We strongly believe in the power of the community to build efficient, open smart home and smart building solutions. The more co-developers we have involved, the faster our product will evolve in varied environments.  In the end, everyone benefits with more highly efficient and sophisticated technology. 

Where we are today: how you can help

Neoji started as an idea for an affordable technology that could change with way we interact with our home and plant the seeds of environmental awareness in people around the planet.  It has been a labour of love.

The Neoji prototype was born from the hard work of a team of experts, passionate about new technologies, especially “The Internet of Things”.  We are appealing to early users, lovers of technology, and community members to support the further development and refinement of the Neoji. 

Your help is crucial to bringing this innovative, beautiful and environmental device to a market reality, so people anywhere can make their home a better, safer, and more efficient place. 

Our initial target is to raise $100,000, we can't do this without you! Join hands with us to move our world into a better future: we have various options in place for your contribution that will meet your individual needs (detailed under perks).



Frequently Asked Questions ...

Q.  How many Neoji’s do I need for my home?  Will one unit monitor my entire home?

A.  1 unit can monitor 1 or 2 rooms.  2-3 units would be appropriate for a bigger house or office.

Q.  Can I take my Neoji with me when I go to the cottage or on holiday?

A.  Of course!  Just unplug and tuck it under your arm.  Arrive, plug in, and you’re ready to go.  But please tell me you didn't forget the corkscrew?!

Q.  Can I set up a Neoji at my parent’s house and program it from anywhere?

A.  Yes, of course!  You can easily plug a Neoji and program it using the free mobile app.

Q.  Will it work in my baby’s room?  Can I see as well as hear my baby if he/she needs me?

A.  Yes. Neoji has been designed with babies in mind.  It will be perfect in your baby’s room and you will be able to follow your baby’s nap from anywhere in your house.

Q.  When will Neoji be available for delivery?

A.  The product is still in development, so we are aiming for April 2015 for delivery.

If you want to be the really first to have a Neoji at home, you can have it by March 2015 by choosing the Early Adopter perk.

Q.  How is the Neoji powered?  Does it plug in or is it battery operated?

A.  Neoji has a lithium-ion battery to be used wireless, but it can also be plugged in, if you prefer.

Q.  What happens if there is a power outage or my internet connection isn’t working?

A.  Rest assured, Neoji has back up power with its lithium-ion battery, and continues to follow events and records what’s happening in its local memory.  You can access everything when the power comes back.

Q.  Is it easy to set up and link to my phone?

A.  Yes!  It syncs easily to your smart device, connect with the cloud Smart Conso platform.

Q.  Will it work with my family’s other phones?A.  Yes, it can connect with multiple smart phones, if needed. 

Q.  Does it matter what kind of smart phone I have?  Does it work with android, iPhone, and Blackberry?

A.    Our mobile app works with Android and iPhone.

Q.  Can the Neoji be wall or ceiling mounted?

A.  We have designed a wall-mounted version, and will provide you with materials to fix the device on a wall.

Q.  Do I need a specific type of heating or lighting system for Neoji to work?

A.  Our goal is to cover the widest range of compatible devices.  Please contact us regarding a specific system

  compatibility. 

Q.  Will it work in North America or Australia with the different electrical currents?

A.  Yes, it will work anywhere in the world, but will require an adapter for different electrical currencies. 

Q.  What if I don’t have Wi-Fi? Can it be linked to my hard-wired internet connection?

A.  Neoji can also connect through an Ethernet connection. 

Q.  What is the Neoji’s range of vision with the camera?  Does it rotate or swivel?  Or does it only see things

when they move into the camera’s line of vision?

A.  Neoji’s camera has a 180° range and is fixed.  You can configure it to have the best angle of vision.

Q.  Will it work with my camera, TV, or other smaller appliances around the house?

A.  Neoji works with devices that use standard protocols such as Zigbee, 6LoWPAN.  We will post regular updates about compatible devices.

Q.  Will my pets set off alerts?  That could be a real pain...

A.  Neoji’s smart software was created for just such situations!  Neoji’s software will learn the rhythms and patterns of your home and its activity. The more you work with Neoji, the smarter it becomes, and the more customized it will be to your home.

Q.  Can I turn Neoji off if I don’t need the monitoring feature for a period of time?

A.  Yes.  You can switch Neoji off.

Q.  Can the Neoji be hacked?  Is my information secure?

A.  We use bank-level security standards for data encryption. Your data is stored securely on our cloud platform and is not communicated to anyone.

Q.  Can I remove the brushed aluminium logo?

A.  Yes, you can change the look of your Neoji by removing the brushed aluminium logo. You can put it again when you want.

Q.  Can I use Neoji as a gateway to collect data from my meters?

A.  Yes, Neoji can communicate with smart meters equipped with an open protocol such as Zigbee, 6LoWPAN, Enocean, KNX, etc.  The list of compatible meters will be updated on our website regularly. Neoji serves as a gateway to collect data. You can follow your consumption with the app.

Q.  Can I check my energy consumption with Neoji?

A.  Yes.  Neoji tracks your usages and identifies peak usage times so you can determine where you can make changes and save money.

Q.  Can I control electric devices with Neoji?

A.  Yes, Neoji was designed to control devices through protocols like Zigbee, 6LoWPAN, Enocean or KNX. Of course, 100% of devices won’t be compatible at the beginning. We are still at the beginning of the smart home wave, and we are striving to add as many devices as possible.

Q. How many Neoji’s do I need for my home?  Will one unit monitor my entire home?

A.  1 unit can monitor 1 or 2 rooms.  2-3 units would be appropriate for a bigger house or office.

Q.  When will Neoji be delivered?

A.  The product is still in development, we are aiming to deliver in  March/April 2015 .

Q.  Is it easy to set up and link to my phone?

A.  Yes!  It syncs easily to your smart device, connect with the cloud Smart Conso platform.

Q.  Will it work with my family’s other phones?

A.  Yes, it can connect with multiple smart phones, if needed. 

Q.  Can the Neoji be wall or ceiling mounted?

A.  Yes, see the wall-mounted version.

Q.  Do I need a specific type of heating or lighting system for Neoji to work?

A.  Our goal is to cover the widest range of compatible devices.  Please contact us regarding a specific system compatability. 

Q.  Will it work in North America or Australia with the different electrical currents?

A.  Yes, it will work anywhere in the world, but will require an adapter for different electrical currencies. 

Q.  What if I don’t have Wi-Fi? Can it be linked to my hard-wired internet connection?

A.  Neoji can also connect through an Ethernet connection. 

You are passionate about the environment and the future of our planet, but can't contribute yet? 

Help us spread the word, use the Indiegogo share tools! 

http://www.neoji.com

don’t have Wi-Fi? Can it be linked to my hard-wired internet connection?
A.  Neoji can also connect through an
Ethernet connection. You are passionate about the environment and the future of our planet, but can't contribute yet? Help us spread the word, use the Indiegogo share tools! http://www.neoji.com

story:
The Ultimate Hands-free Vacuuming Solution 

Neabot  is the most powerful robot vacuum featuring an innovative self-emptying dustbin system. With Neabot, it makes it possible for you to schedule your cleaning and let it do the rest without any intervention even for weeks.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

For years of evolution, floor vacuuming with the robot still remains little more than a tedious housework for us. Poor navigation, inadequate delivery. Not to speak of the inconvenience of emptying and cleaning the dustbin for it. Very frustrating!

 

 

Thankfully, Neabot is here to make your life easier. Neabot can empty its dustbin and resume the cleaning task automatically without you interacting with them. So you can forget about the cleaning chores for weeks and focus on other productivity tasks.

 

Product Review by SupraPixel

 

 

 

 

 

 

Automatic Dirt Collecting & Disposal

Forget about vacuuming for upto a month with Neabot self-emptying dustbin. Neabot automatically transfers the dirt collected from the robot into the bag-lined dustbin without you having to touch the mess.

 

 

Set it and forget it! The Auto-sealed dust bag holds 2 to 4 weeks of dirt and debris for easy disposal without the cloud of dust.

 

 

 

Strong Suction with 2700Pa

Neabot can easily carry out more heavy cleaning tasks with its unbeatable suction power of 2700Pa. Two side brushes and a roller brush effectively loosen, extract, and vacuum dirt to give a superior clean.

 

Multi-Level Vacuuming Modes

Utilized 3 levels of suction power including Small, Regular, and Strong modes, Neabot easily tackles any mess whether for regular or deeper cleaning.

 

 

Deeper Carpet Cleaning

Neabot comes with smart carpet identification that recognizes carpet flooring and automatically boosts the suction for extracting pet hair and other debris from carpet fibers. And it can climb across thresholds of up to 2cm in height with ease.

 

 

One Charge, 200m² of Cleaning

With a large battery capacity of 5200mAh, Neabot cleans upto 3.5 hours per charge for a space of about 200m²(2150 ft²).

 

 

 

 

Smart Route Planning & Customizable Cleaning Strategy

Neabot can learn the environment and figure out an optimized cleaning routine. The technologies of Lidar Navigation and the Simultaneous Localization and Mapping (SLAM) literally make Neabot smarter than ever.

 

 

Neabot uses a z-shaped vacuuming pattern, instead of just randomly traveling around, which tends to be a more efficient way to clean.

 

 

Once the map is saved, you can ask Neabot to clean the rooms that you want it to and set the daily cleaning strategy as you wish.

 

 

Zone Cleaning & No-go Zone & Scheduled Cleaning

With the Neabot APP, you can adjust cleaning settings, customize the cleaning strategy, and monitor the cleaning status and more no matter where you are.

 

 

 

With a room map saved, you can tell the robot to clean only certain parts of the room and to stay out of others. Simply drag the bounding box to the area you want cleaned, it's done.

 

 

You can also place virtual "no-go" zones from within the app, sectioning off any particular areas or boundaries to prevent your robot from going there.

 

 

Neabot allows users to schedule a specific room to be cleaned at different times and on different dates, providing truly convenient and effortless home cleaning.

 

 

 

 

 

You can direct the robot to clean any exact spot you want it to clean and it will clean the localized area of 5*5 ft (1.6*1.6 m) around it.

 

 

 

 

Bumper & Cliff Sensors & Wall Sensors And More

What makes a robot cleaner robotic is the precision of the navigation sensors. With multiple smart sensors, Neabot avoids obstacles with ease and tackles tough terrain effortlessly.

 

 

When Neabot knocks into something, its bumper retracts and the sensors tell the robot to find a clear path.

 

 

The cliff sensors help Neabot sense the edges and avoid it falling from heights.

 

 

The wall sensors let Neabot follow very closely along walls and around objects without touching them.

 

 

 

 

 

When the battery starts to run out of juice the vacuum will return automatically to its charging base.

 

 

 

 

 

After a constant effort of 2 years, we have finally brought the idea of  Neabot to life. This unboxing video will give you a close look at the "real" Neabot.

Product Demo #1: Neabot Unboxing Video

 

Product Demo #2: Neabot Floor Cleaning Video

 

Product Demo #3: Neabot Pet Hair Vacuuming Video

 

 

We've recently finished Neabot's 2nd round pilot production. Problems found in the first round have been fixed and new features including Alexa and Google Assistant have been added. Now we are doing testing in factory until it's fully ready for mass production, which is scheduled in July. There are still some small bugs, mainly app-related ones, waiting to be fixed. But the schedule is on track overall. Here are some pictures and videos from factory. More information about the production will be shared later.  

 

Spread the word to your families, friends and people around you. You can earn 15% cash back, from every pledge you bring in to our campaign through your unique Kickbooster referral link.

story:
This campaign has ended.  See weatherflow.com for current product availability. 

 

Meet your new home weather station

Get precise information about weather and environmental conditions at your house then use the data to save time & money, increase safety, and improve home health. WeatherFlow brings decades of experience designing and maintaining professional weather stations to the home user with our revolutionary line of Smart Weather Stations.

 

 

SKY: Encased in SKY’s eye-catching design, our revolutionary sensors detect rain drops in an instant, give accurate real-time wind speed & direction, and measure sunlight (including UV Index) - all with no moving parts to wear out or fail. Long-range wireless sub-gHz communications with WiFi & Bluetooth Low Energy connectivity. Long Battery Life.

 

 

 

AIR:  Protect your family when AIR detects lightning & warns you of approaching storms. AIR also measures temperature, humidity, and atmospheric pressure. Long-range wireless sub-gHz communications with WiFi & Bluetooth Low Energy connectivity. Long Battery Life.


 

Weather Geek Worthy

At WeatherFlow, we design and install professional weather networks used by some of the most discerning meteorologists in government and industry. We realize the importance of high-quality data and how to put that data to good use. That's why all our devices will feature high-quality sensors as accurate as others sold at twice the price. Weather enthusiasts will appreciate the ability to export station data into 3rd party tools and developers will love how easy our forthcoming API allows data to be used in their applications. *Disclaimer: the government agencies noted in the above logos work with WeatherFlow on various projects, but have not specifically endorsed this line of Smart Weather Stations -- because they are not even available yet, duh.
 

Keeping It Simple

Our Smart Weather Stations are easy to install, configure, understand & use, effortless to maintain. SKY mounts on top of a standard 1" pole. Simply place AIR outside in the shade. Our app will walk you through setup. 
 

App Enabled

 

No more clunky LCD displays here. Nope, this is modern world. All your data is available on our free iOS and Android apps. Plus, you can use popular services such as Weather Underground to view the conditions at your house from anywhere in the world. 

 

 

 

Smart Home Ready

 

Our devices are built to work with popular smart home platforms. Use Your Weather data to optimize heating and cooling, adjust your irrigation schedule, alert your family when lightning storms approach, and close your garage door when the wind kicks up. Yeah, they’re that smart.
 

 

Project Status

September 2018 Update:   All backers have been delivered weather stations. Anyone interested in purchasing a Smart Weather Station, please goto:  http://weatherflow.com/smart-home-weather-stations/.  

 

About WeatherFlow

WeatherFlow is a team of over 30 meteorologists, engineers, programmers, and data scientists. Back in the late 90s, we realized that although weather is everywhere, good weather stations with accurate reliable data are not. In fact, in many areas, The Weather comes from National Weather Service stations installed in the 70s at a nearby airport, or worse, from a poorly sited station reporting inaccurate data.

So, we set out to identify strategic areas lacking good weather data. In order to fulfill our mission, we ended up installing one of the largest, private, high-quality weather networks in the world. Then we combined the unique data from this network with a carefully curated set of trusted weather data to dramatically improve forecast accuracy and provide hyper-local observations in key areas across the US. We got so good at it that agencies such as the Department of Defense and the National Hurricane Center came calling on our expertise. For over two decades we’ve provided increasingly better weather data so that our customers can make better decisions, saving them time and money, and increasing safety.

Nowadays everyone seems to have a weather app on their smartphones. But we continue to see massive discrepancies between The Weather and Your Weather - the conditions in your own backyard that affect you directly. With advances in smart home technology, environmental monitoring, and automation in commercial areas such as agriculture, we recognized a greater need for quality weather data everywhere.

 

The WeatherFlow Team

David St John
CIO and Technical Product Lead
Mechanical Engineer and Software Developer by training, David helped create WeatherFlow on a selfish need for better weather data to fuel his sailing and kitesurfing habits.

Phil Atkinson
CTO
A Harvard trained mechanical engineer and one of the world's leading experts in weather network design, Phil is our technical guru when it comes to sensor and communications design.

Robert Derr
Chief Systems Architect
Rob is brilliant and crafty, that's why he designs our firmware and hardware. Rob's a master at sensor data collection and publication systems.

Derek Trauger
Mobile Applications Architect
Derek is a highly experienced software architect not to mention an all-around nice guy. Derek leads mobile application development of our acclaimed weather data products on iOS, Android and beyond.

Jenna Hampton
Creative Director
Aesthetically gifted, Jenna makes us look good from app user experience design to brand look-n-feel -- she's the one who paints outside the lines.

Keith Koenig
Product Marketing, Business Development
Keith is the bridge between our technical development team and the real world. Making sure we're building the right features and experience that users not only want, but crave. He's also the guy pulling all the marketing strings.

Joshua Forare
Senior Software Developer
Josh develops our APIs and is the backend Systems Architect. He makes sure weather data gets safely and quickly to its final destination and builds integrations to smart home platforms.

Gustavo Litovsky
PCB & WiFi / BLE Engineer
We brought in Gustavo from Argenox Technologies to design our PCB layout and WiFi / BLE technologies. Good thing, as Gustavo loves connected products and has tons of experience from his days at Texas Instruments.

Graham Wimberly
Industrial Design
Graham is the man behind our functional yet unique industrial design. When you think: "hey, that doesn't look like any weather station I've ever seen!"...well, that's Graham's fault.

Michael Tiedemann
Head of Sales & Support
Mike earned his wings, so to speak, working for Lufthansa in total quality management. Now he's in charge of our sales, distribution, and customer service. Growth and happiness hand-in-hand.

Corrine Butcher
Web Applications Developer
Corrine knows web services from over 15 years experience in Software Development. When you're viewing quality weather data online, thank Corrine.

Jay Titlow
Senior Meteorologist, Met, Bus Dev Poquoson
Like a Jedi Master, Jay is wise to all things weather. Jay heads up our government biz dev with really important folks like the Defense Threat Reduction Agency and the National Mesonet project.

Tony McGee
Meteorologist, Met, Bus Dev Virginia
As a highly trained meteorologist, Tony works with data from WeatherFlow's network and elsewhere in support of numerous endeavors.​

Ben Miller
Princ. Oper. Meteorologist, Sr. Support Agent, Gt. Lakes Liaison, Met, Bus Dev Oklahoma
Ben is not only one the finest operational meteorologists, he also knows a thing or two about mesonets. Hailing from Oklahoma -- the mesonet capitol of the world -- it's no coincidence he doubles as a field sensor technician/magician.

Lance Raymond
Manager, Information Systems
Lance knows IT. With 20+years experience ranging from network design to system wide security and management, Lance keeps us running at full steam on modern infrastructure, PCI compliance, and system integrity.

Jason Stavrinaky
Mobile Applications Developer
Jason is new to the team, but brings serious Android chops. He has worked on various open source Android applications and libraries.

Buck Lyons
CEO
Last but not least. Stanford MBA with decades in the weather business, Buck is our fearless captain keeping the ship pointed in the right direction(s).


NOTE: There are quite a few more esteemed WeatherFlow employees not listed here. We love them dearly, yes we do, but our bio list was just getting a bit lengthy.
 

WeatherFlow annual company gathering - February 2016



FAQ's

PRODUCT FEATURES

How accurate are the sensors?

We're all about good data....because let's face it, bad data is misleading. That's why we have spent considerable effort sourcing and testing high-quality sensors for every device we produce. Combined with innovative technologies like our proprietary sonic anemometer and haptic rain sensor, our devices are every bit as accurate as scientific weather stations that cost 3X the price. See our sensor specs further down this page.

Why do I need a weather station at my house?

You might not realize this, but most weather apps and even your evening news is based on public domain data -- primarily on weather stations installed long ago at regional airports. Having a reliable weather station at your house can help you save money on heating & air conditioning based on the true environmental dynamics of your house, tell you exactly what's happening in your backyard (not the nearest airport), and allow you to make automated decision with your smart home systems.

Totally wireless?

Yes. Both the AIR and the SKY are battery powered and communicate to our hub via long range radio telemetry. The typical range is up to 1000ft (300m) depending on situation, and blockages like cement walls, etc. 

Portable?

Yes. Go ahead, bring the AIR to the soccer game and detect lightning before it gets to you. Or place the SKY on your boat or at the beach to measure wind, rain, and solar radiation. The device can communicate with the hub plugged into a common USB power bank, then it will communicate to your connected mobile device and send the data to the cloud for instant viewing online.

Do I need to download the app to use the WeatherFlow devices?

Yes, the WeatherFlow app is required to setup and configure the smart weather devices. The app also serves as your daily weather data viewer. Once set up, you can also view your data through or web app, as well as other integrated weather apps such as Weather Underground Personal Weather Station.

Is the WeatherFlow mobile app free?

Absolutely! Available on iOS or Android now: search for "WeatherFlow Smart Weather"in your app store. Note: no Amazon app as Amazon does not allow publication of apps that run Google services.

Can I use my iPad?

You can use any connected device to view your weather data. iPad - yes. iPhone - yes. Android phone or tablet - yes. Computer - yes. Anything with a browser.

Will the devices work with any Smartphone or tablet?

Most of them. WeatherFlow devices are compatible with all iOS and Android 4.3+ devices with Bluetooth Low Energy support for direct connection to the devices. If the device is connected to your home WiFi network, your data is pushed automatically to the cloud. Then anyone / any connected device can view the data via the WeatherFlow app or a variety of integrated weather and smart home apps.

Why did you separate a weather station into two devices?

Better siting, better data. In order to accurately measure wind, rain, and UV you need to place the SKY in an open area with a clear view of the sky above (like on your roof). As you can imagine, placing a temperature sensor in the full sun presents issues. That's why we made the AIR a separate device to be placed in the shade -- more accurate data.

What if I don't have a shady spot for the AIR?

No problem. There are off-the-shelf radiation shields that you can purchase and place the AIR inside. Search "radiation shield" on Amazon. We suggest the Ambient SRS100LX which fits the AIR snuggly.

What size pole do I need to mount the SKY?

The SKY is designed to fit on top of a pole with an outer diameter of 1.25 inches or 1.32 inches (31.75mm or 33.53 mm). The specific standard is known as "NPS 1" in the US (and Canada?) or "NB 1" in the UK. In most of the rest of the world it's also known as "DN 25". It should be a very common pole size everywhere. In the US it's sold at DIY stores in various materials-if you ask for a "one inch" pole

Will they work with Weather Underground?

Yes. You can publish your weather station data directly to Weather Underground. We'll walk you through the WU set up in our app.

When will the BREATHE be available?

We hope to release the  WeatherFlow BREATHE in 2018. The BREATHE and can be added to your network with the same WeatherFlow hub and apps.

What does the BREATHE device do?

BREATHE will measure total indoor air quality including VOCs, CO2, Dust particles, Humidity, and Temperature. It's designed to monitor the air inside your house and allow you to automatically trigger smart home actions such as: turn on air purifiers, open the windows, tune heating and cooling, ventilate bad air, etc.

 

 

TECHNICAL QUESTIONS

How does the sonic anemometer work?

SKY houses a sonic anemometer in the top of the device. The SKY measures wind speed and direction based on the time of flight of sonic pulses between pairs of transducers. This allows for a high degree of accuracy especially in variable wind conditions.  For more information see Wikipedia on Sonic Anemometers.

What is the report interval for the wind sensor?

Good question! Wind speed and direction are sampled once per second. This one second reading is broadcast locally via BLE or UDP, which means within range (up to 300 feet line-of-sight) you will be able to see those rapid updates on a smart phone or BlueTooth-enabled tablet. Additionally, these one second samples are averaged on a configurable schedule (1 min, 5 min, 15 min, etc.) and viewable both locally and remotely via our app and website (or third party apps like WUnderstation from Weather Underground). We are also working on a way to see the more frequent updates remotely. Reporting intervals are a balancing act with power consumption. Each time the device 'wakes up' and reports via WiFi it uses power. So, more frequent intervals = less battery life. And visa versa.

Can I use this on a boat or other moving object?

Absolutely. Although not specifically designed for a boat, they are very portable and will send data to your phone or tablet even if you're not connected to the Internet. Note: the station is designed for stationary home use and thus does not contain GPS technology to things like apparent wind speed on a moving boat. 

How do I store and access data? What if I don't have internet access?

Normally, your smart weather station will collect and send data to our servers. You can access this data through our app or our website, and you can export it in a variety of ways. But your stations will also collect and store some data even when they are not connected to the Internet! First, the devices themselves will store many days of data if left alone. Then, as soon as you're within range of a station, just start up the app and the data will be pulled in. From there, you can view or export it as usual.

How does the haptic rain sensor work?

SKY uses a patent-pending haptic rain sensor in the top of the device. Using a combination of pressure and capacitance, SKY measures and counts each falling raindrop. Algorithms exclude things that are not rain (like the rumblings of a passing train or Harley). This allows SKY to report the instant rain begins falling, the current intensity, and the total rain accumulation over time.  Accuracy compares to a large tipping bucket, but does not get fouled with leafs or bird crap. 

Does the AIR really detect lightning?

Yup. Pretty cool, huh?  The AIR actually detects cloud-to-ground AND cloud-to-cloud activity. Our sensor detects electrical transmissions from lightning activity up to 40km (approx. 25 miles) away and gives an estimate of distance. Humans can typically sense lightning only up to 25km away. The sensor algorithm is even smart enough to reject man-made signals such as microwave ovens and motors.  That said, it's important to place the AIR away from electrical disturbances for best performance. So ya, AIR can alert you when lightning is approaching way before you can hear or see it.

 

SENSOR SPECS:

 

Lightning Sensor
  • (AMS AS3935)
  • detects cloud-to-cloud and cloud-to-ground lightning strikes up to 40 km (25 miles)
  • estimates strength distance to leading edge of storm
Temperature/Humidity Sensor
  • (Silicon Labs Si7021)
  • air temperature -40° to 85 °C +/- 0.4 °C
  • relative humidity 0 to 100% +/- 4%
  • reports dew point & apparent temperature
Pressure Sensor
  • (Bosch BMP280)
  • atmospheric (barometric) pressure up to 1100 mbar +/- 1 mbar
  • reports both station pressure & mean sea level pressure
Haptic Rain Sensor
  • (WeatherFlow design)
  • detects the instant it starts to rain
  • provides hourly rate & daily accumulation at 0.2mm resolution
Sonic Wind Sensor
  • (WeatherFlow design)
  • continuously samples wind speed and direction 0 to 100 mph +/- 0.5 mph
  • calculates one-minute and five-minute average speed, direction & gust
Light Sensor
  • (Silicon Labs Si1132)
  • visible and infrared ambient light 1 to 128 kLUX +/- 100 mLUX
  • UV index (0-11+)
  • reports solar radiation 0 to 1900 W/m2 +/- 5%

Do the devices need to be calibrated?

No. Each sensor will be first pre-calibrated by the sensor manufacturer and then will go through calibration procedure on our production line to ensure accuracy.

How long will the battery last?

Our hardware and firmware engineers have spent months optimizing the smallest of details to ensure efficient low power consumption.  We recommend using long-lasting, primary lithium batteries, which perform better in extreme temperatures than alkaline. According to our power consumption calculations, we expect your batteries to last at least one year under normal usage conditions before needing replacement. Your mileage may vary based on how you configure your station.

Are the batteries replaceable?

Yes. The sealed battery compartment is accessible via the twist-off base. You can replace the batteries with common lithium AA batteries available everywhere. We recommend the Energizer "Ultimate Lithium" batteries or similar. The AIR takes 4 AA lithium batteries. The SKY takes 8 AA lithium batteries. 

What smart home platform will the devices work with?

We are currently working on integrations with SmartThings, NEST, Apple HomeKit, Amazon Echo, and IFTTT. The IFTTT platform enables integration with thousands of connected devices. We intend to continue to build meaningful integrations with as many smart platforms as make sense.

 

 

DISTRIBUTION

What happens to the money you raise?

Your money will only be used to build your product - all funds will be spent for tooling, manufacturing setup and component costs.

When will my weather station ship?

According to our plan we will start shipping to Field Testers in 2017 and everyone else beginning in late August 2018. Our field testers and early supporters will receive their orders first.

Where will you ship?

We will ship to Indiegogo backers in the US, Canada, the EU, Australia, and New Zealand. Once we're in full production we will ship worldwide.

What will the devices cost at retail?

The expected retail price of AIR is US$129 plus tax. The expected retail price of SKY is US$149 plus tax. The expected retail price of BREATHE is US$149 plus tax. We plan to offer some product "bundles" which will retail for slightly less.

Do the WeatherFlow devices come with a warranty?

Yes! We offer a 12 month manufacturers’ warranty on all our products. We're pretty down-to-earth rational folks...if you're having an issue with your device, contact us and we'd be happy to help resolve or replace.  

I am a distributor or reseller. How do I contact you?

Please email us at dealers@weatherflow.com.

 

 

CUSTOMER SUPPORT

Do you have customer service and technical support?

We sure do! We are here to answer all your questions. We have dedicated live chat hours for real time support, please visit our website or email  support@weatherflow.com

Can I change or cancel my perk?

Indiegogo has now made it easier than ever to upgrade your perks. You can do so on the contributions tab of your Indiegogo profile. See more information on how to do this here: https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/526756-How-to-Upgrade-Your-Perk

Backers can refund your contribution within 10 days. Please goto the IndieGogo Customer Support Center at http://indiegogo.com/contact

 

Help us spread the word

  • Your uncle is a weather guy? Let him know about WeatherFlow. Thanks!

Yeah, they’re that smart.  
Project Status

September 2018 Update:   All backers have been delivered weather stations. Anyone interested in purchasing a Smart Weather Station, please goto:  http://weatherflow.com/smart-home-weather-stations/.  
 
About WeatherFlow
WeatherFlow is a team of over 30 meteorologists, engineers, programmers, and data scientists. Back in the late 90s, we realized that although weather is everywhere, good weather stations with accurate reliable data are not. In fact, in many areas, The Weather comes from National Weather Service stations installed in the 70s at a nearby airport, or worse, from a poorly sited station reporting inaccurate data.So, we set out to identify strategic areas lacking good weather data. In order to fulfill our mission, we ended up installing one of the largest, private, high-quality weather networks in the world. Then we combined the unique data from this network with a carefully curated set of trusted weather data to dramatically improve forecast accuracy and provide hyper-local observations in key areas across the US. We got so good at it that agencies such as the Department of Defense and the National Hurricane Center came calling on our expertise. For over two decades we’ve provided increasingly better weather data so that our customers can make better decisions, saving them time and money, and increasing safety.
Nowadays everyone seems to have a weather app on their smartphones. But we continue to see massive discrepancies between The Weather and Your Weather - the conditions in your own backyard that affect you directly. With advances in smart home technology, environmental monitoring, and automation in commercial areas such as agriculture, we recognized a greater need for quality weather data everywhere. The WeatherFlow Team



David St JohnCIO and Technical Product LeadMechanical Engineer and Software Developer by training, David helped create WeatherFlow on a selfish need for better weather data to fuel his sailing and kitesurfing habits.



Phil AtkinsonCTOA Harvard trained mechanical engineer and one of the world's leading experts in weather network design, Phil is our technical guru when it comes to sensor and communications design.



Robert DerrChief Systems ArchitectRob is brilliant and crafty, that's why he designs our firmware and hardware. Rob's a master at sensor data collection and publication systems.



Derek TraugerMobile Applications ArchitectDerek is a highly experienced software architect not to mention an all-around nice guy. Derek leads mobile application development of our acclaimed weather data products on iOS, Android and beyond.



Jenna HamptonCreative DirectorAesthetically gifted, Jenna makes us look good from app user experience design to brand look-n-feel -- she's the one who paints outside the lines.




Keith KoenigProduct Marketing, Business DevelopmentKeith is the bridge between our technical development team and the real world. Making sure we're building the right features and experience that users not only want, but crave. He's also the guy pulling all the marketing strings.


Joshua ForareSenior Software DeveloperJosh develops our APIs and is the backend Systems Architect. He makes sure weather data gets safely and quickly to its final destination and builds integrations to smart home platforms.



Gustavo LitovskyPCB & WiFi / BLE EngineerWe brought in Gustavo from Argenox Technologies to design our PCB layout and WiFi / BLE technologies. Good thing, as Gustavo loves connected products and has tons of experience from his days at Texas Instruments.



Graham WimberlyIndustrial DesignGraham is the man behind our functional yet unique industrial design. When you think: "hey, that doesn't look like any weather station I've ever seen!"...well, that's Graham's fault.



Michael TiedemannHead of Sales & SupportMike earned his wings, so to speak, working for Lufthansa in total quality management. Now he's in charge of our sales, distribution, and customer service. Growth and happiness hand-in-hand.



Corrine ButcherWeb Applications DeveloperCorrine knows web services from over 15 years experience in Software Development. When you're viewing quality weather data online, thank Corrine.



Jay TitlowSenior Meteorologist, Met, Bus Dev PoquosonLike a Jedi Master, Jay is wise to all things weather. Jay heads up our government biz dev with really important folks like the Defense Threat Reduction Agency and the National Mesonet project.



Tony McGeeMeteorologist, Met, Bus Dev VirginiaAs a highly trained meteorologist, Tony works with data from WeatherFlow's network and elsewhere in support of numerous endeavors.​



Ben MillerPrinc. Oper. Meteorologist, Sr. Support Agent, Gt. Lakes Liaison, Met, Bus Dev OklahomaBen is not only one the finest operational meteorologists, he also knows a thing or two about mesonets. Hailing from Oklahoma -- the mesonet capitol of the world -- it's no coincidence he doubles as a field sensor technician/magician.



Lance RaymondManager, Information SystemsLance knows IT. With 20+years experience ranging from network design to system wide security and management, Lance keeps us running at full steam on modern infrastructure, PCI compliance, and system integrity.



Jason StavrinakyMobile Applications DeveloperJason is new to the team, but brings serious Android chops. He has worked on various open source Android applications and libraries.



Buck LyonsCEOLast but not least. Stanford MBA with decades in the weather business, Buck is our fearless captain keeping the ship pointed in the right direction(s).

NOTE: There are quite a few more esteemed WeatherFlow employees not listed here. We love them dearly, yes we do, but our bio list was just getting a bit lengthy. 
WeatherFlow annual company gathering - February 2016


FAQ's
PRODUCT FEATURES
How accurate are the sensors?
We're all about good data....because let's face it, bad data is misleading. That's why we have spent considerable effort sourcing and testing high-quality sensors for every device we produce. Combined with innovative technologies like our proprietary sonic anemometer and haptic rain sensor, our devices are every bit as accurate as scientific weather stations that cost 3X the price. See our sensor specs further down this page.
Why do I need a weather station at my house?
You might not realize this, but most weather apps and even your evening news is based on public domain data -- primarily on weather stations installed long ago at regional airports. Having a reliable weather station at your house can help you save money on heating & air conditioning based on the true environmental dynamics of your house, tell you exactly what's happening in your backyard (not the nearest airport), and allow you to make automated decision with your smart home systems.
Totally wireless?
Yes. Both the AIR and the SKY are battery powered and communicate to our hub via long range radio telemetry. The typical range is up to 1000ft (300m) depending on situation, and blockages like cement walls, etc. 
Portable?
Yes. Go ahead, bring the AIR to the soccer game and detect lightning before it gets to you. Or place the SKY on your boat or at the beach to measure wind, rain, and solar radiation. The device can communicate with the hub plugged into a common USB power bank, then it will communicate to your connected mobile device and send the data to the cloud for instant viewing online.
Do I need to download the app to use the WeatherFlow devices?
Yes, the WeatherFlow app is required to setup and configure the smart weather devices. The app also serves as your daily weather data viewer. Once set up, you can also view your data through or web app, as well as other integrated weather apps such as Weather Underground Personal Weather Station.
Is the WeatherFlow mobile app free?
Absolutely! Available on iOS or Android now: search for "WeatherFlow Smart Weather"in your app store. Note: no Amazon app as Amazon does not allow publication of apps that run Google services.
Can I use my iPad?
You can use any connected device to view your weather data. iPad - yes. iPhone - yes. Android phone or tablet - yes. Computer - yes. Anything with a browser.
Will the devices work with any Smartphone or tablet?
Most of them. WeatherFlow devices are compatible with all iOS and Android 4.3+ devices with Bluetooth Low Energy support for direct connection to the devices. If the device is connected to your home WiFi network, your data is pushed automatically to the cloud. Then anyone / any connected device can view the data via the WeatherFlow app or a variety of integrated weather and smart home apps.
Why did you separate a weather station into two devices?
Better siting, better data. In order to accurately measure wind, rain, and UV you need to place the SKY in an open area with a clear view of the sky above (like on your roof). As you can imagine, placing a temperature sensor in the full sun presents issues. That's why we made the AIR a separate device to be placed in the shade -- more accurate data.
What if I don't have a shady spot for the AIR?
No problem. There are off-the-shelf radiation shields that you can purchase and place the AIR inside. Search "radiation shield" on Amazon. We suggest the Ambient SRS100LX which fits the AIR snuggly.
What size pole do I need to mount the SKY?
The SKY is designed to fit on top of a pole with an outer diameter of 1.25 inches or 1.32 inches (31.75mm or 33.53 mm). The specific standard is known as "NPS 1" in the US (and Canada?) or "NB 1" in the UK. In most of the rest of the world it's also known as "DN 25". It should be a very common pole size everywhere. In the US it's sold at DIY stores in various materials-if you ask for a "one inch" pole
Will they work with Weather Underground?
Yes. You can publish your weather station data directly to Weather Underground. We'll walk you through the WU set up in our app.
When will the BREATHE be available?
We hope to release the  WeatherFlow BREATHE in 2018. The BREATHE and can be added to your network with the same WeatherFlow hub and apps.
What does the BREATHE device do?
BREATHE will measure total indoor air quality including VOCs, CO2, Dust particles, Humidity, and Temperature. It's designed to monitor the air inside your house and allow you to automatically trigger smart home actions such as: turn on air purifiers, open the windows, tune heating and cooling, ventilate bad air, etc.
 
 
TECHNICAL QUESTIONS
How does the sonic anemometer work?
SKY houses a sonic anemometer in the top of the device. The SKY measures wind speed and direction based on the time of flight of sonic pulses between pairs of transducers. This allows for a high degree of accuracy especially in variable wind conditions.  For more information see Wikipedia on Sonic Anemometers.
What is the report interval for the wind sensor?
Good question! Wind speed and direction are sampled once per second. This one second reading is broadcast locally via BLE or UDP, which means within range (up to 300 feet line-of-sight) you will be able to see those rapid updates on a smart phone or BlueTooth-enabled tablet. Additionally, these one second samples are averaged on a configurable schedule (1 min, 5 min, 15 min, etc.) and viewable both locally and remotely via our app and website (or third party apps like WUnderstation from Weather Underground). We are also working on a way to see the more frequent updates remotely. Reporting intervals are a balancing act with power consumption. Each time the device 'wakes up' and reports via WiFi it uses power. So, more frequent intervals = less battery life. And visa versa.
Can I use this on a boat or other moving object?
Absolutely. Although not specifically designed for a boat, they are very portable and will send data to your phone or tablet even if you're not connected to the Internet. Note: the station is designed for stationary home use and thus does not contain GPS technology to things like apparent wind speed on a moving boat. 
How do I store and access data? What if I don't have internet access?
Normally, your smart weather station will collect and send data to our servers. You can access this data through our app or our website, and you can export it in a variety of ways. But your stations will also collect and store some data even when they are not connected to the Internet! First, the devices themselves will store many days of data if left alone. Then, as soon as you're within range of a station, just start up the app and the data will be pulled in. From there, you can view or export it as usual.
How does the haptic rain sensor work?
SKY uses a patent-pending haptic rain sensor in the top of the device. Using a combination of pressure and capacitance, SKY measures and counts each falling raindrop. Algorithms exclude things that are not rain (like the rumblings of a passing train or Harley). This allows SKY to report the instant rain begins falling, the current intensity, and the total rain accumulation over time.  Accuracy compares to a large tipping bucket, but does not get fouled with leafs or bird crap. 
Does the AIR really detect lightning?
Yup. Pretty cool, huh?  The AIR actually detects cloud-to-ground AND cloud-to-cloud activity. Our sensor detects electrical transmissions from lightning activity up to 40km (approx. 25 miles) away and gives an estimate of distance. Humans can typically sense lightning only up to 25km away. The sensor algorithm is even smart enough to reject man-made signals such as microwave ovens and motors.  That said, it's important to place the AIR away from electrical disturbances for best performance. So ya, AIR can alert you when lightning is approaching way before you can hear or see it.
 
SENSOR SPECS:
 
Lightning Sensor

(AMS AS3935)
detects cloud-to-cloud and cloud-to-ground lightning strikes up to 40 km (25 miles)
estimates strength distance to leading edge of storm

Temperature/Humidity Sensor

(Silicon Labs Si7021)
air temperature -40° to 85 °C +/- 0.4 °C
relative humidity 0 to 100% +/- 4%
reports dew point & apparent temperature

Pressure Sensor

(Bosch BMP280)
atmospheric (barometric) pressure up to 1100 mbar +/- 1 mbar
reports both station pressure & mean sea level pressure

Haptic Rain Sensor

(WeatherFlow design)
detects the instant it starts to rain
provides hourly rate & daily accumulation at 0.2mm resolution

Sonic Wind Sensor

(WeatherFlow design)
continuously samples wind speed and direction 0 to 100 mph +/- 0.5 mph
calculates one-minute and five-minute average speed, direction & gust

Light Sensor

(Silicon Labs Si1132)
visible and infrared ambient light 1 to 128 kLUX +/- 100 mLUX
UV index (0-11+)
reports solar radiation 0 to 1900 W/m2 +/- 5%

Do the devices need to be calibrated?
No. Each sensor will be first pre-calibrated by the sensor manufacturer and then will go through calibration procedure on our production line to ensure accuracy.
How long will the battery last?
Our hardware and firmware engineers have spent months optimizing the smallest of details to ensure efficient low power consumption.  We recommend using long-lasting, primary lithium batteries, which perform better in extreme temperatures than alkaline. According to our power consumption calculations, we expect your batteries to last at least one year under normal usage conditions before needing replacement. Your mileage may vary based on how you configure your station.
Are the batteries replaceable?
Yes. The sealed battery compartment is accessible via the twist-off base. You can replace the batteries with common lithium AA batteries available everywhere. We recommend the Energizer "Ultimate Lithium" batteries or similar. The AIR takes 4 AA lithium batteries. The SKY takes 8 AA lithium batteries. 
What smart home platform will the devices work with?
We are currently working on integrations with SmartThings, NEST, Apple HomeKit, Amazon Echo, and IFTTT. The IFTTT platform enables integration with thousands of connected devices. We intend to continue to build meaningful integrations with as many smart platforms as make sense.
 
 
DISTRIBUTION
What happens to the money you raise?
Your money will only be used to build your product - all funds will be spent for tooling, manufacturing setup and component costs.
When will my weather station ship?
According to our plan we will start shipping to Field Testers in 2017 and everyone else beginning in late August 2018. Our field testers and early supporters will receive their orders first.
Where will you ship?
We will ship to Indiegogo backers in the US, Canada, the EU, Australia, and New Zealand. Once we're in full production we will ship worldwide.
What will the devices cost at retail?
The expected retail price of AIR is US$129 plus tax. The expected retail price of SKY is US$149 plus tax. The expected retail price of BREATHE is US$149 plus tax. We plan to offer some product "bundles" which will retail for slightly less.
Do the WeatherFlow devices come with a warranty?
Yes! We offer a 12 month manufacturers’ warranty on all our products. We're pretty down-to-earth rational folks...if you're having an issue with your device, contact us and we'd be happy to help resolve or replace.  
I am a distributor or reseller. How do I contact you?
Please email us at dealers@weatherflow.com.
 
 
CUSTOMER SUPPORT
Do you have customer service and technical support?
We sure do! We are here to answer all your questions. We have dedicated live chat hours for real time support, please visit our website or email  support@weatherflow.com
Can I change or cancel my perk?
Indiegogo has now made it easier than ever to upgrade your perks. You can do so on the contributions tab of your Indiegogo profile. See more information on how to do this here: https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/526756-How-to-Upgrade-Your-Perk
Backers can refund your contribution within 10 days. Please goto the IndieGogo Customer Support Center at http://indiegogo.com/contact
 
Help us spread the word
Your uncle is a weather guy? Let him know about WeatherFlow. Thanks!

story:
by praktrik.com





We are focused on PRACTICAL TRICKS

The company was established in 2010 by two friends, Petar Zaharinov - the designer of the products and Delyan Spasov - the webmaster and manager. Since the beginning we have been functioning as a boutique brand that sells its products mainly through its own website, but we are sure that we can have much bigger coverage!

All designs are inspired by interlocking burr puzzles. They are flat pack and require no fixtures and no tools. They are made of natural and traditional materials. They are interactive and stimulate the intelligence and the dexterity of the user. They are fun!




By reaching our funding goal we will be able to do the following:

Design and prototype a special collection for children. We have worked on several projects dedicated to kids which convinced us that the interactive and cognitive nature of our designs is appropriate for them.

Reduce the prices of the most popular products on our website by at least 15% and shorten the lead time considerably. We will be able to manufacture and keep in stock larger quantities.

Find reliable distributors worldwide by participating in major furniture Expos in US, UK, EU, Japan etc. Participating in Trade Shows is essential in furniture sector because of the material nature of the products.




sliding collection







impossible collection







coordinate collection







Some burr puzzle structures are extremely simple and even appropriate for frequent change of place. Probably this is the quality that makes our 1×3 and 1×3d the most desirable products in our catalog.

Our bestsellers!

1 × 3 and 1 × 3d









The press coverage we experienced during the last several years enhanced the feeling that our products are interesting and can have a greater spread. Click on the image below for a detailed list of articles.

If you want to have an item you see there you can always place an order, meanwhile take a promo code to ensure a two-year discount for all products you can find on our online store.

1 × 2 + 1 and 1 × 2d + 1d

Your contribution:

2 × 3

4 × 3

If you like combinatorics 4×3 is the perk for you. It is composed of four different types of elements that can be assembled in four different combinations with three different heights, using the same glass top. See the perks' section above for more details about the perk. Worldwide shipping is included!

Your contribution: 600$









4 × 6

4×6 is the biggest challenge in our catalog. It is composed of four different types of elements, six pieces of each. The twenty-four parts require a lot of both – spatial vision and dexterity in order to be assembled. This perk is for the biggest fans of traditional burrs! See the perks' section above for more details about the perk.

Your contribution: 540$









5 × 4

5×4 is for those who need a large low table for their living room. It is composed of five different types of elements, four pieces of each. See the perks' section above for more details about the perk.

Your contribution: 570$









6 × 3

6×3 is the most popular design from our Impossible collection. It is composed of six different types of elements, three pieces of each. See the perk's section above for more details about the perk.

Your contribution: 590$











1:5 scale models

VIIC:5

VIIC is a unique double chair for two. It can be placed between two different tables or it can be used as a regular chair on one side and as a table for books, magazines, and other objects on the other. See the perks' section above for more details about the scale model.

Your contribution: 30$







CD:5

CD is a shelving system that offers an extreme number of possible combinations. The shape of its elements looks decorative but it is actually very constructional, making the above-mentioned combinatorics possible. It is also perfect for desk organizer. See the perks' section above for more details about the scale model.

Your contribution: 70$







TETRIKS:5

For the biggest fans of the main video we provide a complete set of models replicating the furniture arrangement shown there. It is ideal for furnishing an off-beat dollhouse for your children. See the perks' section above for more details about the perk.

Your contribution: 260$

story:
About Pupbeamo

 

The Pupbeamo Teeth Whitening Powder, used with the Pupbeamo Activated Charcoal Toothbrush, is the dentist-approved, 100% natural way of having and keeping your teeth white and healthy, with the fresh touch of Pupbeamo’s certified organic ingredients.

What Pupbeamo Offers

Pupbeamo Teeth Whitening Powder is able to

 

 

Out with the Chemicals, in with the Natural Way of Teeth Whitening

 

Complex laser treatments, intricate LED devices, uncomfortable dental trays or dental strips to bleach your teeth… there are many chemical-based treatments to help you whiten your teeth. However, why should you take these uncomfortable and unnatural approaches, when there is a perfectly natural, safe, simple and easy-to-use-at-home treatment to give you back that big shiny smile that you had before? That’s right: with Pupbeamo natural teeth whitening products, you can have a side-effect-free fully natural way of whitening your teeth and keeping them really healthy. Effortlessly.

 

Why Pay a Lot When You Can Pay a Little?

 

Sophisticated chemical-based treatments are not only uncomfortable and possibly leading to nasty side effects… they are also extremely expensive and only somewhat effective. They keep you going to successive and extremely costly sessions with your dentist, knowing that, if you drop that expensive treatment for some reason (namely because you cannot afford it forever), results will quickly evaporate and your teeth will again suffer discoloration (meaning that all that you spent will be lost as well). So why pay so much for something with such limitations, when you can use Pupbeamo products for the easiest, cheapest and most natural method to keep your teeth white and healthy?

 

The Power of Coconut Activated Charcoal 

 

Coffee, cigarette, tea, wine and other sources of stains in your teeth are very persistent dental discoloring agents. They either keep your teeth yellowish or darkish, and they make you feel bad about the smile that you keep hiding. They also leave certain odors that make you feel uncomfortable and self-conscious… that is until they meet the natural whitening power of activated charcoal obtained from the natural coconut shell. That’s the main ingredient that the Pupbeamo Teeth Whitening Powder uses to make your teeth go completely and naturally white, fresh and healthy.

 

Organically Fresh

 

The Pupbeamo Activated Charcoal Teeth Whitening Powder has an icy cool taste due to having certified organic sweet orange peel, peppermint and lemon myrtle – which will also remove stubborn stains, arm you against bacteria, boost your immune system, and remove toxins from your mouth. This means you’ll keep a fresh breath without worrying about harmful chemicals or additives that can damage your oral health.

 

Bamboo-style Oral Hygiene, not Plastic Bamboozle

 

Pupbeamo offers yet another product that is truly special and made to make your oral hygiene and dental care go fully natural and healthy. Our Bamboo Charcoal Toothbrush is processed and manufactured with antiseptics and Bamboo activated charcoal added to the toothbrush hair, allowing you to have an even more hygienic tooth-brushing process. Since it is made with Bamboo charcoal, which is processed under high-temperature heating, the Pupbeamo Toothbrush contains 3-10 times more delicate holes on the charcoal than normal charcoal from normal wood. This means that this toothbrush is the real deal that plastic toothbrushes, as fancy and expensive as they may be, can never compete with: our toothbrush absorbs any impurities and all sorts of odors, while also having antiseptic properties and humidity regulating features that ensure it dries completely and quickly, thus reducing the chance of bacteria growing.

 

Risks & Challenges

Like all Indiegogo projects, we will face certain risks and challenges in delivering this product at the quality we demand of ourselves. However, the Pupbeamo team brings with it not only our passion but experience in engineering and manufacturing at scale, and we've made every effort to mitigate these risks for our backers.

With the support of our manufacturing and distribution partners, we are well prepared for the challenges ahead. We promise to be transparent and to keep our backers updated and informed about any issues that may come up and our solutions to such.

Feel free to reach out at service@pupbeamo.com if you have any questions.

story:
In 2020, our life has changed dramatically due to COVID 19. While we are trying to adopt new lifestyles and habits, the requirements for cleaning, sanitization, and disinfection products are increasing.It’s also a better way for us to understand what our users are looking for.

During this battle with the virus, we found that quality anti-epidemic products should meet these three requirements: Lightweight, versatile, and effective! SteriliBot S2 fulfilled all these principles.

 

 

 

Have you ever heard that UVC radiation is an effective mean for disinfection?

Have you ever heard that manufacturers are using ozone to disinfect our face masks?

Have you ever used an ionizing air purifier?

 

We got to know different sterilisation techniques in the past months and they are effective. At the same time, we realized that each of them has its own advantages and limitations. As a consumer, we do not want to buy so much. Also, it's hard to choose just one.

SteriliBot S2 will be your best choice.

 

 

  

SteriliBot S2 can be placed on a table or in a cabinet without taking up a lot of space. Equipped with a long-lasting internal battery, which is the best solution for tangled and messy electrical cables. Also, the leash can be hung on hangers or robe hooks.


In addition to household items sterilisation, SteriliBot S2 provides you extra protection while driving. It’s a mobile personal sterilizer which can be hung on your neck with a leash to keep you protected on the go. If you are worried about catching the virus from banknotes or merchandise that customers with suspected infection with COVID-19 have touched, SteriliBot S2 can be used to disinfect items on your way home.

 

SteriliBOT uses Korea imported UVC chips with 275nm wavelength, which can effectively kill bacteria in second. It has been certified in the laboratory, helps to reduce Escherichia coli, Staphylococcus aureus, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Klebsiella pneumoniae, Salmonella typhimurium, and other harmful bacteria up to 99.9%. The chip can also last up to 10,000 hours,  as well as providing a long-term safety solution.

   

UVC light can be used to instantly disinfect all surfaces of virus and bacteria, such as:

your cutlery, stationery, keyboard and mouse.

 

Anion Ozone Sterilization technology generates negative ions and ozone particles, which enhances bactericidal capacity. Bacteria and viruses circling in a room can be cleared by negatively charged ions attaching to them and removing them from the air. Ozone can effectively kill bacteria. It’s proven to kill 99.9% of bacteria and viruses

 

SteriliBOT S2 has three built-in smart modes: cycle mode, effective, purify, strong oxidation.

Freshen air, reduce strong odor, kill bacteria and viruses in 30 minutes in an airtight space.

Our product has been tested and certified by Guang Dong Detection Center Of Microbiology and the Hong Kong Standards and Testing Centre Ltd in being effective in eliminating the viruses and bacteria of seasonal influenza, methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus, Salmonella typhimurium and Escherichia coli.

    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

In June 2020, SteriliBOT has been tested on it’s effects on the ozone depletion for humans and the environment.  By simulating the situation that a SteriliBOT is using, the ozone depletion levels are below the limits, which is in the healthy range of the U.S. official standards (FDA、OSHA、NIOSH、EPA).

 

It’s one of the safest disinfection options in the market.

  

 

Anion Air Purification

An ionizer air purifier is a good choice for those with necessity of using it in different environments such as at home, in the car, in the office, or even traveling. Negative and positive ions have indeed been shown to have bactericidal effects, it also helps you to remove particles of allergies from the air, relieve hay fever and skin rashes.

story:
We are a nonprofit Organization, building a Christian children camp in Chiang Mai, Thailand. We have been developing the camp facility since 2009. We offer the young people to come and enjoy the camp activities, and to learn the love of Jesus Christ. It is our mission and desire to share the gospel and minister to the children, sharing spiritual truth to children is a great joy. No one is more receptive, more hungry to learn, or more trusting than a child.

It is our love and compassion with a non-stop duty to teach the young children of hope and salvation.

However, we are in the process of replacing the unsafe staff bungalows with new staff housing to serve the children. We are in need of housing for kitchen staff, ground staff and cleaning staff. Our goal is to raise $75,000.00 dollars to meet the estimated cost of this required work. It can be very difficult for people to get to and
from the villages to the camp to work, so many of our full time staff members stay within the property.

We would appreciate your potential donations. As a 501 (c) (3) organization, we will provide a tax receipt for all donations.

Your ongoing support of the mission of Teakwood Camp is deeply appreciated. If you have questions, concerns, or just want more details about this important fundraising effort, please visit our web site at www.teakwoodcamp.com

May God Bless your generous Gift
