story:
The lamp that challenges the lockdown

 

 

The whole planet has been called to live a historical moment of exceptional importance. The health emergency of COVID-19 has isolated us and forced us into confinement: we are closed in at home, deprived of work and social contacts, and unable to perform actions that up until very recently were taken for granted, such as going to concerts or shaking hands.

Many people in different fields are looking for answers to this emergency, using the tools they know best. There are musicians and actors who organize streaming events to liven up monotonous days, engineers and makers who combine their skills to help hospitals in trouble, textile entrepreneurs who reconvert their factories for the production of masks.

We too, as a small manufacturing reality forced into lockdown, wondered what our answer might have been. So, after transferring part of our equipment to the garage at home, we decided to take advantage of our time to work on a project that was on the one hand the demonstration of how companies such as ours can live with the crisis during isolation, and on the other being a tangible help for the on-going health emergency.

Hence Esse, the lamp that challenges the lockdown.

 

 

What is Esse

Esse is a table lamp made in cement designed to be made even in periods like this, characterized by the scarcity of equipment and supplies, where "know-how" and design are the only resources available.

In this sense, the lamp evidences a possible resistance from the world of design in the face of the global upheaval we are witnessing.

 

 

The awareness of limitations has been the reason it was given its monolithic aspect; its shape and essential lines are the result of the inability to make complex moulds working inside the house, while the side slot was created to allow the installation of electrical wiring even without equipment.

Know-how gained over the years on the craftsmanship of cement has given colour and rigor to the Esse lamp. The chosen colours - grey, red and yellow - are as primary as the light modes that the lamp can guarantee, direct and shielded, thanks to its half-cylinder shape.

 

 

 

Concrete aid to combat COVID-19

Esse is also a concrete contribution against the pandemic, since half of the proceeds from sales will be donated to help all countries affected by the virus.

To allow as many people as possible to participate in the donation, it was decided to give the lamps at the symbolic price of €35 (to which are added €35 for donation) instead of €128.

 

 

How we will use the money collected

For each piece sold we will donate € 35 to the Lang Europe Onlus Foundation in support of the COVID-19 Solidarity Response Fund of the World Health Organization. Donations support WHO’s work, including with partners, to track and understand the spread of the virus; to ensure patients get the care they need and frontline workers get essential supplies and information; and to accelerate research and development of a vaccine and treatments for all who need them.

Some donations also support Fund partners UNICEF, for its work on COVID-19 among vulnerable communities including children, and the vaccine development alliance CEPI. https://covid19responsefund.org/

The remaining €35 will be used for campaign management, moulds realisation and materials purchase.

 

 

 

Technical specifications

  • Material: cement
  • Available colours: grey, red, yellow
  • Dimensions: 12 x 9 x 16 cm / 4.7" x 3.5" x 6.3"
  • Weight: 1,3 kg / 2.9 lbs
  • Use: only for internal use
  • Plug: European, American and British plug available
  • Length of the wire: 180 cm / 70"
  • Light bulb (not included): E14 MAX 10W LED, E12 for US and Canada

 

 

 

Who is Plato Design

We are Alessandro Mattei and Caterina Naglieri, two designers with training in architecture, that has taken us around the world for years in many international design studios. In 2016 we decided to drop everything to return to our city, Rome, and start from scratch with our own project and a start-up that, thanks to a crowd-funding, allowed us to create our first product, the D-Twelve lamp.

Thus Plato Design was born, a laboratory in which we make lamps and home objects entirely handmade in Italy. Among our favourite materials is cement; in a few years from our home-laboratory we managed to develop a small creative industry that exports all over the world.

Now the lockdown due to the virus has taken us back to those days of 4 years ago, when we closed ourselves inside the walls of our house to let our minds flow to give shape our ideas.

For us, design means exactly this: never stop looking towards tomorrow.  http://www.platodesign.it/

Project in collaboration with Sign Press di Isabella Clara Sciacca https://www.signpress.it/

 

 

 

 

Special thanks

The entire Esse Lamp project and the crowdfunding campaign were carried out during lockdown between March and April 2020. This is why video and images were realized without our partners, who we still want to thank for their remote help. Thank you Luca Ferrante for the help with pictures https://www.lucaferrantefotografo.it/, thank you Alessandro Roberti - Cliche Video for video supervision https://www.clichevideo.com/ and thanks to David White for translations and subtitles https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1470733/. Thank you also Luca Longobardi (Luca sei fico!) https://soundcloud.com/luca-longobardi

 

 

*** ITALIANO***

ESSE, la lampada che sfida il lockdown

Un progetto pilota e un aiuto concreto per l'emergenza COVID-19

Tutto il pianeta è chiamato a vivere un momento storico di portata eccezionale. L'emergenza sanitaria del COVID-19 ci ha isolato e costretto al confinamento: siamo chiusi in casa, privati dei contatti sociali e del lavoro, impossibilitati a compiere azioni fino a poco tempo fa scontate come andare a un concerto o stringerci la mano.

Molte persone in ambiti diversi cercano risposte a questa emergenza, utilizzando gli strumenti che conoscono meglio. Ci sono musicisti e attori che organizzano streaming per ravvivare giornate monotone, ingegneri e maker che uniscono le loro competenze per aiutare gli ospedali in affanno, imprenditori tessili che riconvertono le loro fabbriche per la produzione di mascherine.

Anche noi, come piccola realtà manifatturiera costretta al lockdown, ci siamo chiesti quale sarebbe potuta essere la nostra risposta. Così, dopo aver trasferito parte delle attrezzature nel garage di casa, abbiamo deciso di sfruttare il nostro tempo per lavorare a un progetto che fosse da un lato la dimostrazione di come anche durante l'isolamento aziende come la nostra possano convivere con la crisi, e dall’altro un aiuto tangibile per l’emergenza sanitaria in corso.

Da qui nasce Esse, la lampada che sfida il lockdown.

 

Cos'è Esse

Esse è una lampada da tavolo in cemento progettata per poter essere realizzata anche in periodi come questo, caratterizzati da scarsità di attrezzature e forniture, in cui le uniche risorse disponibili sono il “saper fare” e il design. In questo senso la lampada si fa testimone di una resistenza possibile del mondo del design e dell’artigianato allo stravolgimento globale a cui stiamo assistendo.

La consapevolezza delle limitazioni ne ha disegnato il suo aspetto monolitico; la sua forma e le sue linee essenziali sono frutto dell’impossibilità di fare stampi complessi lavorando dentro casa,  mentre l’asola laterale nasce per consentire il montaggio dei cablaggi elettrici anche senza attrezzature.

Il know-how maturato in questi anni sulla lavorazione artigianale del cemento ha donato alla lampada Esse il colore e il rigore. I colori scelti - grigio, rosso e giallo - sono primari come le modalità di luce che la lampada può garantire, diretta e schermata, grazie alla sua forma a mezzo cilindro.

 

Un aiuto concreto alla lotta al COVID-19

Esse è inoltre un contributo concreto contro la pandemia, poiché metà del ricavato delle vendite sarà donato per dare un aiuto a tutti i Paesi colpiti dal virus.

Per permettere a più persone possibile di partecipare alla donazione, si è anche scelto di dare le lampade al prezzo simbolico di 35 € (a cui si sommano i 35€ della donazione) anziché 128€.

 

Come useremo i soldi raccolti

Per ogni pezzo venduto doneremo 35€ alla Fondazione Lang Europe Onlus a sostegno del fondo COVID-19 Solidarity Response Fund dell'Organizzazione Mondiale della Sanità. Le donazioni sosterranno il lavoro dell'OMS e dei suoi partner, per tracciare e comprendere la diffusione del virus, assicurare ai pazienti le cure di cui hanno bisogno e garantire a chi lavora in prima linea le attrezzature e le informazioni essenziali necessarie, accelerare la ricerca e lo sviluppo del

vaccino e dei trattamenti. Parte delle donazioni andrà inoltre a supporto dei partner del Fondo: all'UNICEF per il suo lavoro di lotta la COVID-19 nelle comunità più vulnerabili e al CEPI per lo sviluppo del vaccino.

https://covid19responsefund.org/

I restanti 35€ verranno utilizzati per la gestione della campagna, la realizzazione degli stampi e l'acquisto dei materiali.

 

Specifiche tecniche

  • Materiale: cemento
  • Colori disponibili: grigio, rosso, giallo
  • Dimensioni: 12 x 9 x 16 cm 
  • Peso: 1,3 kg 
  • Uso: solo per uso interno
  • Lunghezza del cavo: 180 cm 
  • Lampadina (non inclusa): E14 MAX 10W LED

 

Chi è Plato Design

Siamo Alessandro Mattei e Caterina Naglieri due designer con una formazione in architettura, che ci ha portati per anni in giro per il mondo in alcuni studi internazionali di progettazione. Nel 2016 decidiamo di mollare tutto per tornare nella nostra città, Roma, e ripartire da zero con un progetto tutto nostro e una startup che, grazie a un crowdfunding, ci ha permesso di realizzare il nostro primo prodotto, la lampada D-Twelve.

Nasce così Plato Design, un laboratorio in cui realizziamo lampade e oggetti per la casa interamente fatti a mano in Italia. Tra i nostri materiali preferiti c'è il cemento; in pochi anni dalla nostra casa-laboratorio siamo riusciti a sviluppare una piccola industria creativa che esporta in tutto il mondo.

Adesso il lockdown dovuto al virus ci ha riportati a quei giorni di 4 anni fa, a quando chiusi fra le pareti della nostra casa lasciavamo correre la mente per dare forma alle nostre idee.

Progettare per noi significa proprio questo: non smettere mai di guardare al domani. http://www.platodesign.it/

Progetto in collaborazione con Sign Press di Isabella Clara Sciacca https://www.signpress.it/

 

Ringraziamenti

L’intero progetto della lampada Esse e la campagna di crowdfunding sono stati realizzati durante il lockdown tra Marzo e Aprile 2020. Per questo abbiamo girato il video e scattato le foto senza i nostri collaboratori, che vogliamo comunque ringraziare perché ci hanno dato consigli e spiegazioni a distanza: grazie Luca Ferrante per l'aiuto con le foto https://www.lucaferrantefotografo.it/, grazie Alessandro Roberti di Cliche Video per la supervisione sul video https://www.clichevideo.com/ e grazie David White per le traduzioni e i sottotitoli https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1470733/. Grazie anche Luca Longobardi (Luca sei fico!) https://soundcloud.com/luca-longobardi
story_txt:
The lamp that challenges the lockdown  The whole planet has been called to live a historical moment of exceptional importance. The health emergency of COVID-19 has isolated us and forced us into confinement: we are closed in at home, deprived of work and social contacts, and unable to perform actions that up until very recently were taken for granted, such as going to concerts or shaking hands.Many people in different fields are looking for answers to this emergency, using the tools they know best. There are musicians and actors who organize streaming events to liven up monotonous days, engineers and makers who combine their skills to help hospitals in trouble, textile entrepreneurs who reconvert their factories for the production of masks.We too, as a small manufacturing reality forced into lockdown, wondered what our answer might have been. So, after transferring part of our equipment to the garage at home, we decided to take advantage of our time to work on a project that was on the one hand the demonstration of how companies such as ours can live with the crisis during isolation, and on the other being a tangible help for the on-going health emergency.Hence Esse, the lamp that challenges the lockdown.  What is EsseEsse is a table lamp made in cement designed to be made even in periods like this, characterized by the scarcity of equipment and supplies, where "know-how" and design are the only resources available.In this sense, the lamp evidences a possible resistance from the world of design in the face of the global upheaval we are witnessing.  The awareness of limitations has been the reason it was given its monolithic aspect; its shape and essential lines are the result of the inability to make complex moulds working inside the house, while the side slot was created to allow the installation of electrical wiring even without equipment.Know-how gained over the years on the craftsmanship of cement has given colour and rigor to the Esse lamp. The chosen colours - grey, red and yellow - are as primary as the light modes that the lamp can guarantee, direct and shielded, thanks to its half-cylinder shape.   Concrete aid to combat COVID-19Esse is also a concrete contribution against the pandemic, since half of the proceeds from sales will be donated to help all countries affected by the virus.To allow as many people as possible to participate in the donation, it was decided to give the lamps at the symbolic price of €35 (to which are added €35 for donation) instead of €128.  How we will use the money collectedFor each piece sold we will donate € 35 to the Lang Europe Onlus Foundation in support of the COVID-19 Solidarity Response Fund of the World Health Organization. Donations support WHO’s work, including with partners, to track and understand the spread of the virus; to ensure patients get the care they need and frontline workers get essential supplies and information; and to accelerate research and development of a vaccine and treatments for all who need them.Some donations also support Fund partners UNICEF, for its work on COVID-19 among vulnerable communities including children, and the vaccine development alliance CEPI. https://covid19responsefund.org/The remaining €35 will be used for campaign management, moulds realisation and materials purchase.   Technical specifications
Material: cement
Available colours: grey, red, yellow
Dimensions: 12 x 9 x 16 cm / 4.7" x 3.5" x 6.3"
Weight: 1,3 kg / 2.9 lbs
Use: only for internal use
Plug: European, American and British plug available
Length of the wire: 180 cm / 70"
Light bulb (not included): E14 MAX 10W LED, E12 for US and Canada
   Who is Plato DesignWe are Alessandro Mattei and Caterina Naglieri, two designers with training in architecture, that has taken us around the world for years in many international design studios. In 2016 we decided to drop everything to return to our city, Rome, and start from scratch with our own project and a start-up that, thanks to a crowd-funding, allowed us to create our first product, the D-Twelve lamp.Thus Plato Design was born, a laboratory in which we make lamps and home objects entirely handmade in Italy. Among our favourite materials is cement; in a few years from our home-laboratory we managed to develop a small creative industry that exports all over the world.Now the lockdown due to the virus has taken us back to those days of 4 years ago, when we closed ourselves inside the walls of our house to let our minds flow to give shape our ideas.For us, design means exactly this: never stop looking towards tomorrow.  http://www.platodesign.it/Project in collaboration with Sign Press di Isabella Clara Sciacca https://www.signpress.it/    Special thanksThe entire Esse Lamp project and the crowdfunding campaign were carried out during lockdown between March and April 2020. This is why video and images were realized without our partners, who we still want to thank for their remote help. Thank you Luca Ferrante for the help with pictures https://www.lucaferrantefotografo.it/, thank you Alessandro Roberti - Cliche Video for video supervision https://www.clichevideo.com/ and thanks to David White for translations and subtitles https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1470733/. Thank you also Luca Longobardi (Luca sei fico!) https://soundcloud.com/luca-longobardi  *** ITALIANO***ESSE, la lampada che sfida il lockdownUn progetto pilota e un aiuto concreto per l'emergenza COVID-19Tutto il pianeta è chiamato a vivere un momento storico di portata eccezionale. L'emergenza sanitaria del COVID-19 ci ha isolato e costretto al confinamento: siamo chiusi in casa, privati dei contatti sociali e del lavoro, impossibilitati a compiere azioni fino a poco tempo fa scontate come andare a un concerto o stringerci la mano.Molte persone in ambiti diversi cercano risposte a questa emergenza, utilizzando gli strumenti che conoscono meglio. Ci sono musicisti e attori che organizzano streaming per ravvivare giornate monotone, ingegneri e maker che uniscono le loro competenze per aiutare gli ospedali in affanno, imprenditori tessili che riconvertono le loro fabbriche per la produzione di mascherine.Anche noi, come piccola realtà manifatturiera costretta al lockdown, ci siamo chiesti quale sarebbe potuta essere la nostra risposta. Così, dopo aver trasferito parte delle attrezzature nel garage di casa, abbiamo deciso di sfruttare il nostro tempo per lavorare a un progetto che fosse da un lato la dimostrazione di come anche durante l'isolamento aziende come la nostra possano convivere con la crisi, e dall’altro un aiuto tangibile per l’emergenza sanitaria in corso.Da qui nasce Esse, la lampada che sfida il lockdown. Cos'è EsseEsse è una lampada da tavolo in cemento progettata per poter essere realizzata anche in periodi come questo, caratterizzati da scarsità di attrezzature e forniture, in cui le uniche risorse disponibili sono il “saper fare” e il design. In questo senso la lampada si fa testimone di una resistenza possibile del mondo del design e dell’artigianato allo stravolgimento globale a cui stiamo assistendo.La consapevolezza delle limitazioni ne ha disegnato il suo aspetto monolitico; la sua forma e le sue linee essenziali sono frutto dell’impossibilità di fare stampi complessi lavorando dentro casa,  mentre l’asola laterale nasce per consentire il montaggio dei cablaggi elettrici anche senza attrezzature.Il know-how maturato in questi anni sulla lavorazione artigianale del cemento ha donato alla lampada Esse il colore e il rigore. I colori scelti - grigio, rosso e giallo - sono primari come le modalità di luce che la lampada può garantire, diretta e schermata, grazie alla sua forma a mezzo cilindro. Un aiuto concreto alla lotta al COVID-19Esse è inoltre un contributo concreto contro la pandemia, poiché metà del ricavato delle vendite sarà donato per dare un aiuto a tutti i Paesi colpiti dal virus.Per permettere a più persone possibile di partecipare alla donazione, si è anche scelto di dare le lampade al prezzo simbolico di 35 € (a cui si sommano i 35€ della donazione) anziché 128€. Come useremo i soldi raccoltiPer ogni pezzo venduto doneremo 35€ alla Fondazione Lang Europe Onlus a sostegno del fondo COVID-19 Solidarity Response Fund dell'Organizzazione Mondiale della Sanità. Le donazioni sosterranno il lavoro dell'OMS e dei suoi partner, per tracciare e comprendere la diffusione del virus, assicurare ai pazienti le cure di cui hanno bisogno e garantire a chi lavora in prima linea le attrezzature e le informazioni essenziali necessarie, accelerare la ricerca e lo sviluppo delvaccino e dei trattamenti. Parte delle donazioni andrà inoltre a supporto dei partner del Fondo: all'UNICEF per il suo lavoro di lotta la COVID-19 nelle comunità più vulnerabili e al CEPI per lo sviluppo del vaccino.https://covid19responsefund.org/I restanti 35€ verranno utilizzati per la gestione della campagna, la realizzazione degli stampi e l'acquisto dei materiali. Specifiche tecniche
Materiale: cemento
Colori disponibili: grigio, rosso, giallo
Dimensioni: 12 x 9 x 16 cm 
Peso: 1,3 kg 
Uso: solo per uso interno
Lunghezza del cavo: 180 cm 
Lampadina (non inclusa): E14 MAX 10W LED
 Chi è Plato DesignSiamo Alessandro Mattei e Caterina Naglieri due designer con una formazione in architettura, che ci ha portati per anni in giro per il mondo in alcuni studi internazionali di progettazione. Nel 2016 decidiamo di mollare tutto per tornare nella nostra città, Roma, e ripartire da zero con un progetto tutto nostro e una startup che, grazie a un crowdfunding, ci ha permesso di realizzare il nostro primo prodotto, la lampada D-Twelve.Nasce così Plato Design, un laboratorio in cui realizziamo lampade e oggetti per la casa interamente fatti a mano in Italia. Tra i nostri materiali preferiti c'è il cemento; in pochi anni dalla nostra casa-laboratorio siamo riusciti a sviluppare una piccola industria creativa che esporta in tutto il mondo.Adesso il lockdown dovuto al virus ci ha riportati a quei giorni di 4 anni fa, a quando chiusi fra le pareti della nostra casa lasciavamo correre la mente per dare forma alle nostre idee.Progettare per noi significa proprio questo: non smettere mai di guardare al domani. http://www.platodesign.it/Progetto in collaborazione con Sign Press di Isabella Clara Sciacca https://www.signpress.it/ RingraziamentiL’intero progetto della lampada Esse e la campagna di crowdfunding sono stati realizzati durante il lockdown tra Marzo e Aprile 2020. Per questo abbiamo girato il video e scattato le foto senza i nostri collaboratori, che vogliamo comunque ringraziare perché ci hanno dato consigli e spiegazioni a distanza: grazie Luca Ferrante per l'aiuto con le foto https://www.lucaferrantefotografo.it/, grazie Alessandro Roberti di Cliche Video per la supervisione sul video https://www.clichevideo.com/ e grazie David White per le traduzioni e i sottotitoli https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1470733/. Grazie anche Luca Longobardi (Luca sei fico!) https://soundcloud.com/luca-longobardi

story:
About 

The Motleys are:

  • A collection of decorative wooden characters.
  • Instantly recognisable cultural figures from around the world.
  • Magnetically connected parts for maximum fun.
  • Playful and interactive.
  • Decorative and cultural.
  • Solid wood for durability and sustainability.

Playfully showcasing different cultures and lifestyles from around the world, the motleys will bring a little bit of fun into your home or work-space.

 

What We Need & What You Get

How

It all started when mama Motley & daddy Motley loved each other very much …

…

No… that didn't happen, it was a bit more technical than that! :)

It all started when we thought it would be really cool to make cultural characters as playful decorative ornaments.

So we picked a number of recognisable characters and started experimenting, each character has a similar shaped head and body, but their individuality is emphasised in their hats, body colour and little accessories.

Also, super strong magnets are glued into each part, allowing them to stick together really easily, and it also makes them super fun to play with. Don't worry, you will never see any of the magnets as we have magically hidden them in the wooden pieces.

 

Materials / Materiales

The concept of The Motleys is to create beautiful little characters that will be enjoyed and admired. So we have selected the highest quality and most appropriate materials to make sure each Motley will remain as a playful decorative ornament for many generations.

The Motleys are made from:

  • Solid hardwood.
  • Magnets.
  • Natural wood dyes.
  • Natural oil finish.
  • Brass.
  • Leather. 

The Impact

Long-lasting design

The motley's have been designed to be simple and robust in their appearance and their construction, this ensures that they will have an extended life cycle that justifies the natural resources required to produce them. And when the Motleys are old and grey after many many years or decades, they can be recycled safely and easily back in the ecosystem.

Sustainable materials

As the main ingredient of The Motleys is yummy renewable and recyclable hardwood. We are going one step further and ensuring that it will be sourced from certified and managed forests with FSC certification.

Sustainable fulfilment and distribution

The packaging that will be needed to get your rewards to you, will be carefully considered to ensure the minimum material is used to maximum effect, reducing package weight to optimise deliveries and reduce environmental impact.

Where possible only packaging from recycled and or renewable sources will be used in the fulfilment of your reward. In addition, we will endeavour to minimise the use of any non-recyclable plastics anywhere in the process of creating The Motleys.

Something else

In addition to all of this, we are partnering with Tree-Nation, an organisation with a mission to "reforest the world". We are pledging to plant a minimum of five trees for every pledge we receive, this is all to help the fight against deforestation, alleviate poverty and empower local communities in some of the most environmentally affected parts of the world.


As the Motleys are characters of honour! It is our promise to them and you, that we will not to dishonour them!
We will do our best to bring them to life with an absolutely minimum carbon footprint and where possible carbon neutral or even carbon positive.

 

The guys behind The Motleys 

We are David and Diego, we are two designers but more importantly, we are two friends who enjoy creating concepts that engage people. We really love the playful diversity of The Motleys and we hope you will do too.

 

Risks & Challenges

We have already overcome many challenges in building our campaign and developing every element of it, from establishing the goal we need to produce our first batch of Motleys to the rewards we can offer.

The risks we identify that our project might be exposed to:

  • Not achieving our goal will mean we will not have the funds to produce our first batch.
  • Delays to our schedule as a result of manufacturing problems
  • Delays to our schedule as a result of shipping problems
  • Develop the product
  • Source and develop product process with our selected manufacturers.
  • Analysed the best shipping options to achieve fast and efficient deliveries.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Once you've backed this project, we encourage you to share this page on social media platforms, such as Facebook and Instagram, and share with your friends and family or even with workmates!

Also, be sure to like The Motleys on Facebook and follow us on Instagram to get real-time updates about this project and more!

story:
Buy it on Amazon 

Amazon US : https://www.amazon.com/dp/B076WKVGP7

Amazon UK: https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B075J824H5

Amazon DE：https://www.amazon.de/dp/B075J824H5

Meet Alex

Why did we design Alex?

Why did we design Alex?We got tired of having to disconnect and re-connect the Echo Dot cable every time we moved from place to place. With all the convenience that Amazon Alexa gives our day-to-day life, why not stay connected for longer? Hence, the Alex, by Kiwi Design.

 

With Alex, you could take your Amazon Alexa anywhere! Experience room-to-room listening on the go.

 

Alex and Alexa are true companions

with Alex’s built in battery and cordless design, you can take them anywhere together!

The battery capacity for Alex is 10000mA/h, which provides 24 hours of standby battery life on-the-go and up to 12 hours of continuous play-time, per charge. The Alex is charged up for the long run.

 

Protect your Echo Dot 

Alex comes with a docking tray to make Echo Dot safe.

Take Alexa anywhere

Alex's built-in battery gives you cordless freedom and you can take Alexa from anywhere in your home.

Technical Specifications

General

  • Specially designed for the 2nd generation Amazon Echo Dot
  • Multiple layers of safety protection
  • Available in black or white color
  • Echo Dot docking tray
  • Power Button
  • Up to hours of continuous play time
  • Full charge in less than 8 hours
  • Micros USB connector and cable included
  • Weight: 0.8 lb

Electronics

  • Capacity: Rechargeable 10000mAh Lithium battery
  • High performance power management IC
  • Input: 5.2V  1.8A
  • Output: 5.2V  1.8A
  • Single-color led

Dimensions

  • Height 73mm (2.8In)
  • Diameter 83mm (3.2In)

How to use

  • Simply place your Echo Dot onto the top of Alex.
  • Make sure the Alex and Echo Dot align with each other
  • Plug in connector, press the power button and you’re charged up, ready to go!

     

 

Design Process

After months of exploration and research into the Echo Dot and other batteries, we designed the best solution on the market. We filed a patent in March 2017. Our superior design combines a high capacity batter for longer play time with absolute protection and sturdiness.

 

Testing and Manufacturing

After months of rigorous testing and retesting, we built the highest quality charging station available on the market. It’s beautifully designed and exceptionally easy to use. We hope you are as delighted with Alex as we are. 

Perks

PU Leather Cover

Customized Dress for your Echo dot (2nd generation). Premium synthetic leather with soft non-scratch microfiber interior. Provides protection for the body against scratches, greasy dirt and abrasions. Easy to install and secure cut-outs allow access to all ports and buttons.

Wall Mount Holder

Specially designed for Amazon Echo Dot (2nd Generation)..Easy to install! Anti-slip hook clip is designed to safely and securely lock your Echo Dot. Precise holes at the bottom for omni- directional sound. Designed for a precise fit around your device. Comes with two screws and two setscrews, you can mount your Echo Dot 2nd Generation on the wall for convenience.

Alex Pack

Specially designed for Echo Dot 2nd generation and Alex.

  •  Unique Design –Travel with Alexa with the Alex Pack. 
  • High Quality -- Made of durable oxford fabric, tough,  anti-scratch technology. Classic design for easy opening and closing.
  • Best Value -- Comes with a detachable double security screw-lock carabiner for hanging on backpack, bicycle, belt, etc.,
  •  Portable & Lightweight -- Easily fits in the palm of your hand, making it convenient to carry, and a great partner for travelling, hiking or cycling.

Other Ways You Can Help

Other Ways You Can Help

Like the Alex? Have a friend who would love this? Want to share? Just 30 seconds of your time could make the difference in growing our community. You can help us make Alex a success by sharing our posts on social media, giving us your feedback and telling your friends and family about it and our Indiegogo campaign.


The more people who know about us, the larger our community will become. Let’s do this!

Let's do this.

Timeline

Why are we crowdfunding?

We truly believe that our distinctive design and premium quality are perfect for those who want more out of their Amazon Echo Dot.

We believe in Indiegogo as a platform, where like-minded entrepreneurs and early adopters bring together innovative, disruptive and sophisticated projects to life. Indiegogo connects us with tech and design enthusiasts like you. The money would be used in stocking up with high quantity, since it would be sold on Amazon in December. 

Team

KIWI design is a brand that focus on Smart Home accessories. Our goal is to create a range of premium accessories that elevate our connected environment.

We couldn’t have created Alex without the help and support of friends and family, all of whom have encouraged us to launch our new product on Indiegogo. In particular, a big thanks to Manuel Joaquin Rodriguez Ramos, Ben Vasilescu, Ellie Webster, Ed Chambers. Finally, thanks to the kind people @Indiegogo for their unwavering support, and helping us turn our ideas into a reality.

 

Risks and challenges

As with any Indiegogo project, there are certain risks and challenges we must overcome to produce a fantastic product for you. Fortunately, our team has experience in delivering successful products. For this new project, we have spent months developing the prototype and working with our manufacturing partner to ensure that production and delivery go smoothly.

The challenges for us is that we were working with lithium-ion batteries and shipping them all around the world. Our manufacturer is extremely experienced. By partnering with experienced manufacturers and logistics experts, we are prepared for pretty much anything. And, of course, we will maintain constant communication with our contributors, no matter what.

FAQ

Please contact us via our support form: customerservice@kiwidesign.shop  or www.kiwidesign.shop We guarantee a reply within 24 hours!

Do I need an Echo Dot to use my Alex?
Yes. The Alex is an accessory designed specifically to work with the Amazon Echo Dot 2nd generation. It is not a stand-alone device and can only be used with the Dot. 

What's in the box?
Just the Alex and a welcome guide to get you going. Everything you need to connect to your Echo Dot is built-in to Alex. Since your Dot will be powered by the Alex, you can use your Echo Dot power cord as the charging cord for your Alex.

How do I pair my Dot with Alex?
Unplug your Echo Dot. Nest your Dot into the top of the Alex, then plug the micro-USB into Dot.  When you need to recharge your Alex, you can use your Amazon Echo Dot charging cable. Enjoy!

Can I charge my Alex with 3rd party charging cables? 
We highly recommend that the Alex is charged by using the Amazon Echo Dot charging cable that was provided when you purchased your Dot. We do not recommend using the 3rd party chargers, as we cannot guarantee that other chargers will work with Alex. To ensure a full charge every time, make sure to use the Amazon Echo Dot charging cable. 

Can I use my Alex outside?
Alex is not water-proof or water-resistant, so you want to make sure that if you use it outside on your patio, it is placed in a dry area.

Can my Alex be used while charging?
Absolutely! And once you are fully charged, continue to use your Alex plugged in or cord-free.

How long does it take to charge my Alex?

Charging Alex when not in use will take about 8 hours. If you are using your Alex as it is charging, it will take about 8-12 hours. When fully charged, Alex’s battery run time is at least 12 hours (play - time ), more than 12 hours if Echo Dot is just in standby mode. The LED light on the front of the Alex will indicate its current state.

Why isn't my Alex working?
Are the micro-USB connections are secure between the Dot and the Alex? Is your Alex turned on (LED light is turned on)? Is your Alex charged? Is your Alex within range of the wifi network that the Dot was linked to? If you have checked all of the above and Alex still isn’t working, please contact us.

When is Alex expected to ship?

Alex is expected to start shipping in November 2017.

How will my order be shipped?

Depending on where you are, your Alex may be shipped to you using different couriers or services. We will provide a shipping notification and tracking information for each order.

Can I take Alex on an airplane?

Yes, it can be with you in your carry-on luggage. The capacity of Alex (54Wh±5% 10000mAh±5% at 5V) falls within Federal Aviation Administration's (FAA) guidelines for air travel of 100Wh.

Why did we design Alex?
Why did we design Alex?We got tired of having to disconnect and re-connect the Echo Dot cable every time we moved from place to place. With all the convenience that Amazon Alexa gives our day-to-day life, why not stay connected for longer? Hence, the Alex, by Kiwi Design.

 
With Alex, you could take your Amazon Alexa anywhere! Experience room-to-room listening on the go.

 
Alex and Alexa are true companions
with Alex’s built in battery and cordless design, you can take them anywhere together!
The battery capacity for Alex is 10000mA/h, which provides 24 hours of standby battery life on-the-go and up to 12 hours of continuous play-time, per charge. The Alex is charged up for the long run.

 
Protect your Echo Dot 
Alex comes with a docking tray to make Echo Dot safe.

Take Alexa anywhere
Alex's built-in battery gives you cordless freedom and you can take Alexa from anywhere in your home.

Technical Specifications

General

Specially designed for the 2nd generation Amazon Echo Dot
Multiple layers of safety protection
Available in black or white color
Echo Dot docking tray
Power Button
Up to hours of continuous play time
Full charge in less than 8 hours
Micros USB connector and cable included
Weight: 0.8 lb

Electronics

Capacity: Rechargeable 10000mAh Lithium battery
High performance power management IC
Input: 5.2V  1.8A
Output: 5.2V  1.8A
Single-color led

Dimensions

Height 73mm (2.8In)
Diameter 83mm (3.2In)

How to use

Simply place your Echo Dot onto the top of Alex.
Make sure the Alex and Echo Dot align with each other
Plug in connector, press the power button and you’re charged up, ready to go!
 



 
Design Process
After months of exploration and research into the Echo Dot and other batteries, we designed the best solution on the market. We filed a patent in March 2017. Our superior design combines a high capacity batter for longer play time with absolute protection and sturdiness.





 

Testing and Manufacturing
After months of rigorous testing and retesting, we built the highest quality charging station available on the market. It’s beautifully designed and exceptionally easy to use. We hope you are as delighted with Alex as we are. 




Perks

PU Leather Cover
Customized Dress for your Echo dot (2nd generation). Premium synthetic leather with soft non-scratch microfiber interior. Provides protection for the body against scratches, greasy dirt and abrasions. Easy to install and secure cut-outs allow access to all ports and buttons.
Wall Mount Holder
Specially designed for Amazon Echo Dot (2nd Generation)..Easy to install! Anti-slip hook clip is designed to safely and securely lock your Echo Dot. Precise holes at the bottom for omni- directional sound. Designed for a precise fit around your device. Comes with two screws and two setscrews, you can mount your Echo Dot 2nd Generation on the wall for convenience.



Alex Pack
Specially designed for Echo Dot 2nd generation and Alex.

 Unique Design –Travel with Alexa with the Alex Pack. 
High Quality -- Made of durable oxford fabric, tough,  anti-scratch technology. Classic design for easy opening and closing.
Best Value -- Comes with a detachable double security screw-lock carabiner for hanging on backpack, bicycle, belt, etc.,
 Portable & Lightweight -- Easily fits in the palm of your hand, making it convenient to carry, and a great partner for travelling, hiking or cycling.


Other Ways You Can HelpOther Ways You Can HelpLike the Alex? Have a friend who would love this? Want to share? Just 30 seconds of your time could make the difference in growing our community. You can help us make Alex a success by sharing our posts on social media, giving us your feedback and telling your friends and family about it and our Indiegogo campaign.The more people who know about us, the larger our community will become. Let’s do this!Let's do this.
TimelineWhy are we crowdfunding?We truly believe that our distinctive design and premium quality are perfect for those who want more out of their Amazon Echo Dot.We believe in Indiegogo as a platform, where like-minded entrepreneurs and early adopters bring together innovative, disruptive and sophisticated projects to life. Indiegogo connects us with tech and design enthusiasts like you. The money would be used in stocking up with high quantity, since it would be sold on Amazon in December. TeamKIWI design is a brand that focus on Smart Home accessories. Our goal is to create a range of premium accessories that elevate our connected environment.We couldn’t have created Alex without the help and support of friends and family, all of whom have encouraged us to launch our new product on Indiegogo. In particular, a big thanks to Manuel Joaquin Rodriguez Ramos, Ben Vasilescu, Ellie Webster, Ed Chambers. Finally, thanks to the kind people @Indiegogo for their unwavering support, and helping us turn our ideas into a reality. Risks and challengesAs with any Indiegogo project, there are certain risks and challenges we must overcome to produce a fantastic product for you. Fortunately, our team has experience in delivering successful products. For this new project, we have spent months developing the prototype and working with our manufacturing partner to ensure that production and delivery go smoothly.The challenges for us is that we were working with lithium-ion batteries and shipping them all around the world. Our manufacturer is extremely experienced. By partnering with experienced manufacturers and logistics experts, we are prepared for pretty much anything. And, of course, we will maintain constant communication with our contributors, no matter what.FAQPlease contact us via our support form: customerservice@kiwidesign.shop  or www.kiwidesign.shop We guarantee a reply within 24 hours!Do I need an Echo Dot to use my Alex?Yes. The Alex is an accessory designed specifically to work with the Amazon Echo Dot 2nd generation. It is not a stand-alone device and can only be used with the Dot. What's in the box?Just the Alex and a welcome guide to get you going. Everything you need to connect to your Echo Dot is built-in to Alex. Since your Dot will be powered by the Alex, you can use your Echo Dot power cord as the charging cord for your Alex.How do I pair my Dot with Alex?Unplug your Echo Dot. Nest your Dot into the top of the Alex, then plug the micro-USB into Dot.  When you need to recharge your Alex, you can use your Amazon Echo Dot charging cable. Enjoy!Can I charge my Alex with 3rd party charging cables? We highly recommend that the Alex is charged by using the Amazon Echo Dot charging cable that was provided when you purchased your Dot. We do not recommend using the 3rd party chargers, as we cannot guarantee that other chargers will work with Alex. To ensure a full charge every time, make sure to use the Amazon Echo Dot charging cable. Can I use my Alex outside?Alex is not water-proof or water-resistant, so you want to make sure that if you use it outside on your patio, it is placed in a dry area.Can my Alex be used while charging?Absolutely! And once you are fully charged, continue to use your Alex plugged in or cord-free.How long does it take to charge my Alex?Charging Alex when not in use will take about 8 hours. If you are using your Alex as it is charging, it will take about 8-12 hours. When fully charged, Alex’s battery run time is at least 12 hours (play - time ), more than 12 hours if Echo Dot is just in standby mode. The LED light on the front of the Alex will indicate its current state.Why isn't my Alex working?Are the micro-USB connections are secure between the Dot and the Alex? Is your Alex turned on (LED light is turned on)? Is your Alex charged? Is your Alex within range of the wifi network that the Dot was linked to? If you have checked all of the above and Alex still isn’t working, please contact us.When is Alex expected to ship?Alex is expected to start shipping in November 2017.How will my order be shipped?Depending on where you are, your Alex may be shipped to you using different couriers or services. We will provide a shipping notification and tracking information for each order.Can I take Alex on an airplane?Yes, it can be with you in your carry-on luggage. The capacity of Alex (54Wh±5% 10000mAh±5% at 5V) falls within Federal Aviation Administration's (FAA) guidelines for air travel of 100Wh.

story:
Welcome to my kitchen!

I'm incredibly passionate about home cooking and the kitchen is my playground.    With pen, paper, and camera in tow, I've been documenting this journey with my husband, three daughters, and hosts of friends.   In my adopted home state, Wild, Wonderful West Virginia, I'm dedicated to a simple mission:  Bringing Cooking Back.  Join the fun by helping support my 'best of' cookbook, tried and true family favorite recipes.  This book will be a tool for all cooks, with stories and tips woven throughout.  


What We Need & What You Get

My funding goal of $8,800.00 will defray the expenses of producing a book: designing, testing, and printing.
Check out these perks!
All contributors will be listed in the Acknowledgments section.  Every dollar counts! There are exciting perks for each contribution level--Colorful recipe cards, signed books, family cooking sessions, and more!
Let's get cooking, and thanks in advance!


Other Ways You Can Help

I'm truly grateful for your help in spreading the word!

story:
We are now accepting orders for our second production run of Tapps - the first batch was sold on Indiegogo, and as soon as we can ship those filters, we will get to work on Run #2.

As before, for each filter purchased we will donate one in a developing country.

To order Tapp, make a paypal money transfer to "orders@twothirdswater.com" on paypal.com. The pricing info is below.
 
filters
Tapps (all plastic): $68/unit
10 pack of Tapps: $550
shipping
Canada: $10 ($50 for a 10 pack)
US: $15 ($75 for a 10 pack)
International: $25 ($100 for a 10 pack)
 
Thank you! We look forward to getting you your order.
 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Tapp is an extremely simple and user-friendly water filter that can be used with water bottles, bags, hoses, buckets and jugs, camel-back systems, etc. It is a great fit for outdoor trekking, globe-trotting, and emergency preparedness kits.

For every Tapp sold on Indiegogo, we will donate one to someone in a developing country. Help us fund production, and get safe water to vulnerable families!

      

 

Who do you know who would just love this device? Pre-order them a Tapp and one will be donated on their behalf as well.  

Who we are

Twothirds Water is a startup company built by engineers and entrepreneurs who are passionate about using good design and effective strategies to meet the needs of vulnerable people.

  • Bradley is an engineer who has lived and/or worked in Ethiopia, Dominican Republic, Uganda, the Philippines, Haiti... Bradley has been studying water technologies and their implementation in developing countries for the past 7 years.
  • Kevin is an artist and designer who has a 3D printer and a CNC mill in his living room. In his spare time he's polishing off a PhD in chemical engineering. Nuff said.
  • Deanna is a PR / marketing guru and entrepreneurial spirit. She has an amazing ability to take Bradley and Kevin's wild ideas, and say "sure, we can make that happen." And she does.

But we can't do it without you! Please help us fund the tooling costs so we can manufacture Tapp at volume.

What we've made

Over the past few years we have conducted an iterative design process – building a water filter, interviewing dozens of potential users to learn how to improve it, and going back home to build a new one. The culmination, Tapp, is tremendously exciting. We have protected it with several patents, and formed Twothirds Water to take it to market.  

Even if you never encounter the extreme circumstances Tapp was designed for, its simplicity and versatility make it a fantastic filter for wherever you might find yourself, whether you’re an international traveller, a back-country hiker, or just want to be ready for emergencies.

How it works

Just pass water through the filter. It is really that simple.

Tapp connects to threaded containers or 1/4" hose. You can let the water flow through by gravity (siphon), or pressurize it any way you like (e.g. squeezing a bottle or bag). You can drink through it like a straw, or put it in-line with your Camelbak. Regardless, the water will come out clean and ready to drink!

Tapp's top segment can rotate to three positions:

  • open - Water flows through
  • closed - Water stops flowing
  • clean - Depending on your sourcewater, the filter may eventually begin to clog, which slows the flow of water. No problem! In this position you can give the top segment of the filter a single pump up and down, and dirt is flushed away. We're proud of this invention - and we've patented it rigorously.

Technical information

Tapp uses a special membrane that was developed for kidney dialysis machines. Called a "hollow fiber microfilter," this membrane has tiny pores that are small enough to catch bacteria and parasites, while letting the water flow through. Of course it catches dirt particles too. The membrane does not remove dissolved chemicals (like salt), so the taste of the water does not change. Microfiltration is a well-established technology that has been tested thoroughly and repeatedly, and is used in many water treatment plants.

Effectiveness

  • turbidity (dirt): over 99% reduction
  • parasites: over 99.9% reduction
  • bacteria: over 99.99% reduction

Hikers and campers familiar with Beaver Fever (giardiasis) and its effect on... lets say regularity, will be pleased to know that this is a large protozoan (a type of germ) that is particularly easy to filter out.

Lifetime

Tapp is designed to be used on a daily basis for a year. If you use your Tapp intermittently, as we trekkers and travellers do, we recommend you use it for up to 3 years.

Making it happen

We need your help! The money raised on Indiegogo will fund the manufacturing equipment so we can set up production of Tapp.

We have assembled a solid team with the skill-sets we need to bring Tapp to your door. We have already field-tested many rounds of prototypes from our Ultimaker 3D printer, and a fantastic design company is helping us to polish our engineering drawings for volume production.

Our focus on simple design really reduces the challenges of the production process. We know we'll encounter unforeseen challenges, but with our engineering team and Form3's experienced guidance we are confident we can work through whatever arises. We know it is achievable - it is a matter of putting in the hard work to make it happen.

We are setting up production near our home city of Vancouver so we can be close by to help sort through any challenges.

 

Questions?

Ask us in the "Comments" section, and we'll reply to you there.

 

Help us spread the word! Please cut and paste this link to our video to Twitter and Facebook, and email people who may be interested :) bit.ly/tappvideo

****

Mianwali MOV Campaign has ended! Imran Khan is contesting from 3 more areas, gift MOV for his Lahore, Peshawar and Pindi areas at http://igg.me/at/khanmovs

*****



Short Summary

General Elections of 2013 in Pakistan will be historic. Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf is popular all around the country but can use more help in the rural areas. The Multimedia Outreach Vans project was initiated to spread the PTI message in selected constituencies.


This campaign is to gift Imran Khan a MOV in his constituency in Mianwali. You can be part of something very historic as your name will be associated with the Van that will be used for Campaigning in Imran Khan's constituency. You can take part in this very special campaign by funding through Indiegogo so your contribution is tracked and we can put your name in the Multimedia Outreach Van gifted to Imran Khan.

story:
In this picture, the Jamaican construction crew that we assist to build this home is in the foreground of the picture and the Project J7 Mission Team      are on the porch of the home.


The Opportunity To Change:

How many of us will have the opportunity to influence or change the course of another individual’s life journey, of one of our sisters and brothers in need living in another country and then actually see the results? 

For many of us, probably never or maybe once in a lifetime, if we are lucky.

Since 2006, when the first Project J Mission Trip went to Jamaica to be of service to our sisters and brothers in need in the Diocese of Mandeville, in the interior of Jamaica, that opportunity to change or influence the life of another human being as been presented to those who went on one of these mission trips. And as the years have passed we have had the opportunity to see how that influence or change has made such a huge difference in their life journey. That has been the hidden result and treasure of our Project J Mission Trips.

I am sure that many of us did not even think of our participation in a particular Project J Mission Trip as an opportunity to be a direct agent of influence or change in the life of a fellow human being.


Results of our previous 7 Mission Trips:

Since 2006, the 70 individuals, women, men, and young adults from St. Peter's Columbus Club, St. Peter Council 7070 - Knights of Columbus,  St. Theresa's Parish and other individuald, have taken the opportunity to be an agent of change in the life of another through their participation in Project 1 - 7 Mission Trips to the Mandeville area of Jamaica.

So of the things that we have done to assist our sisters and brothers in the Mandeville area of Jamaica through our Project 1 - 7 Mission Trips are:

  • Have built 10 simple homes for families  identified by the Diocese of Mandeville as needing this kind of support.
  • Delivered over 7,000 lbs of gently used adult, children, baby clothing, underwear and all kinds of footwear. No winter clothing left!
  • Delivered over 140 pieces of gently used luggage that Jamaicans use to keep their clothing clean and in order.
  • Delivered uncountable numbers of tubes of toothpaste, toothbrushes, bars of soap, personal grooming items, combs, brushes and other items.
  • Also delivered uncountable numbers of pencils, pens, paper, workbooks and erasers to numerous schools in this area of Jamaica.
  • Contributed over $30,000.00 to the economy of Jamaica in Room & Board fees when on our 7 previous Mission Trips.
  • Contributed uncountable dollars to the economy of Jamaica by purchasing food and other liquid refreshments when teams are on these Mission Trips.
  • Mission Trip members have made unknown amounts of Project J and individual donations to support a number of individuals in the Mandeville area of Jamaica, as identified to be in special need of our support, and to the Seniors Center,  Bosco Home for Boys and a children's orphanage and parishes where they attended Sunday celebrations.


The Impact - 4 more homes built:

The success of this Indiegogo fund raising campaign will result in the Project J8 Mission Team having the construction materials onsite, when we arrive in mid-February, 2016 for our 2 week Mission Trip, to build 4 simple homes for individuals or families, as designated by local housing authorities from the Diocese of Mandeville as being in need of one of these simple homes.

The cost of construction materials for one of these simple homes is approximately $4,000 - $4,500 (USD). All of the construction materials used in the building of one of these simple home are imported from the United States. Some considerable lead time is then required to have these construction material onsite for use by the Project J7 Mission Team in mid-February, 2016.

Other impacts resulting from our Project J8 Mission Trip will be: another 1,000 lbs of donated women's, men's, children's and baby's clothing will be delivered along with another 20 suitcases to be used for storage of clean clothing. Team members will reconnect with some special Jamaicans that all Project J Teams have visited alone with visits to Bosco Homes, Compassion House and a number of local schools where we will leave donated supplies and financial donations to support their good works. Most importantly we will have the opportunity to meet and interact with many wonder Jamaicans who are our sisters and brothers.


    Risks & Challenges.

    As Project J8 will be our eigth Mission Trip to the Mandeville area of Jamaica we anticipate few risks and challenges on this Mission Trip. A number of members of 10 member Project J8 Mission Team are repeat members and that will add to our ability to deal with any risks and challenges that may arise.

    We are also in the capable hands of an experienced crew of individuals from the Diocese of Mandeville who have a great deal of experience in dealing with Mission Trips such as yours.


    Project J Team Members Pay Their Own Way.

    It is important for donors to this campaign to know that NO donated funds will be used to fund any aspect of the Project J8 Mission Trip other than to pay for construction materials to build our 4 simple homes.
    Project J Mission Team members have always paid any costs associated with their own Mission Trip, with the exception of airfare for the 10 members of the Mission Team that is covered by a generous donation from St. Peter's Columbus Club in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada.

 As Project J8 will be our eigth Mission Trip to the Mandeville area of Jamaica we anticipate few risks and challenges on this Mission Trip. A number of members of 10 member Project J8 Mission Team are repeat members and that will add to our ability to deal with any risks and challenges that may arise.
We are also in the capable hands of an experienced crew of individuals from the Diocese of Mandeville who have a great deal of experience in dealing with Mission Trips such as yours.

Project J Team Members Pay Their Own Way.
It is important for donors to this campaign to know that NO donated funds will be used to fund any aspect of the Project J8 Mission Trip other than to pay for construction materials to build our 4 simple homes.
Project J Mission Team members have always paid any costs associated with their own Mission Trip, with the exception of airfare for the 10 members of the Mission Team that is covered by a generous donation from St. Peter's Columbus Club in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada.

story:
Our name, Eques, originated from the Greek word Aegis: it means protection. Since 2016, when we established our home base in the heart of Silicon Valley, our mission has been to protect what is dearest to you. 

Over the last year we have been developing and perfecting the VEIU Smart Doorbell. After many iterations and testing we are happy to say that the only thing standing in the way of you making your home smarter and safer is your support of this project. 

 

 

 

 

The Eques App puts your front door at your fingertips no matter where you are. Since VEIU runs off your home's Wi-Fi, you have a secure connection from your smartphone to your VEIU anywhere with a network connection.

Many smart home products require expensive monthly subscriptions that can run you hundreds of dollars a year. With VEIU there are no monthly cloud storage fees, your only expense is the hardware. The Eques App is available as a free download from both Google Play and the Apple App Store

 

 

 

 

30 seconds of your time can make all the difference in bringing VEIU to life. Take a second and hit one of the links below to share this project with your friends. Who knows, they might be thanking you later...

 

 

 

 

 

Motion Sensor - VEIU automatically detects motion and can be set to take a snapshot, send an alert to your phone, or start recording video when motion is detected.

Child & Senior Friendly - The VEIU Doorbell is completely functional even without the smart phone app. The 5" LCD touch screen display is easy to set up, read, and displays the same video your app would. The display also allows you to save and share video clips. 

Wi-Fi Connectivity - VEIU uses your home Wi-Fi connection to stream video to your device making the connection safe and secure. This also allows you to access multiple cameras at once. 

Rechargeable Battery - The rechargeable battery saves you time and money by eliminating the hassle of replacing batteries every time they die.

Long Battery Life - A fully charged battery can last up to two months in standby mode giving you piece of mind that your VEIU will be ready when someone pays you an expected or unexpected visit. 

Wide Angle Lens - The lens on the VEIU gives you a 180 degree view of your porch, making sure you wont miss any visitors. 

No Subscriptions - Other smart home products require expensive monthly and yearly subscriptions. Not VEIU. Our app is completely free and available for both Apple and Android devices. 

VEIU is compatible with any door (35-110mm thick) and installation is super simple.  All it takes is a screw driver and five minutes of your time. 

Each VEIU comes with a simple 12 step guide to help you install the smart doorbell quickly and without professional help.  

 

Will there be other color options of VEIU?

Yes, we offer 2 color options for the exterior doorbell, COPPER or NICKEL colored. Please let us know your color option when you place the order.

 

What are the dimensions of the VEIU doorbell?

The package dimensions are 9.95 × 7.17 × 2.96 inches (25.2 x 18.2 x 7.5cm). The product weighs approximately 2.5 lbs (1.15kg).

Do I need a Wi-Fi connection to set up my VEIU?

The VEIU Doorbell can be used with or without WiFi connection.  To maximize VEIU's benefits, use a wireless internet connection to enable its smart features, including the ability to send live video and audio straight to your smartphone. VEIU is compatible with wireless routers running on 2.4 GHz.

Does VEIU require direct power lines to function?

No. VEIU operates wirelessly using its built-in battery. The battery lasts an average of 2 months after each complete charge. 

Do I need to have an existing peep hole for VEIU to work on my door?

No. If your door does not have a peephole, don’t worry at all.  Feel free to request a free drill bit to safely drill a hole in your door.  Drill bits will be available at the end of our campaign.  We will be sure to send it along with your backed product. 

How long does it take the for the battery to fully charge?

It takes about 4 to 5 hours for VEIU to fully charge. To preserve your battery’s life, we recommend recharging the device when the battery drops to 25%.

Do I need to remove the indoor panel to charge it? 

The indoor panel can be easily removed from the door mount for charging. In addition, we also provide a 10 foot (3 meters) charging cable for those who may find it more convenient to plug your product into a nearby outlet. Alternatively, you may use a power bank to charge your device.

Will VEIU notify me when it is time to charge the system?

Yes.  The VEIU app features a low-battery warning and a battery level indicator on the indoor touch screen that you can check anytime.

Are there any additional fees?

No. For standard services, VEIU devices operate without any monthly fees.  The free cloud based storage will allow you to save up to 15 day’s worth of videos or images.

What if someone steals my VIEU Doorbell?

The VEIU Doorbell is equipped with proprietary security screws that keep the device securely mounted, which makes it difficult to take.  However, if your VEIU does get stolen, the outdoor camera will not function without the indoor panel, so it’d be useless for the thief.  If this happens, please contact us with a police report, and we’ll be happy to replace your device for free.

Where can I download the app?

Download our free VEIU App from App Store or Google Play Store -- both under our company name, EQUES. Please note that this App is also compatible with other Eques smart devices. When you install VEIU, make sure that you select the VEIU device option. 

What happens if my Wi-Fi goes out?

If you lose wireless internet connection, VEIU will not be able to send audio and video data to your smart devices.  However, your device can continue to operate with saved data in its local storage.  The 2GB local storage is included in the product and can save up to 20,000 images.

Do I have to replace my existing doorbell?

Replacing your old doorbell is not required. VEIU PIR (Passive Infra-Red) Sensor operates without needing to press your traditional doorbell button. You can still check the live video and chat with your visitors through VEIU App on your smart devices. 

My front door is glass. Will I be able to install VEIU?

We do not recommend that you mount it on glass.  VIEU works with door thicknesses ranging from 35 mm to 110 mm.

SHIPPING: When will I receive my VEIU?

We’re aiming for July 2017.

SHIPPING: How will my product be shipped? Will there be tracking numbers?

DOMESTIC: US orders will ship from our Los Angeles center using ground service (USPS priority, FedEx, or UPS -- depending on destination and shipment size).  Tracking information will be provided.

INTERNATIONAL: Non-US orders will ship from one of our 3 international warehouses located in London, Hong Kong, and Toronto. To save money for our backers, we will import all of our products to the aforementioned countries before shipping them to you.  This means that your shipments… 1. Won't require taxes or fees in Canada, EU and HK (other countries may have applicable fees/taxes; please check with your customs office for specific details). 2. Will arrive more quickly rather than being held up in customs. 3. May have tracking, though not guaranteed (depending on the particular post service). For EU and Asian backers, Royal Mail International or Hong Kong Post will most likely be used. Note that we cannot alter the value of your rewards on customs declarations -- the value will be declared as the total value of the items contained in the shipment.

What is your return policy?  

Unfortunately, we don’t offer refunds or returns on items received as Kickstarter rewards.  The support from our Kickstarter backers enables us to run and grow our business, gather customer feedback, design new products, and improve existing ones.  In our Kickstarter community, the items that you receive after making a pledge are referred to as "rewards" because they are not traditional purchases.  Instead, they are gifts - in our case, camera products - that are sent to our supporters as a token of our appreciation.  In the same way that public television funds their service through their supporters’ pledges and how supporters receive gifts, we have chosen to run and grow our business with a crowdfunded business model. We sincerely thank our backers for helping Eques move forward in this journey.

story:
​

The Coolest Coffee Table morphs utility and comfort with cutting edge features:

 

You deserve state-of-the-art furniture that takes relaxation to a whole new level.

Everything you need to watch the big game, cozy-in for movie night, or just kick back and relax is perfectly integrated into a table that fits any vibe or decor.

There is one warning; Your friends will become so envious of your new relaxation centerpiece, they will want to spend more time at your place… they will NEVER want to leave! 

That’s because the Coolest Coffee Table is a coffee table, a work station, an entertainment center,  drink cooler, a storage center… and more! 

Neutral color schemes match perfectly no matter the theme or décor of your living space. No matter what team you root for, or how expansive your collectibles collection, the Coolest Coffee table is your perfect fit. 

Sturdy, long-lasting, with the reliability that only comes from the top of the line components.

Perfect for small spaces. The Coolest Coffee Table works in a studio suite, a dorm room, a mobile home, and more.

Lose the wrenches and screwdrivers. The Coolest Coffee Table is ready to go to work in seconds.

Two safe and secure AC power sockets and twin USB ports allow for quick and easy charging for multiple devices.  

Power up your laptop, phone, or game console, and then secure all the cords and cables in one of the hidden storage bins.

Your computer, tablet, remotes, controllers, snacks, or whatever else you need come right to you. 

When you pop-up the mini table, you reveal a hidden storage compartment! Lots of room that’s perfect for a blanket for snuggling on cooler nights, or to stash extra treats.

Connect your TV, gaming console, computer, or phone to out of sight - but never out of range - speakers!

The Coolest Coffee Table puts the controls in your hands. Boost the volume to the max or flip channels with ease.

The Coolest Coffee Table features a Volume & Device Control Station.

 What is your way to relax: watching videos, gaming, or just listening to your favorite tunes? 

The Coolest Coffee Table puts the controls in your hands. Boost the volume to the max or flip channels with ease.  

Pop open a cold can of your choice of beverage. No running to the kitchen. Just open the fridge compartment of the Coolest Coffee Table to reveal your private stash.

There’s one for you and one for a friend…or maybe the second one is all yours.

Coolest Coffee table comes with ample storage space for snacks, magazines, books, game consoles, and anything else you need.

The Coolest Coffee Table fits and looks great in any living spaces. Make the most of every minute of your relaxation time with the Coolest Coffee Table.

Functional design and professional craftsmanship that fits the budget and the room…   

 

Nathan Resnick is the CEO of Sourcify, the fastest growing sourcing platform backed by YCombinator that helps hundreds of companies manufacture products around the world. 

In the past, Nathan has brought dozens of products to market, ran three ecommerce companies (sold one), and been a part of projects on Kickstarter like Original Grain and Lume Cube raising over seven figures. He writes for media outlets like Entrepreneur, The Next Web, Business.com, and more. Nathan also used to live in China and speaks Mandarin fluently.  When he’s not in a factory or selling software, he can be found mountain biking, sailing, skiing, fishing, or hiking!

 

 This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.
